reviews.review: Great for the sunset . Great place to see the sunset and then watch Cape Town light up! Bring dinner and relax. Get there early!

Don't miss it. Begins with a lovely scenic drive to the top. ( Road is opposite the road to Table Mountain) Plenty of lay-bys to stop and take in the views of Table Mountain and Cape Town City .Coffee kiosk situated halfway up where you sit and stare in amazement.360 degree views once you reach the top that rival Table Mountain and it's all FREE!Take a picnic and enjoy the wonderful sunsets

Good views . Good views from the top. The Canon fire happens at 12 noon sharp. Lack of information available is an issue for tourists. Be sure to check with locals to be at the point from where the Canon is fired.

Beautiful view of Table Mountain!. Take the taxi up to Signal Mountain and then walk around at the top. The taxi driver agrees on a price that includes driving you down again and gives you as much time as you need to explore.

Awesome place to test that new camera. Views, views and more views, and all for free. My only advice here is to avoid public holidays or Sundays as it gets crowded, and to be careful when crossing the traffic if you are approaching from the Capetown CBD as the turnoff is awkward with traffic coming up a semi-blind rise. If you enjoy walking, there are many footpaths leading from here. As always, never leave anything interesting looking in your vehicle.

On a non windy day, best views.. Driving up to Signal hill is already a lovely experience. The indigenous fynbos grows along the road and this biome is endemic to South Africa and has spectacular flowers.Halfway up, you can pull over and have an awesome view over Cape Town city and off course, the one and only Table mountain. At the top of the hill, you can have a picnic under a tree, or walk around to see the fynbos close up. From here you can see Table bay, Robben island and spectacular sunsets.Paragliding is also done from Signal hill. For a tandem glide with video and photos included cost R1400 Oct 2016. You end the glide at Seapoint on the beach.

Slow sunday afternoon. If you want to have a slow relaxing sunday afternoon take a drive or open top bus up signal hill. You can enjoy the uninterupted views of the ocean. It is a relaxing way of spending time with family and friends. An added benefit is you could watch the paragliders take off or join in this adrenaline inducing sport.

Great Views. I visited this site and was not surprised to find no parking. The problem I had was the people playing loud music and consuming alcohol. But putting that aside knowing it is a popular spot. We were able to get fantastic photos. New was the young man selling coffee from the back of his van. A must visit while I'm Cape Town. Just not at night by yourself I don't think it is very safe.

watch the sun rise. For sunrise and sunset ,this is a great spot to be. Be warned , it gets busy with everyone parking and trying to get the ideal photo. Take a thermal flask of coffee for the early morning cooler day start. Stop at the bottom of the hill to have a look at the old cannons that were used in the past
Great hiking spot.. Beautiful and stunning views while jogging or taking a stroll up the hill. Get to meet many people visiting this attraction. xxx

Perfect morning jog. It sounds like lots of folks drive up the hill for the view, but I really have to recommend jogging the trail for and incredible run vista. There wasn't a single person out running and there were stunning views on all sides. Would have liked to return to hear the cannons or for a scenic picnic. Trailhead is a little difficult to find (starts directly opposite from Lion's Head) but absolutely recommend.
Great view . This is just a hill you can drive up . It's on the way to table mountain . Great views for photos . Small parking lot at the top of the hill . Nothing to do up their but look .

Beautiful views. It's an easy drive up to signal point and well worth the visit as the views are as good as from table mountain and it was fairly quiet at the top also. Good for a walk around the summit and the compulsory 100 photos...

Signal Hill, Cape Town. Signal Hill is on the way to a table Mtn. It provides wonderful views of the mountain and Cape Town. You can see Robben Is. in the water. This is where Nelson Mandela was held prisoner.
Evocative!. Great views and they do fire the cannons; although we never heard them. Go paragliding for the ultimate thrill!

Good accessible views. I took a drive up Signal Hill to take some photos of a car I was reviewing against the backdrop of Table Mountain and the city below. The views did not disappoint and other than the main car park at the top of the hill, there were a number of pull in spots on the way up.

Worth a quick trip. Signal Hill is a small hill overlooking Cape Town and Sea Point. Its a small hill, but you can drive up it. I guess thats why it is popular. Table Mountain is over 1000m elevation, Signal Hill is probably about 300m so its a poor facsimile. But you can drive up there (parking may be a problem) have a look at the view, and then drive down again.Dont go there late evening or at night, it is a popular mugging spot!
Stunning views. Signal Hill is easily accessible by car and gives stunning views of the harbour, city centre, Robben Island and Table Mountain

One of the best views in the world. This is one of the best scenic and beautiful spots in the world, only perhaps matched by a view of San Francisco from the Sosalito side, hugely romantic...especially in the evenings. It offers you the opportunity to stop and view from different levels of the ascent.

A piece of heaven in the city. This place has spectacular scenes, you can drive up and experience Cape town as well as its beautiful mountains for free. Come early in the morning and bring your jacket as it can get quite windy up there. There are ablution blocks available and although they are very neat and well kept, they are of the longdrop kind... There are some nice hiking trails that you can take on if you like to hike, just bring enough water, sunscreen and a hat if you'd like to do that.

Wonderful Views. Signal Hill is a must do whilst in Cape Town. Not only do you get fabulous views over the city and the coast but you also get a wonderful view of Table Mountain. We were there quite early so parking wasn't a problem and we were greeted by a friendly Guinea Fowl wandering around.There are nice picnic areas and don't forget to take a walk up to the top of the hill to really get the impressive views.

Nice Views. We did this trip on the bus as Table Mountain was shut. We travelled on a bus but it was quite a difficult trip as this location is very popular with the locals and there is not enough parking so drivers park on the hill near the top. The views were excellent and location easy to walk round.

What a view....a must in Cape Town. If you don't make it up to Lions Head which is the best of the spots to view over Cape Town at least make it up to Signal hill... you can watch over Sea Point and the beaches and enjoy just a great view...the best still remains Lions head though :-)

Run, don't jump!. We visited Signal Hill out of curiosity, as we'd seen paragliders around there a few days beforehand.Luckily, they were able to fit us in there and then, so we ran off the hill and soared above the city. A truly spectacular and unique way to view such a beautiful place.

Organised chaos?. Signal Hill is immediately adjacent to Table Mountain, and from afar is rounded with a few tall trees. It is a favourite place with the locals , especially at the weekend, to picnic and view the sunset. Parking is VERY limited, so a lot of drivers park at the edge of the hillside, alongside the sheer drop, and walk the rest of the way. This means that the narrow road, which can just about take two coaches coming in opposite direction on a good day, totally struggle when there is parking all along one side. So we whizz up the hill in the coach, see the sun beginning to come down, then come to a halt. Stalemate! We completed the journey on foot, and the jam took some considerable time to sort out.The views were fantastic, and the sunset whilst not the best ever that evening, was worth the trip.Tip: Sunday evening is manic. Go early with a picnic. Chill. Wait for the mad rush to go back down to the city, or maybe use the hop on hop off bus service, so you don't even have to worry about parking.
Gorgeous Views. The views alone are not to be missed. We loved watching the paragliders take off. I loved the comical guinea hens that were all over the place. A fabulous place for pictures

Very busy at Sunset!. Well worth visiting for the views of Table Mountain but be aware that if you drive up before Sunset your journey back down will be a nightmare as you encounter cars trying to go up the hill while you go down; this is because people illegally park on the narrow road making it very difficult for cars to pass each other, particularly due to the deep drainage channel on one side!

Amazing place to watch the sunset!. We love to drive out to the top of Signal Hill about an hour before sundown. It is one our of favorite places in the world to watch the sun set down into the ocean as the colors beautifully reflect off of Table Mountain behind you!
beautiful. the view was beautiful beyond words. you have to see it for yourself. We got to see the view of the whole of cape Town and we had a romantic moment as we watched the sun set.
Red bus tour sunset tour.. This was included in a two day ticket. The sunset was not that fantastic but still worth it. The view was awesome and chilly so warm clothing advisable.
Great for sunset views. Great location for sunset views over the ocean and great views of Cape Town on the way up and down. Good car parking and toilets at the top.

Beautiful.... Stunning views of the City and Table Mountain from this point. We reached post lunch by our tour bus and could see crowd pulling in for sunset. There is a slope with protective net but watch your kids. Nothing else to do here.

Go & See The Sunset. Parking is a bit of a crush but well worth it to see the sun set over the sea on a clear day, I highly recommended. Take a picnic and go early. The view of Table Mountain from there is also stunning.

Walk Up Signal Hill. We decided to walk up Signal Hill from Green Point. The entrance to it starts at Upper Rhine Road off Main Drive. The start of the trail is a bit hard to find but once you get going it is well marked and maintained. The walk to the top winds along way towards Lion Head and then snaps back the other way to the top of Signal Hill. You get great views of Bantry and Camps Bay. We walked down to the small park where the noon gun goes off and and then continued down to Bo Kaap. The walk to the top takes about 90 minutes. We didn't see many people on the trail so take normal precautions but had no issues.Easy walk .. not too demanding.

Stunning view of Cape Town City and Sunsets. A must do if in Cape Town. Stunning views of the city and stunning sunset viewing spot. You can take along a blanket and picnic items to watch the sunset or buy something from one of the mobile vendors. Be early if you want to view the sunset as parking is limited and it is always busy.

Something everyone should do. Whether you're a local or a tourist - you must take a ride or a cycle or a walk up to the viewpoint on signal hill. The views are simply breathtaking. Bathrooms not great but reasonable and security could be a little more prominant but overall the 360 degree views of Cape Town, the mountains and the sea makes up for any other downfalls.

Must see place. Amazing views. Exceptional place. There are no words to describe how beautiful is this. Absolutely stunning. Do not be tempted to take or dress too much thinking that it will be cold up. While climbing up you ll sweat as cray and as less clothes u have as possible will really save you. One jacket is a must though to protect u when u re up the hill.

Amazing. Most amazing sunset views From on top of sunset hill. We had a picnic whilst admiring views From Cape Town From above. The local Guinea fowl Came to join us for our picnic which was also a great experience.

Chill in the evening sun and watch the paragliders!. Paragliders take of at the end of the road. Watching them taking off (sometimes taking of and immediately landing in the next bush) is very relaxing and entertaining at the same time. Great view overlooking the ocean and the sunset in the west and beautiful views overlooking Cape Town, Table Mountain and Lions Head southeast to southwest.

Sunset . A great place to watch the sunset or see the city lights at night. Parking and facilities are provided for, and the area feels safe. I would recommend a picnic blanket, some snacks and maybe some bubbly.

Great hiking trail. We walked up to the Signal Hill from the city via the Noon Gun Hill and went on to the Lion Head. What an enjoyable and interesting hike with great views! The Signal Hill is a perfect place to picnic. Non-hikers can come up to the main parking lot with one of the trail-heads via taxi or rental car and still enjoy the views and nature. Any able-body person should hike at least the length of the Signal Hill so called "Lion's Flank"; the views of the city and surroundings and the opportunity to see the unique flora - the endangered Peninsula Shale Renosterveld vegetation - are very,very rewarding. Signal Hill has a few kramats which are graves of Muslim missionaries and religious leaders. Some tourists and Captonians alike come here at dawn to see reportedly legendary sunrises and sunsets.At the parking lot on Signal Hill there was a park ranger from Table Mountain National Park -friendly and ready to help if needed. The parking lot also features bathrooms and what looked like little booth but the latter was closed.

Nature and Sunset Fanatics. My first hand experience of Signal Hill was so exciting. I visited with family from my hometown. It is a bit is a steep incline. Lots of indigenous and beautiful plants along the way. You can park the vehicle and walk to the top. A bit of a walk but worth the effort. Take along a picnic basket and enjoy the clean and natural surroundings. Blissful to watch the sunset, The view of Cape Town is awesome. Only to be wary of your safety at all times. And try to get back down the road before it gets very dark. Like any area , you have to be extra vigilant. Otherwise worth the trip if you have the perfect company. Don't try it alone.

Beautiful sunset views!. A perfect spot to watch the sun go down over the city. Grab some dinner for take-out, drive to Signal Hill, find a spot to sit, and watch the sunset on both sides of the peninsula. It's beautiful!
Beautiful Escape. Take a picknick basket, puton your walking shoes and go and enjoy the amazing CT views and nature. Wonderful place for the whole family

Loud - and history is alive. First time I heard the noon cannon go off I was driving along the bottom of signal hill- and it startled me. Signal hill is nice for a hike from the city. Very accessable and you have a nice view.
Great views. We came up on a beautiful sunny day. Actually it was part of the half marathon run that took place today and they ran through Signal hill.

A great view over Cape Town. The table mountain cable car was not operating when we visited so this was the alternate viewing spot. Had a good view from here and lucky because the day we went table mountain was in cloud anyway

Hill Top View. Been here many times all throughout the year and I have always been blown away by the views that this magical hill has to offer... I suggest that the odd, rainy days that it may not seem worth the drive, believe me, the views even a rainy day will bring is worth the drive!
beautiful beaches!. We went to the beach as pat of our tour, amazing white sand and beautiful views, took a lot of amazing picture

Beautiful . Beautiful views! Don't really know what else to say other then it's a bit of a drive from Cape Town and I definitely would do it if there was extra time in your day. There are a few shops and public restrooms.

NO traffic control. Absolutely astonishing and pathetic that there is no traffic control nobody can go forward nobody can go back we stuck 29 minutes already at 6.20pm on a Sunday...
Oh no Cape Town you need to up your game!!! And i am a local...

Go for the 12:00 Cannon. Signal Hill has great views, and is a wonderful spot to look around and take photos. We were there for the 12:00 firing of the gun which happens every day except Sunday and Holidays. The man who fires the cannon gives you some great information about the cannon and it's history.

Excellent views of Table Mountain. The best place to view table mountain - sunset seems a particular favorite for photographers.
Cute frame to sit in an "frame" yourself with the Lovely Table Mountain in the background.
Mr Farouk Khan . A great drive up the steep hill but when you get to the top, it's breathtaking, you can basically see the whole of Cape Town in one glance . Amazing.
Amazing vue. If you are having a full day visiting the Cape Town peninsula, stopping at signal hill is a must. It shows the beauty of the shore and the sea different tone of colours.

be there at noon time. you should go there at noon, so you can hear the canonshot at 12 o'clock.it is a tradtion for the ships that pass by so they n
know it is 12 o'clock.there is a photo area because you have a perfect view of table mountain

Wonderful sunset. Get there early a picnic basket for sunset. Lovely outing and free.
Super views of Cape Town.
Best to Uber up and down as traffic is a nightmare.
Wonderful views. We been on signal hill many times but it never fails to impress. I just wish would be brave enough to para sail from it like a number of people we watched

"GOOD PHOTO OPPORTUNITY". This is a good mountain to take photos of table mountain inside a big frame,with you in the frame and table mountain in the background.
You can also watch people paragliding off the side of the mountain.
Well worth a visit

View of the World. Outstanding views of the city and table mountain, and the ocean. The days we were there where crisp and clear and the ocean sparkled so much it took my breath away. This is a great place to people watch too. There were many, many people launching for hang gliding and micro lite flying, and that too was breath taking.
great view. To up in good weather at night or at sundown and enjoy beautiful views of the City Bowl , Table Mountain, Sea Point, and beyond. Or go up at noon and here the noon-day cannon shot!

"AWESOME". if you are in the mother city then this is a must. the views are totally awesome , I mean you can see the ocean , city , table mountain and so much more . you must take a camera for awesome pictures.
The gun is not here!. Great drive to the top with magnificent views over Cape Town. We intended to watch the 12 noon gun but got the wrong place. The gun is situated on Military Road.

Love it up here with the spectacular views. This is a great place to take tourists and show off the Mother City from above, on one side, and Robben Island and the Waterfront and beyond on the other. The picture frame with Table Mountain as the backdrop is also a great attraction. It's also a favourite, especially in summer, for locals wanting to catch the sunset over a picnic on the lawns...highly recommend it!

Great views!. We only stopped off here for a little while, following our trip on the Table Mountain cable car, but it was well worth it. The drive to Signal Hill was very scenic and, once there, we enjoyed seeing the spectacular views. There is a nice picnic area and we enjoyed watching the paragliders!
Up and Down. Great views from the top, easy parking if you go by car, crude toilets. Watching the hang gliders taking off is good fun.

Nice view of the city. It's good alternative if you do not have much time and cable to table mountain is not working. You can go by car and take great photos. There are paragliding flights starting there.
Nice.. Went there for paragliding! Perfect spot for that, didn't stay there for long though. Nice view but it's better from lion's head or table mountain.

Amazing view!. This is a great place to have a spectacular view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. The access is very easy by car because you can drive all the way up to the top, where you will find a parking.I suggest Signal Hill to everyone, families, old and young people.

Best views at Dawn. A great spot to park your car, and celebrate a new day at sunrise. The views are spectacular. Grab a coffee from vida or a petrol filling station on the way up and enjoy the best views in town at sunrise.
Hiking. Best hike in world especially the full moon night hike.stunning 360degrees capetown.a must trip.accessibke by car safe.
Easy Access. Great Place to visit, you can easily reach by car, no need to queue like Table Mountain and views are (almost) as good

Spectacular view of the city, easy access, easy walk/hike from the top. This is a great spot from which to get a spectacular view of the city and of Table Mountain. Access is easy by car -- you can drive all the way up to the top, where you'll find a parking lot. If you want to do an easy walk/hike (suitable for children and elderly people as well), there's a path leading from the parking lot along a very nice trail -- you can just walk along it as far as you like and then head back. This is a very nice outing for a nice, sunny day.

Amazing view but be wary of sunset traffic. Signal Hill offers a good view of Table Mountain and Lions Head. You can also go tandem paragliding!It's an excellent place to watch the sunset but be sure to arrive in plenty of time because parking is a nightmare. If you park on the road, make sure you park facing downhill or you'll have a nightmare to get out once everyone leaves after sunset!
Fabulous views. Great spot to actually see Sea Point, The Waterfront, Cape Town and Table MountainOn a clear day you can see really far and make the most fantastic pictures.
Viewpoint. A picturesque location which gives a great view of the Table Mountain, Lion's Head and the Atlantic Ocean. Great location for photo sessions

The most convenient and accessible place to witness a sunset in Cape Town.. Buy a bottle of wine and some plastic glasses and enjoy the sunset from Signal Hill.Do not worry about the logistics of getting up and down Table Mountain when this is equally as stunning. The cab driver will wait there for you as you watch the sun trickle over the horizon. On some days there are para gliders drifting off the cliffs.

Beautiful Views. To go to Signal hill, you need to drive all up to the top. but it’s worth the trip. We waited for the sunset at Signal Hill. It was amazing experience. We reached there at about 5:30 pm and waited.You can see the coastline of Cape town from signal hill. Finding parking can be tricky. The Red bus Sunset tour brings you to Signal Hill for the sunset at the end of the day.

Preferred this to Table Mountain. Easy drive up the hill if the queues are too big to go up table mountain. In many ways this was a preferred place as it still offered spectacular views without the crowds.

An alternate view to Table Mountain. A narrow road will take you to the top of Signal Hill, where hang-gliders and para-gliders begin their flight. There are more trails, but we didn't have time (or energy) for those after Table Mt.

Amazing view of a West Coast Sunset. . One the most beautiful places to view the sunset in Cape Town and it's free. Drive and park and then you can do a trail walk or run on the mountain before watching the sunset over the ocean . One of the most beautiful sights to behold. You can picnic or have sundowners that you brought with you .Guinea fowls wander amongst the visitors. It is really a MUST do when in Cape Town.

Drove up here for views of the city and table mountain - not disappointed.. Really worth the trip up - great if you feel like walking up too. The views are spectacular - and if it is raining, wait a bit, and it will clear up.

Paragliding . We went to signal hill for paragliding. The view of table mountain was awesome. The paragliding with Cape Town tandem paragliding company was excellent!! Definitely recommend! My 7 year old did it just fine!

Bang at noon. Close to Cape Town CBD. About a 10 minute drive from city center. Easy access via vehicle and hiking. Try to be present when they fire the canon indicate 12 noon. Great view of the city and the sea.

A beautiful day . With nothing to do we decided to go to Signal Hill. The day was beautiful and sunny ... very little wind ... in fact slightly less wind that the paragliders required We watched them whooshing off with their tandem partners for quite some time until the wind disappeared and they had to sit and wait till it returned.Magnificent views!

Easiest way to get night view of Cape Town. Perfect to place for Cape Town night view. This was the next stop after hiked up Lions Head for sunset view. Once you hiked down, then you will be in time for the glittering lights of Cape Town from the hill

Sunset view . We went here to watch the sun set. You will not be disappointed what a view. Parking can be tricky but it's worth it. Loved every minute. Can be very romantic. Do it at least once . I will not leave photos because I will let you enjoy that for yourself.

Great view over the Table Bay. This is one of the must do activities in Cape Town. It is free and open all year round. Views from Signal Hill are amasing. From the open parking area you are able to view almost 360 degrees by walking a little. Moving just around the corner towards Cape Town City Center you have a great view of the City bowl and Table Mountain. Do it!
Dont miss the sunset from signal hill. make sure to go to signal hill dring sunset. Wonderful sight and not to be missed. . buy yourself a coffee and wait for the beautiful sight.

Great views . The view was very good and we arrived just prior to sunset and beat the crowds. The parking is limited and you might have to walk a hundred yards or so, Good alternative to Table Mountain .
Lovely view of the City!. Stopped here on the City bus tour as the cable car was not running on Table Mountain. Great to see all the para gliders taking off from such a beautiful spot. Great views.

Beautiful view from the top,not enough parking. Loved the view from the hill towards the sea and the city.A lot of tourists ...some of the -clever-ones left their buses on - so the fresh air could be poluted with disquisting gasses.

Lovely view of the city and Table Mountain. Our favorite spot in the city. Offers the most beautiful view of the city itself and Table Mountain.
If you wish to watch paragliders or do it yourself, signal hill is the place to be.
a view from Heaven. during a week stay in Cape Town - this is a highlight spot for picnics, viewing and enjoy the fresh air. Make the effort - run, walk, bike or drive the hill - it will refresh you.
Great Views - Free!. Nice easy drive up and tremendous views over the whole of Cape Town and up to Table Mountain. Free view!
Utterly stunning. This is an absolute must if you visit Cape Town. Great views over huge parts of the city that will take your breath away. You can walk, but much easier to drive.

Amazing walks and sights. Signal Hill overlooks the Sea Point, the City and Table Mountain with amazing views and on a good day the para gliders take of from the hill and land on the Sea Point beach front. This is a must for those who want the best posible pictures of this beautiful part of Cape Town.

Noon gun. Lovely view of the city from the top of the hill!
Our guide provided some history behind the cannons and we saw the firing of the noon gun - it is the oldest cannon of its type that is still operational!

What better way to see the city we all love. Signal Hill is an amazing lookout point and place to get away for a bit.My girlfriend and I tend to come up here around sunset time with a bottle of wine and want the city light up. It is the perfect place for a view of Table Mountain and the City.You can see Greenpoint stadium too.Pack a blanket or a jersey as it does and can get very windy and nippy when outside your car.

Great alternative for Table mountain. Gives you a great view over capetown and Table mountain. Great alternative when cable mountain is not running or being crowded. Gives better pictures of table mountain than the mountain itself. Easy exit to a roundtrip over hout bay, Chapmans peak and Cape
The views!. I love the view from here. Traffic can be a little insane, but everyone wants a piece of this! Nice for sunset or sunrise stop. Survey the view of a beautiful city!

The Fairest Cape. It is one of the best views of the City. My personal favourite is going at night. Be it only my Husband and I or with our children.
It is definitely a must see or do :)

Good Views. The Cape Town Sightseeing Bus went to Signall Hill, amongst other places, as the funicular to Table Mountain was closed for maintenance when I was in Cape Town. Signal Hill did not disappoint. I took what I think is a fantastic photo of Table Mountain from the Hill and you also get nice views of the seas and Cape Town below. Well worth a visit. For a history/trivia buff, like me, the history of Signal Hill is interesting.

The sun diving into the ocean!. I think the pictures I put in my review are quite selfexplanatory. From the top of signal hill you have a wondeful view of all Cape Town, Water Front and Sea Front. It is just amazing. Best time to visit it, is sunset. For the first time I saw the sun diving into the ocean. Beautiful.

Best Quick overview for the lay of the land!. This little hill has the best view of any hill in the world! If you don't have the time for the mountain or the table cloth is rolling over, do signal hill! Fantastic for sunset picnics, romantic moments and fitness freaks!

Pick your time to visit. Its off season now but even still parking at the top was a problem. I can't imagine what it'd be like during summer or near sunset, not that I'd want to drive down the hill in the dark.The views are amazing. Follow the trails and you can see all around Cape Town. It was slightly hazey on the day we visited which did reduce the view a bit but we still could see for miles around.Make sure to walk down a bit from the car park to look out over the port area. It'll only take a minute or two to get down. There are numerous places to pull in on the way up to look out over the far side of Cape Town if you are driving. If not you can walk up a bit from the car park to see over and down to the central area.

Watch the Sunset or do some Paragliding!. Beautiful piece of Cape Town. Make a picnic and watch the sunset with friends and family, or do some paragliding from the top. I experienced both and highly recommend Signal Hill as a destination when in Cape Town. See the city from a new perspective.
signal hill. breathtaking views of cape town, the old city and the new buildings, the highways and the bi-ways of life

breathtaking view. No trip is complete when visiting Cape Town without going to all the famous landmarks. Was extremely busy though and you battle to find parking as the road is extremely narrow you can't really stop along the side. The view however was worth it even for a short while

The view that should be on everyone's bucket list. If you time it perfectly, you will arrive at the top of Signal Hill to see the sight you will never forget. It is a vista that captures the heart and shows off Table Mountain and Cape Town basking in golden light. Truly spectacular, and well worth the effort to get there at the right time.

Alternative to Table Mountain. We went there by car as that day it was too cloudy to visit Table Mountain. The view is spectacular and access to the area is totally free. From here you can take nice pictures of the city and of Table Mountain itself

Best View of Cape Town at night. Have not been up for a while as traffic can be a bit of a nightmare but it is surely one of the best free excursions you can do around Cape Town. The view on a clear day is magnificent both of Table Mountain and Table Bay. Views over Robben Island and on to the Hottentots Mountains in the distance. If you are a first time visitor to the Cape do not miss it. The view is great at night also so try an come as the sun goes down. Best of all it is free.For the energetic there are also many hikes but that is another story.

Great place for a walk and take in vuew. I went up to signal hill on the hop on hop off bus as table mountain closed for maintenance it was a very good substitute views are great and you can walk around with several walking tracks.You can walk both sides to get a good view of Cape Town and table top mountain and then walk towards the other side to get views of green point and anchor bay.They do have toilets but that's it no shops to buy and water so bring with you.

Breathtaking. A lovely drive with contrasting cityscape and landscape views. Seeing Cape Town city, the harbour and stadium to Robben Island, this is a great outing for the whole family. There are clean toilets, parking and picnic spots for anyone to enjoy. Though it can get quite popular in the holiday season, it's a great outing and fab way to enjoy some of the beauty on offer in Cape Town.

Very pretty spot. We stopped here after our visit to the Table Mountain. It was the perfect location to admire Cape Town including Robben Island, V&A Waterfront and CPT Stadium.There is a particular photo point to allow a great shot of the Table Mountain as a back drop. Free to visit. If you are an adrenaline junkie, you can do paragliding!!! Otherwise, if you just want to relax, this is the best place to watch the sunset and have a romantic picnic! :)

Give view of Cape Town, but Table Mountain much better. My view of this mountain may be shaded by the fact that we had bad weather the day we went up, but the area at the top of the mountain was barren and not that interesting to explore. It is possible that the view might have been very good, but with a light drizzle, it wasn't great.
Vacation in South Africa. All in all, signal hill, a part of the whole mountain has a picturesque view of the surroundings. It is beautiful to view Cape town from all angles
Beautiful back drop. Signal hill is used for paragliding and entrance up to lions head - beautiful walk up to lions and you dont have to climb to the top you take it all in as from my pics
Signal Hill. Great views from Signal Hill. Good alternative if the Cable car to Table mountain is closed. View not as good if raining or cloudy.

I cannot stay away,,,. Over many years, actually since my earliest childhood memories, this has become one of my favourite view points in all of the World I have seen to date! It is quite incredible to see how the city has developed over the last couple of decades - especially from all the various view points one has access to on Signal Hill. It has also become my first stop after arriving in Cape Town, the place where I can fill my lungs with the fresh Atlantic Ocean air,and take it so much beauty surrounding me while doing it! The public areas seem to be well maintained and secured, but sadly one is mindful of one's surroundings at all times.

Great views of Cape Town, Lions Head, etc, No charge to come and look. We drove up to Signal Hill and it is a pretty drive up to the top where there is a parking lot. There are washrooms there as well. Sometimes there are people with trucks and sell drinks, ice cream etc, but you should always come prepared with water and snacks. It was a clear day and we had excellent views. There is no charge for this and you can walk around, have a picinic etc. Very pretty spot.

Great food and sushi. The food at this well established V & A waterfront has been consistent with serving great seafood and sushi for a long time. We have visited Cape Town on a few occasions and this is always one not to be missed.

Spectacular views. This is a wholesome activity for the whole family. You need a fair level of fitness and the final ascent can be scary if there is a strong wind blowing, but the views all along are amazing. As the walk circles around the hill you get city-, sea- and mountainscapes which are amazing photo opportunities. You can also turn back at any stage and still feel it was worth while.

Great view over city and Table Mountain. We took an Uber up to Signal hill on a sunny winterday and got great view over Table Mountain, Lion Head, City, Waterfront and Seapoint. We could see Robben Island as well. There are hikes you can do. There are toilets at the parking place.
A great view. The drive to the top of Signal hill give a good view of Cape Town, the Bo Kaap and Sea Point/Green Point with Robben Island and Blouberg on the other side of the Bay.

Great city/harbour views. Perfect alternative for great city/harbour views of Cape Town if Table Mountain is closed. Visiting the Noon Day Gun at midday is also worthwhile. You'll get a little history lesson about Cape Town & witness the firing of the Noon Day Gun...a tradition that's over 300 years old.

Great place to run off a mountain!. Most of the para gliding is done from this hill. It is an exhilarating thrill to run right off the side of the mountain and into the sky. Signal Hill is the place to go for sundowners!

See/Hear a Cannon Fire. Every day except Sundays and holidays, the noon gun is fired at Signal Hill. After a brief explanation of the how and the why, we covered our ears and felt the shock wave from the cannon being fired right in front of us. (No ammunition is used.) Probably not worth going to for its own sake, but a nice diversion as part of a tour.
Perfect point to take pic of Table Mountain. Very nice point to take the pictures of the Table Mountain. I recommend to bring the windbreaker since it is windy up there in the morning.

Best views at sunset of Table Mountain. Can't beat views from here for Table Mountain. Bring a mat and a picnic during good weather. The glow of the light of setting sun on Table Mountain and the Bay is amazing.

A five star vantage point. Signal Hill is iconic. There is the gun that goes off at 12:00 each day. The Noon Gun. Well worth a look see. Then there are the views. Spectacular. Use your GPS to get you there and enjoy. But take care. There has been a lot of crime over the areas and criminals have been known to prey upon young lovers in their cars at night while looking at the lights of the city. Well worth a visit. Then there is also the Moslem shrine to visit. Truly an eclectic place.

Breathtaking views. We drove up Signal Hill with the fantastic view surrounding the city and the harbour. Clear view of Robben island as well. Great photo opportunity from the top. The visit was worthwhile.
Great walk to vista. A bit of an anticlimax having walked all the way to the top. Expected more once there, but views of the city could not be faulted.

Beautiful view from the top. The view of the mountains and Cape Town is breath taking. Its a place where people can go to ski-diving. Such an amazing place to go to just free your mind from the world and enjoy the beauty of what nature has to offer.

The best views of Table Mountain. On our only fully clear day, we chose to instead go up Signal Hill. We got fantastic views of the mountain and surrounding city. You can also track down back to the city. Would definitely recommend.

Great view of Cape Town . Climbing up the hill on this winding Road can be unnerving but hold your breath because the view up there is breathtaking. And for the bravehearts, an opportunity to paraglide. The view of Robben island is however can be obstructed by the sunlight so scheduling your visit is key to enjoying the view.

The place to take your "remembering Cape Town" photo from!. Yes it's "the hill to the left of Table Mountain" and the place where the Noon Day Gun is located, but a drive up Signal Hill and a photo opportunity from the top is one of the absolute must do activities when visiting Cape Town, be it day or night! The recent addition of the Stadium down in Green Point makes it even more spectacular, so be sure not to miss out on this photo opportunity.

Nice easy hike . You can drive right up or park your car at the base of Lion's head and hike up. This is a very nice and easy hike that ends in a beautiful view of the city bowl. You can also hike Lion's head and signal hill in one day (Lion's head and Lion's rump). The canon is fired from Signal hill at noon on all days barring Sunday
Went there for the sunset. I went there with the hop on hop off bus for the sunset trip. It was pretty cool! Really enjoyed the view!

Traditional thing to do. Every time I visit Cape Town I take drive up Signal Hill. It is best visited at sunset although it becomes very busy and parking is limited. On the drive up you get good views over the city and from the top views over Sea Point and the ocean. A good place for a picnic

Stunning views of Cape Town - free / self drive. Do it!. Easy to get to, with some of the best views of CT. I always recommend this if you can't make it up Table Mountain due to weather / time restrictions. Beautiful views, walk around and see the city from the top. No time restrictions but can get quite busy in peak season.
Stunning View. Signal Hill certainly has a fantastic view of the peninsula, the best time of the day to visit is early morning to see the sun rise, then go for a hike. We do have a beautiful City.

Great alternative to the Cableway. Avoid the queues and expense of the cablrcar and go to Signal Hill to still enjoy magnificent sweeping views of Cape Town and Table Bay. Stick to daylight hours though.
Nice view. Worth a stop for photos. You have a great view of most of Cape Town, the harbor and table mountain. Great if you like taking panoramas.
Sunset. Nice spot to watch sunset although did not see much else up there...although honk we mise the noon gun
Great view of Cape Town. A place to have an overall view of Cape Town. The sunset from there is just wow! It may take a while to get there depending on the traffic, but it is worth a visit.
Great views of the coast. It's easy to drive up to signal hill from the base. Can watch paragliding from the peak. Great birds eye view of Cape Town.

A GOOD WAY TO HAVE A PERSPECTIVE OF CAPE TOWN. We were lucky to have a sunny day up in Signal Hill. We could see the entire city and as far as Robben Island. It was a bit chilly but we managed to have our car parked in the parking lot and we had a short walk to a bend where we could see the entire city more clearly. It's a good way to start your Cape Town tour.

Beautiful . The place to go to watch the sun set.Take the tour bus, pack a picnic and a few drinks and enjoy the stunning view and beautiful sunset.We were even lucky enough to see whales in the sea below.
Amazing for sunset!. One can just drive right up to Signal Hill to enjoy the view. It's a great place for a picnic, taking photos, or just to walk around and explore.
Well worth the visit.... A landmark place in Cape Town and worth a drive to the top. Good views out to Robben Island, of Cape Town, Table Mountain and along the coast.

Great view. The view is amazing.. Drive to it is equally great.. Do try the parasailing being conducted at the top.. You can buy an instant oil painting made by an old gentleman(they are good.. Believe me).. NOTE avoid going there in dark.. A serious risk of getting mugged exist at that time.

An awesome natural spot in the city. My partners cousin was visiting South Africa for the first time from the USA so we decided this would be our first tour. The views are amazing from the central area at the top of parking area. You get to see the entire city and coast line plus you're in a natural setting right in the middle of the city. It's free and be aware that it can get pretty busy, so plan carefully, especially over the peak holiday season. This is a place I always drive to and parking is limited at the top. It's a day time and sunset spot.

Robbed hiking Signal Hill. I had read about the best way to walk to the top of Signal Hill and was confident that it was safe and not too strenuous. We set out at 11am following the road up from Bo Kaap as instructed. After about half an hour and whilst still on the road a black man approached us from behind and threatened to shoot us if we did not hand over our rucksack. Obviously we were very frightened and immediately handed over the bag which contained our camera, rain coats, warm tops, and money. I would suggest that driving the hill is the only way to get up to the top although we have been talking to people who have hiked it many times without issue. I am now very frightened to go out in Cape Town and can't wait to leave on Sunday. The police didn't even take a description of this low life scumbag.

Mind Blowing view. After a some-what scary drive on a slightly narrow road, we took a walk to signal hill in bone-chilling winds...... But it was all worth the amazing view once you get to the top.If the view of the Ocean, does not blow your mind the view of Cape Town will, and the best of both can also be appreciated as you can view the coming together of the ocean and the city!!!

Scenic and windy. One usually goes to signal point before cape point and it's very scenic there from all around. A very nice installation for taking pictures, a lot of trails you can walk down on, and some geese running around on the hill to keep children entertained

Great place for a sundowner!. Spacious well maintained parkway that crawls along the ocean. Picnic areas and enough parking to enjoy strolling along the cliffs. Sundowners are allowed as many enjoy watching the beautiful African sun sink into the horizon. Amazing evenings!

Great hike at sunrise. We hiked Lion's Head at dawn during a recent trip to Cape Town. Local trail information lists the trail as easy. From a US perspective it is more moderate. The trail spirals around the peak to the top. The first 2/3 is moderately steep but easy dirt path. The rest is mostly rocky, including some rock scrambles, chains, staples, etc. The wind can be very strong on whichever side it is blowing from. Views of the city, Table Mountain and the 21 Apostles are amazing. The trail is heavily used by locals and we felt safe at all times.

Best panoramic view of Cape Town by far. I always take visitors up Signal hill so they can appreciate the incredible view, it beats any other vantage point in the city by far, please don't waste your money on the Cape Wheel when something so much better is available absolutely free of charge. You can drive all the way to the top and have a picnic even.

Excellent Views. Get their early, the views are incredible in the early as the sun is rising above the horizon. A light fog come in from the ocean and it's truly a sight to see. There was always ample parking at the signal hill parking lot but not at Lions Head. I honestly thought the views from signal hill were better than from on top of Table Mountain. We went to signal hill 3 of the 4 days we were in Cape Town to see the sunrise from there.

Where you paraglide from. You can drive up here or take an Uber. You could also bike up here. You get to the top of Signal Hill after passing Lions Head. Signal Hill is where the paragliders launch from, you then land at Sea Point. The view whether you paraglide or not is amazing
Tandem Paragliding. Be a daredevil and enjoy cape town panaromic view from signal hill to cape point but if you are laid you can go for walks and enjoy the scenery.

Best views of Cape Town . We watched the sunset here in May. It was majestic. Signal hill also offers Panoramic view of Cape Town including green point stadium AND table mountain. Grab a blanket and picnic basket and just find a nice quiet spot.

Lovely spot. In all the years I've lived in South Africa (40) and on all the 100's of trips I've done to Cape Town, I've never been up Signal Hill before! But I'm glad I did it at last. It was great, with wonderful views. Just a pity I hadn't taken a bottle of bubbly with me to drink while taking in the beauty of Cape Town.
Good Views of the city. If you can not do Table Mountain, this is the second best place to get amazing views of Cape Town. You can see Robben Island from here.

Go for the sunset. Take a uber here (or taxi) and watch the sunset. Then cross the hill and have the best view over the magical ocean of lights at night Cape Town. It's a imagine that sticks to your memory because of its beauty. Not too crowded either.
beautiful sunset. View better than table mountain especially during sunset, very windy but place to do paragliding and to meet people around the world

Beautiful!. Signal Hill is one of the best vantage points from which to get spectacular views of this breathtakingly beautiful city. If you can visit by night you will get an even more stunning view of Cape Town with the night-lights. Lovely!

Beautiful sunset. I visited with the HoHo red sightseeing bus as part of my two day pass. I love sunsets and watching the sun fade and the city lights emerging was just amazing. The views of Cape Town, Robben Island and Table Mountain were spectacular. It was quite busy when I visited but there was plenty of space for everybody so it didn't feel too crowded. I wasn't sure how long I'd be up there so I took some food I'd bought when visiting the Old Biscuit Mill during the morning.This was a lovely, well-organised trip and I have some amazing photographs.

The most beautifull Place........ I was living in Cape Town for 1 Year.So i came to the Signal Hill a lot of times. Its just incredible watching the sunset ( for sunrise you need to go to Muizenberg , surfing) and later than the City lights. I really love that Place.

Night time visit to see the city lights and stars. My son and I were on an African adventure and were staying in Cape Town. One evening after dinner we grabbed a cab and had him drive us up to Signal Hill. It was a clear night and there were quite a few people up at the top enjoying the city lights and stars. It was the first time I had ever seen the Southern Cross! It felt quite safe in the little park at the top and there seemed to be just enough people around with out feeling crowded or alone. The whole trip was about 100R ($30CDN) and took about 45 minutes. Well worth the time and money.

Awesome Sunset Spot!. If you're not able to get to the heights of Table Mountain, or hike your way up Lions Head to catch a good spot for one of Cape Town's infamous sunsets, then Signal Hill is your spot!Although it can get quite busy at this time of day, you could always go up a bit earlier with a picnic basket and bottle of wine and claim your special place of choice!

Great fo sunset. We visited Signal Hill for sunset and it was beautiful! parking was a bit of an issue (no chance to park on the top of the hill due to many cars) but we left our car safely on the side of the road and walked around 5 mins to the top. There were many people but that made to feel us very safe. Got many beautiful pictures.
Stunning view. Fantastic view of Cape Town (Robben islands, Waterfront, harbour, Stadium and down town) and table mountain. Free to visit. Great for a little pic-nic.
Good atmosphere. I went there with a group. Very nice place to relax, good atmosphere with an awesome and unforgettable view! There are some tables and they sell snacks there with a good price.

Wonderful views over the whole of Cape Town, and Table Mountain. This is the best place to get your photographs of this wonderful city and its surroundings. Very popular, especially at weekends, and it is worth going right to the top where there is a small car park, and toilets! The views are superb, but it is worth stopping at various places on the way back down to get a different angle on the Mountain itself.
Amazing hike. . We took about two hours to hike up and down (being sick slowed us down). We headed up in the morning around 7 and the best views ever. Close to the reliable City Bus.

'High' light trip!. Very popular attraction, but once you are up there you will understand why. If you are an adrenaline junkie, then this is certainly one to add to your list of things to include. When the weather is good there are spectacular 360 degree views, including Cape Town city, the harbour, Table mountain, Robbin Island and Lion's Head. There is a particular photo point to allow a great shot of the Table Mountain as a back drop. These views are amazing and give a great experience if you can't manage to get up Table Mountain (also it's free!). Winding your way through the free roaming Guinea fowl, you will find yourself on a precipice watching people hook up to their chute and run off the edge 'Go-proing' their way to the coast below with must be an incredible and exhilarating ride.This is definitely an experience for all the family. Toilets, info centre and mobile refreshment facilities are available at he top, or great place to have a picnic. Check for low cloud cover before travelling as this will impact on the whole experience. If you found this post useful, please review with as helpful.

Arial view over the Mother City. Spectacular view of Sea Point, the Stadion, Waterfront, City Bowl and beyond. You can either go up pass Lions Head to the top of Signal Hill, where the paragliders take off or from where we were today - up Military road, where the Noon Gun is fired off. Either way - the view is beautiful. Don't go up Military road shortly after 12pm, when the Noon Gun viewers descend, as is is an extremely narrow road!
Best place to watch the sunset!. Just get up there on time if you want to see the sunset! It is a most popular place to do so, so it can get crowded.

Top of the World. A trip to the top is an absolute must for the views. read up on local history & of Signal Hill's importance to early cape Town before visiting if possible. If you see a guy with a coffee truck at the summit buy his coffee. it is stellar!

Incredible sunset views. Mind the cold though.. Visited the view point in the early evening and it was already crowded. Cold in spite of being in midsummer. Mind the cold evening wind. Dusty due to works. Beautiful views on Camps Bay area and the sea as well as the Apostles with the Table cloth appearing late evening on the mountains. Fabulous!
Nice area to visit. This is one of the included areas to visit when touring Cape Town and cannot be missed. Careful when its windy as it is quite powerful
Sunrise!!. I went there to catch the sunrise on 17 May 2016 7.36am! It's amazing. You can take picture Table Mountain & Lion's Head in golden/red colour.
Lovely View. Lovely View. Quite romantic if you are looking for that type of place. Nice to take a stroll and great for photos.

Sunset picnic! . We were here in winter and it was still so lovely to come in the evening! We grabbed some cheese, crackers, grapes and wine and came and sat to snack and watch the sun set! So lovely! Lots of people so get there at least 45 minutes before sundown because parking is limited!Also some great places to park along the road if you're just looking to stay in the car and watch the sun set over the city!

There about sunset. Although I just missed the sun setting, the view from Signal Hill was amazing out to sea and over Cape Town also towards Table Mountain. The road up to this is very windy although people still run or cycle up to this point. There were a lot of people there just to see the sunset and also have a drink which is not permitted. It was a great experience to see this.

Good for sunsets and night views. I walked up here for sunset photos. While there are not many good spots to get a good view of the sun setting over the beach below due to the slope of the hill, the place gives great views as the lights of the city comes on. Best thing is that it is free.

The place to be for the sunset!. You can easily get an uber to the top (make sure you arrange for transport down if you don't have wifi...) and the view of the sunset is spectacular. Plus you have a great view of Table Mountain and Lions Head!

A great view over Cape town. Nearby Table mountain with even Greater views.To the left the great beach es and to the right Cape Town with the harbour front.Great to watch paragliders from the top down to the beach, the instructrice with their Guest before them s creatief of excitement

Great spot to watch the sunset. Especially with a, bring your picnic and gin & tonic. Take something warm to wear as it gets cold when the sun goes down.
Spectacular sunset views.
Amazing Sunset and Paragliding. A great place to be either in the evening to watch the sunset or during the day to paraglide with one of the many companies that launch from Signal hill

You Can't Beat a Signal Hill Sunset. There probably isn't much appeal in coming here during the day, but in the evening, it's a different matter completely. The sunset here is fantastic, purely because the speed of the setting sun is clearly visible. It's a must-do for Cape Town, and also accessible via the Citysightseeing buses.

A must - especially at sunset. A must - especially at sunset,
Breathtaking views from the top.
Can also do tandem paragliding from the top.
Safe and free entry.
Can do a walk up if you are fit enough.

Stunning sunset!. It is a pace to go while in Cape Town, you can't miss this stunning view! You can go there by the red bus, for the same price they offer the "nigth bus"that takes you there before the sunset and brings you back after is done. There is windy so bring a jacket and a blanket, you can buy delicious coffee and bread to enjoy the view.
It's a hill!. We visited at dusk for the sunset - it was cold and far from spectacular though we did have bubbly and nibbles to cheer us up. But basically it is just a hill.

360 degree view of Cape Town!. This is a MUST DO if you are visiting Cape Town. It is quite a walk but the views are amazing!!! Go early to watch the sun rise or later for sunset. Advisable to go in a group.

Adventure and scenic . We've been to signal hill before. The views are great all round. The hiking trails are easy. This time we found the adventure sport paragliding setup on top. It's a sight to watch and great fun to take a ride.  On the way to the top makes a good spot for a photo shoot with table mountain close in the background.
Nice views!. Good views of "the bowl" and the ocean. Great place for paragliding which is run on a weather-permitted basis.

Spectacular. The views from Signal hill, including Robben Island are breath taking. There are several walks including paths up and along Lions Head, but the best was our Paraglide off the hill....it's a must and something we'll never forget, especially as we had a video and pictures taken during the flight which we received on a memory stick at the bottom.

Well set up. Sadly by the time i got to the hill the clouds had dropped and my purpose was to see the sunset so it soon darkened,then hill has a huge area covered by matting which is good for you to sit and look over the city, would be worth a trip in the day also, either time take a bottle of wine and picnic...The red tour bus does a sunset trip,,worth using. ...

Windy Ridge. No wonder people paraglide from here...we nearly found ourselves doing so involuntarily!. On an otherwise calm day, we enjoyed a coach ride up to Signal Hill, from where we took some great pictures of Cape Town itself. Parking is limited and the place gets quite busy but it is definitely worth a trip. I understand that locals enjoy the sunset picnics and walks on the hill, so maybe that is a good option....but take care in the wind.
So beautiful. To head up here on a bright, sunny April afternoon was something I will never forget. So many beautiful pictures were taken!
Amazing views. Cape Town and his Hills is definitely the most beautiful and picturesque places on whole earth!!Signal hill amazing at afternoon time, with all colours, last sun lights and clouds!

View from the top. This is a really pretty place to go to.. especially to watch the sunset on one night. To see the day go from light to dark and then the city lights coming into view. Worth doing this at night too.

Nice vistas of Cape Town. We had a clear day, so the views were excellent Parking is very limited, but during the day lots of people come and go so you should find a spot. We were told there would be a cannon shot every day at noon, but this is not on Sundays. Keep that in mind. Very close to Table Mountain, so be sure to take beautiful pictures.

Great views. Signal Hill was a neat place with really great views and a few hikes, there were some artists painting at the top and selling their work, and ice cream trucks too! It's not a full day activity unless you plan on doing one of the larger hikes, but still work the quick trip up to see what's there.

Beautiful Cape Town. The view from the top was amazing! The drive up was as beautiful and the view of the Campsbay area and Table Mountain was absolutely beautiful and next time I would paraglide from there!
Paraglide from here. We did tandem Paragliding from here.....5 of us....it was a super experience.....to short....I would go again and again!

Pretty Overview But Nothing Special. Maybe it's just me, but Cape Town is so full of gorgeous views and vistas that this one just did not meet the hype.We made it here, planning to have a picnic and while it was very nice and generally pretty, I did not find this to be anything spectacular. Instead, we wandered down to the Bo Kaap neighborhood and wandered around the beautifully colorful houses, grabbing a bite to eat there.

Sunday drive. Beautiful lookout point to see Cape Town from the top of Signal Hill. Great place to have a picnic, take some pictures and enjoy the beautiful scenery Cape Town has to offer. Travel by car, taxi, tour bus. Plan your trip on a clear day. It's absolutely free and the views are breathtaking. There also a lovely artist who was selling paintings of the landscape. A must see if you are visiting Cape Town from upcountry or abroad. Enjoy!

Lovely Sunset if the Weather is Good. This is a Super Location close to the City if you want to see the Sunset on a Clear Day.There is Not Much There except the view and coffee if your lucky so take your own supplies of food and drink.

Best time to view was after dinner, when it was cooler.. I took the Hop On Hop Off bus to the top for free. When you purchase 2 days this is one of the free ventures. I met other travelers from British Columbia on the bus. Unfortunately it was a cold evening and no sunset due to heavy cloud cover. As I too live by the ocean at home, one has to take the weather as it is and just enjoy a different outlook.

Excellent sunsets. It is a must do for all visitors to Cape Town. Pack a picnic basket with wine and a blanket and go up to signal hill for sundowners and absorb the beauty of the Cape whilst the sun goes down over he sea.The are fantastic photo opportunities and stunning sights to remember.
Don't go if cloudy. We actually thought the views were better than tablemountain. The parking is a bit tough, and very tight. But incredible views. No clouds today!!!!
Worth the effort.. Great views over the town. Paragliding is available to try!It was quiet when we went but I understand that it can be busy during holidays or weekends, weather permitting.

Iain MacDonald's Walking Tour. Quite frankly, I prefer walking alone or in a very small group (My wife and I). This is NOT advisable around Cape Town and walkers are strongly recommended to join a group of at least six people. It is possible for most of the time to walk alone and not be attacked by muggers, but it does happen so why take the chance. Local newspapers often report attacks in the hills and forests and on lonely beaches with pangas, knives, handguns and rocks, causing very serious injury and even deaths, quite apart from loss of valuables. Be warned. So I walked one afternoon and evening with Iain's group, starting at the foot of Table Mountain, going around Signal Hill and Lion's Head, watching the sun set over the ocean and giving the legs a good stretch. It was not a difficult walk - for those, go with a group like the Meridian Club. But do wear good footwear, as some of the paths are uneven. It took about five hours. Try not to tread on any snakes, but there is less risk with this in large groups, as the snakes tend to get out of the way fairly smartish. Let the one of the guides go first! In our group of about 15, there was one guide at the front and one at the back. We arrived back at the car park at bit later than I expected - but only ten minutes or so - and it was quite dark by then, so take a torch; One with a red filter or infrared option is best. Have some warm clothing - hills are chilly at night - and take some grub. Water of course is always essential and the South African climate can be very deceptive if you are not used to it. Take sun block SPF 30 as a minimum - this is a must. Listen to the guide's advice and ask if unsure. Iain is very informative, the walk was immensely enjoyable and an excellent introduction to the sights and beauty of Cape Town. A bit far for small children, even if you carry them, but fine for all other age groups with a reasonable level of fitness.

Bird's eye view across the city. Our tour group went to Signal Hill for our lunch stop, taking our own picnic lunches with us. What marvellous views in every direction! Down to Camps Bay, across to Robben Island, over Cape Town City, and not forgetting the views of the Lion's Head and Table mountain. It was sunny and warm, and conditions were perfect for tandem paragliding. Unfortunately, our schedule didn't allow time for the adventurous amongst us to have a go!
Great views of the city!. This is an easy hike that leads to some great views of the city. It's not a difficult hike, and should only take about an hour.
Great views. There are lovely views over the city and towards Table Mountain. There are also great views over the Sea Point coastline as well. Also good for sunsets.

Gorgeous sunset view. Went to see the sunset here and the views were simply stunning. On weekends it is absolute chaos as many people go and there is very little parking which means cars park on the side of the road so that a two lane road becomes a one lane. I would recommend going early with some snacks and waiing out the chaos as the views are certainly worth it.
great place to watch the sunset. You need to get their early in order to get a place to park as the places fill up fast. Such beautiful sunsets from this place.

Easily accessible views over CT. Signal Hill offers stunning panoramic views over the city and table mountain and the bay. Its easily accessible by car and the red town bus, but beware its a popular spot and gets very crowded during sunsets. Its a lovely place to get a good overview of the area. This is is good to do spot when in CT.

Nice spot for picnic during sunset. Visited Signal Hill as part of a Red Bus sunset package. It was well worth it. Seems a popular spot for picnic by the locals. Nice place for a sundowner. Spectacular views of Cape Town with city lights at dusk and light trails of people ascending Lion Hill on the return journey. Recommended.
Alternative to table mountain. If don't feel like queing up for table mountain, can come here instead. Lower hill but nice view. Can do parasailing.

Spectacular Signal Hill. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a trip up Signal Hill. The views are spectacular especially on a clear day, with views of Sea Point, Greenpoint, the V&A as well as Robben Island. The best part is that it is completely free. Also a great spot to take in the sunset. Lots of paragliding from Signal Hill weather permitting too. Well worth a visit.

Extrodinary View. Signal Hill is one of Cape Town's iconic landmarks. Any tourist travelling to Cape Town needs to visit Signal Hill. All Capetonians need to visit Signal Hill at least once a year.The Hill gives extrodinary views of Table mountain, Table bay, Cape Town, Robben Island and lots more. A must see.
Fab. we did the Sunset bus tour with the Citi hop-on-hop-off bus. The views of the sunset was incredible.
Great sunset views. Take an easy (and cautious) ride up for an awesome sunset view , a must for visitors.Tip: Hike lions head for an even better 360 degree view.

For a wonderful view of Cape Town. Driving the road up to the top of signal hill could be a little scary for those with a fear of heights but well worth it for the amazing views both towards table mountain and also looking over Cape Town city and the hills beyond. Great place to have a glass of wine or picnic and watch the sun setting. Take a jumper it can be windy and cool as sun sets this time of year.
Great Views of table Mountain and Cape Town. Head up here for great views of Table Mountain. On the way down stop and park up if you fancy hiking up Lions Head.

Wow. If you are ever in Cape Town then a trip up signal hill is a must. We stayed in Cape Town for 2 weeks and went up twice. So peaceful and magical to look down at the city. You can also partake in paragliding if the weather is good. We saw heaps of people jumping off. Looks like fun however I wasn't brave enough. Take a drive up it won't disappoint.

The views from here are spectacular. but bring a wind cheater or warm coat along with your camera, and we were warned not to go alone or in a tiny group. You really get a sense of the geography of cape town, the different areas, and different mountains. Half an hour s all you need, but you will come away impressed

Stunning views. Lovely you can drive up here park at the top and gaze out at the views they are lovely.You can see Robbin Island,Camps Bay,Seapoint etc very nice,there are also toilets on site as well,excellent place for some camera shots

Great views over Cape Town city and the neighbourhoods. Short ride from town by car. Fantastic view over Cape Town city and the surrounding areas. Best of all - it´s free !! No need to queue to get up to Table Mountain. Take a bottle of champagne and see the sun setting over Fresnay - beautiful.

Delightful views and entertainment too!. Having decided against waiting two hours for the cable car up to Table Mountain, we instead took the road up to Signal Hill. We didn't feel the loss of joining the masses and instead enjoyed some fabulous views of Cape Town, Sea Point and Robben Island as well as Table Mountain itself.A particularly enjoyable hour was spent however watching the brave souls undertaking tandem paraglides off the side of the hill down to SeaPoint. One lady of advanced years got a particularly harrowing flight when they failed to take off and had to be relaunched.All very entertaining and worth the visit with far less congestion than Table Mountain.
Amazing!. the wiew was amazing!! i loved taking pics en enjoyed very much, the place was wonderful and special

Short Drive and Great Views. This is only a short drive away from town and even better if you are going/been to Table Mountain. The view of both sides is great but the views of Table Mountain are greta and stop on the way down to take a photo from the side of the road, there is a small parking area.

Sundowner ....to have a real sundowner. This hill is such a significant part of Cape Town and is a must see and do. The view from here overlooking Seapoint and out to sea beyond Robben Island... and then all the way to South America.Take a bottle of wine and a sick ...always something to keep you warm as well (VIP) and watch the sun go down in the west.Exercise vigilance at all times!!!
Running down Signal Hill, with the Kloofnek race, 21km. So thankfull as i got to the lookout, how beautiful is our Cape, we stopped to experience the view. What a wonderous Cape we live in.
Breathtaking views. Stunning 360 views of Cape Town. A lot of tourists and minimal parking but so so soooo worth the visit. Recommend to go at day and night (not sure about security at night)
Paragliding. My friend and I jumped went to signal hill for paragliding. The view was nice and easy to approach. Its one of the places that you should visit to enjoy nature(if you are a nature lover)
Great place but get there early. This is a great place to view the magnificent sun-sets, but you'll need to get there early, as it gets very busy, and you'll struggle to find somewhere to park.

See the CT . If you like photography or you just want a glimpse of the city this is a very good spot. The car park right at the end is often jam packed with tourists so it's usually a good idea to just stop and park on the side of the road. There is a cool path about half way which gives you a panoramic view without the crowd. It's a public area so you're not supposed to drink up there. But it's the perfect spot for a sundowner...
Fantastic Views. Lovely drive to the top and perfect for a picnic with amazing views of the ocean and Robben Island, Table Bay and all down the coast seeing Clifton, Camps Bay and beyond.

Wonderful view. It should get 5 stars for the view, which is magnificent. However don't use the toilet facilities, especially not with kids. It was awfully dirty and there was not a cleaner in site. This could be due to us visiting over the weekend, but as it is a popular tourist destination I believe it should always be kept very clean and tidy. The view made up for this though. We had no traffic problems.

beautiful view - terrible traffic. very beautiful view, loved the sunset. however, you have to be very patient. everybody parks their car right on the road. once the sunset is over, the traffic jam starts. it probably takes about 30 minutes just to be able to start driving. also, it is VERY windy, so don't forget to pack your jacket or at least bring a blanket.

Remarkable sunset and city scape, traffic is very heavy. Easter week in Cape Town. High volume of holiday visitors. Signal Hill is a favorite, almost a single lane for up & down traffic when every meter is a parking area- entire route up. Then the Red On/Off Buses arrive, along with charters and you have hours of gridlock. Take water and favorites for sunset along with a windbreaker, blanket. Everybody up there is a traffic cop.; it's amusing. But plan for an extra hour to return.Oh yes, the 360 views are great, especially the lights of Cape Town on your 75 minute ride down. Cheers mate, did ya' drain the bladder before starting down?
360 view of Atlantic seaboard. no charges, good for hikers, paragliding etc. mind blowing 360 degree views of CBD, sea point, camps bay, green point etc. some walking too
Good place for viewing the sunset. Nice and free view of the city, Sea point and Robben island. We also watched the sunset and it was fantastic.
Beautiful view from Signal Hill of the city and ocean.. The view is spectacular, even though the elevation is lower than Table Mountain. It is an easy location to get to.

Another nice view of the city. Not as dramatic as table mountain, but still pretty nice. There's hiking up there and watching no the paragliders take off is pretty neat. Rent some mopeds and ride on up. The cannon fires daily at noon

Great view of Cape Town.. Excellent location, free, to overlook Cape Town. Also a great place to watch the para-sail lunching toward the ocean. One drawback is that there is really no place to get food or refreshment. The day we visited the temperature was in the mid 90 F.

Good place for a view of Cape Town. Free view of the city bowl looking across towards Robben Island. From another angle a good view over Seapoint, and then also a picturesque view of Table Mountain and Lions head.
Paraglider's launch from here if the wind is favorable.

Have to experience when in Cape Town. Just such an integral part of Cape Town this is a must see for visitors - gets very windy and chilly as the sun goes down so take some warm clothes but amazing views

Views of Capetown and table mountain!. Simply stunning vista of Capetown and table mountain and the ocean and Robin Island on the other. Obviously Table Mountain is the main wonder of this city but if you visit Signal Hill you won't be disappointed.
A Good visit. Perfect for those on a budget, a great place to pack a picnic and enjoy time with the family. Beautiful for sunrise and sunset views

Great sunset and views.. Signal hill looks onto parts of the city and the Atlantic ocean. The winding road to the top is in good condition. We took a picnic and some drinks and enjoyed the beautiful sunset over the ocean. The area is also very popular during full moon.

Amazing . We went there many times enjoying the view in front of the ocean while sunrise .. Bring heavy clothes with you as it is windy and cold.no public transport .. Just uber or city sightseeing bus ..avoid being there while it is sunny don't miss the chance to go there while you are in cape town !
Fantastic. Worth a trip up to enjoy the fabulous scenery and views. A light lunch at the Tea Room and a Life Memory Photographic opportunity!

S sset @ signal hill. fabulous sunset evening at Signall hill. I went impromptu trip up the hill for a sunset visit as recommended in most of the travel books.... and it truly lived up to expectations, simply stunning!!! highly recommended- and yes take a picnic or drinks as its nice to have a walk around the panorama at the top before settling to peacefully watch the sun set or rise-highly recommended by car or the tourist sunset tour bus trip- not to be missed, obviously watch the weather reports for changeable conditions of sunset, fog or dangerous windy conditions or storms before visiting
We watched sunset. We went by the big red bus to see this spectacular sight really lovely. Take a picnic, bottle of wine, really very magical. Very popular with locals.
Great view. Went up here to watch the sunset, it was really busy for parking. Had a great view of the sunset and over the Seapoint area and downtown,including the football stadium.

Wonderful sunset views. We got there early which was good because parking is very limited. It did mean we had quite a long wait to see the sunset so taking a picnic would have been a good idea. There is a large expanse of green netting to sit on. People are quite happy to sit right in front of you and block the view so my advice is to sit as near the front as you can!

Breathtaking view of the city and the cannon too!. By all means, go to Signal Hill for the cannon firing at noon. The views are spectacular and the idea unique. You can see a long way from atop Signal Hill and it's a good alternative if Table Mountain's Cable Car isn't running which is what happened to us..
A beautiful view over Cape Town. From here you have the full view: Cape Town, the table Mountain, Lion's Head and even Robben Island.

Best Bay views and spectacilar Sunsets. This is a different city sightseer bus trip and well worth it. Great 360 degree views and be there for the sunset as you won't be disappointed. You can drive there if you have a car or motorcycle. Public restrooms and lots of grassy areas to lay out a blanket and picnic. Gets cool at night so take a light jacket.
Most beautiful setting . Most awesome setting, breathtaking views. Too bad there is always so many cars driving up there. Shuttles would have worked better or even making it a paying attraction.
