Sunset at Signal Hill. Was at Signal Hill to watch the sunset and trust me when I say it was an awesome view, its quite windy and cold up there so appropriate clothing should be taken along.

This is an amazing place!!!. The first time I came here with friends, we watched the sunset-an amazing sight!!! Next time I came here, to paragliding and it was amazing!!! And there were other days when my friends and I came here for a picnic... This place is also very romantic!!!

Nice views of Cape Town. Place to visit during day trip around the town. Noting too special, except you can enjoy views of Cape Town from top. Have seen people doing walking tours, but have not done one myself. However, have done paragliding, and that was so fun.

Nice place to watch the sunset. Get there early take some snacks and enjoy a lovey
sunset the best way to end a day in Cape Town it gets quote busy

Great views. Would be a lovely spot for a picnic but we went as part of a tour so just stopped to snap pictures. There are Eco toilets here which smell unpleasant but are quite clean and it's good to know the environment is being considered at such a beautiful spot.
cool place to stop at. Don't need too much time here, but it was fun to drive the motorcycle up there to check out the views. best part was getting ice cream and watching the paragliders take off!
Fantastic views.. Do yourself a favour and put Signal Hill on you places to visit list in Cape Town. Wow what fantastic views!!
Beautiful view of the cape. Signal hill offers one of the best views of the sunset on Cape Town. And at night, the city lights warm up the dark skies.

Nice place for a run. If you enjoy running along long winding roads, this is the place. Even though that it's an up-the-hill route most of the way, it's worth it. Especially as the sun is setting, lovely view over the ocean.

Fantastic views!!. What a great place!! Fantastic views of Table mountain and Cape Town from here, easy to access. It does get very busy with tourists and can get a bit crowded but definitely make sure you visit if you want that perfect picture of table mountain!!

Amazing views of the city and surrounds. A short drive from the city is the famous signal hill. Everyday at noon the cannon is fired and the views are spectacular. You can walk, if you have a fair level of fitness and good shoes, or drive. There's not much parking at the top, but it's a great place to watch the sunset. Don't walk after dark.

Perfect sunset view. If in Cape Town don't miss a drive up to signal hill at sunset, on a clear day. It really is something. There's not much else other than the view but the short drive from the city means you can pop somewhere nearby for din afterwards. Be sure to make a few stops on your way up to get the full 360 of this beautiful city.

Sunset views. Wentvon the Sunset tour with the hopbon hop off bus. Lovely evening and took a beer and some nibbles. The views over thd sea as the sun went down were spectacular. Well worth the visit.
A lovely evening and great views of Cape Toen lit up at night.

Have a drink at sun set on Signal Hill. Lots of people come to see the sun set from Signal Hill, having a picnic or a drink. Make sure you're there a bit earlier as the sun goes down pretty quickly. The view is great !

Quick trip for excellent views of Table Mountain and Cape Town. Easy drive up and plenty of places to stop and take photos, the car park can be busy up top, but has a reasonless turnover if you are patient.

Great view of Table Mountain. The road to the top of signal hill is a good tarred one and there's parking there, toilets and little else. The close-up view of Table Mountain is spectacular. Bring a picnic.
Beautful views. Worth driving up whether in the day or evening to see the views especially looking back at Table Mountain. Views from all directions were spectacular

Unforgetable moments. When i've been there with my wife, we actually got surprised with the atmosphere. The sky was incredible clean, sun was going to set, and despite of the freezing weather, the overview of the sun dropping on the sea was awesome. We got drinking a Black Label, and enjoying each other, the nature, quite nice people around, cute animals, people playing guitar....oh my god! What a remarkable moment in my life
Views to die for. We love signal hill and it's wonderful views over table mountain and Cape Town. There isn't much parking at the summit so chose early or late in the day to visit.

Wonderful views. The drive from Kloof Nek is very pretty but the views of the city, harbour and coast line from Signal Hill are superb. And if you are brave you can para-glide down to the Sea Point sea side!

Sunset at Signal Hill. 6pm - Summer time/Fall - head Signal Hill with a bottle of Cape wine and watch the sunset, it's beautiful and has become a bit of a tradition. You can drive all the way to the top but parking is difficult, better to park close to the top and walk up a little earlier, or take a bike.Lovely couple date - you'll make a great first impression.

Table Mountain's little brother. Not as high as Table Mountain but you can drive up and it doesn't cost you the cable car charge only the ubiquitous parking attendant tip and the views of Cape Town and Table Mountain are superb.
Sunset on Signal Hill. Perfect spot to watch the sunset. You can go by car. Or the Hop on hop of bus. Be sure to take some water because there are no shops on top of hill.

Sunrise and Sunset. I went on Signal Hill many times and it was always a great time to be there. The sunrise view at the City is wonderful great it is a must to watch and if you like to take photos you will love it even more. The sunset you have to watch at the other side, you will see the ocean and Sea Point, Green Point and an amazing sunset you will never forget.

Cloudy but still a wonderful view!!! . We went at sunset and it was ok but it was the weather that wasn't cooperating!I would go back in a second and enjoy it all over again!!Highly recommend this activity!! Views are beautiful and it would be a lovely place to have a picnic or a bottle of wine or both!

Next to Table Mountain the best place to wiev Capetwon. You can drive up there.At the top there is no good view over town, but on the way up there are plenty of oppertunities.From the top you can do paragliding.

Sunset views are amazing . We went up to signal hill just before sunset.The views are really something out of this world.On a clear day you will get a beautiful view of Robben island and the soccer stadium.On the left u see camps bay.A must

Breathtakingly Beautiful. Stunning views all along the winding mountain road-amazing views in all directions at the top-exceptional mountain and sea views-great for watching sunset-free of charge-great picnic spot-very peaceful and relaxing-basic toilets-not safe after dark

Great place for sunset!. At least one evening while we are in CapeTown, we travel up to Signal Hill to watch the sunset. It is one of the most stunning venues I've been to. We like to go about an hour before the sunsets because the colors, as the sun sets, are simply beautiful reflecting back on Table Mountain. From Signal Hill you get an unique opportunity to view the mountain and the 12 Apostles as you watch the sun sink in to the ocean.
Good view of the city and a marvellous sun set. A bit crowded at sun set but when parked at last you have the most fantastic veiw of the city and a sun set you will never forget

sunrise hike. A beautiful quick hike before going to the beach or going out for breakfast,I love chilling on a rock and just practising some yoga. Honestly it is such an easy hike that the brave can attempt it after a Saturday night out.Get there early enough to catch the sunset and then take selfies with the rising sun in the palm of your hand,
High point of holiday. Stunning views on the drive up signal hill with plenty of gaps to stop for photo shots.At the top a stunning view of the city and coastline.

Superb views. Definitely worth a visit. Drive all the way to the top, don't be fooled into parking lower down! If you are a thrill seeker, then launch yourself off the top on a tandem paraglide! Superb views down into the city from one side and down over Green Point, Sea Point and Bantry Bay on the other side.

Scenery from above. Overlook Seapoint, the VA Waterfront, the Greenpoint Stadium, the Cape Flats, Table Mountain
Hikes popular especially on Full Moon evenings
Safe parking
Secure lookout points
A must visit

Bird's eye views of Cape Town. This is a wonderful spot to get a bird's eye view of Table Mountain, Cape Town City Centre, Table Bay and Sea Point. As this is a popular view point the parking area on the top of Signal Hill fills up quickly so you may have to park along the road and walk to the view point. A popular time to visit is the evening of a full moon. Pack a picnic and grab a spot to watch the sunset over the Atlantic Ocean and Table Bay. Then walk across to view the full moon rising over Cape Town as the City's lights appear. This is also the starting point for a couple of hiking trails. The only let down is the unsatisfactory state of the toilets, so avoid using them if possible.

Suñset ...... This is where you go to do the paragliding, but there are also lots of walks with beautiful views ..this is the place to sit with a picnic and chill with a glass of wine while you watch the sun go down .

The Signal Hill Sunset. I really enjoyed the drive up to Signal Hills to see the Sunset set for the evening, this was a perfect day, Absolutely No Wind! The transitions of the Sunset was beautiful. A vibrant orange, reds and yellow lite the skyline. Every Sunset is different in. Each counrty. I suggest you take a pic of every sunset when you travel..BEAUTIFUL
Splendid view on Cape Town. If you like, you can reach it by bicycle....Splendid views of the city center, sea point. Best during the day. Later on buses and cars are coming...
Beautiful spot. Steep hike up, the route is spoilt by litter. When we got there we were the only people, beautiful views across cape town, very peaceful. Worth the walk up.
What a view. Sweet baby Jesus, is there a bad view of Cape Town? Me thinks not. This view area is again stellar but a bit hard to get to...did a cab up there as I had to get to the airport.
Fine views over Cape Town. Try the sunset. We go there at sunset. It worths the view. We thought there were plenty of cars and we parked at some distance. But the walk and the view were amaising
Watch the hang gliders. Went up Signal Hill on a Saturday. It was fun watching the hang gliders taking off. Good views of the city.
Great views of the city. It was a very windy day and was coming up to sunset, but the views from the hill were breathtaking. This is a definite must do sight.

Pleasing to the eye & wheelchair friendly.. This is one of the most popular tourist destinations with the most awesome views YET the parking area is ravaged with huge pot holes. I found no disabled parking bay.

Picture perfect . Once you on the signal hill road the cameras can come out because there will always be great views of the city, mountain,ocean, sky ... or everything else
Always so relaxing up there.
Was a little disappointed on the smell of the toilets(I understand it's a long drop toilet but still was not pleasant)

Beautiful View /Inconsiderate People. We visited in the evening of the 21 Feb, 1 hour before sunset.Well we loved the view, but the inconsiderate/disrespectful behaviour of some of the visitors was a sight to behold. They parked all over, even below signs clearly stating "no parking" which made the visit extremely unpleasant. When challenged I was told "who made you policeman" !!!! As a result of no police or traffic official in sight, gaining access to the parking area and leaving was dangerous to put it politely. My family visiting from the USA & Poland were appalled at this dehaviour who were mostly SA. One person even parked his bright green 1984 Datsun which took up two parking spaces, so that he could push start his car down the hill ! Avoid Signal Hill, if possible or chose another time, maybe. What a great pity....
visit cape town. you can drive up to signal hill were you have a beautiful view over the city,the ocean. and the mountains. If you a thrill seeker, you can paraglide down to sea point.

Great views. If you do not have the time to queue for the Table Mountain Cable Car, drive up Signal Hill.The views may not be as great as from top of table mountain, but it gives you great views of the city, table mountain, the ocean with Robben island, Seapoint and much more.
Signal Hill, easy place to go for sunset!. Signal Hill, easy place to go for sunset! you can get there with a car. if you dont feel like walking up to lion's.

Amazing Sunsets. Went up with the open top bus, the trip there was a bit scary as the road are very narrow, would do it with a car. Take a picnic basket and a blanket and watch the sunset from the slopes, its spectacular. Be careful don't go alone, make sure you in a group.

Schedule in a Sunset Tour -- and pray it doesn't cloud over. This is a wonderful place to come and watch the Sunset over Cape Town and the Indian Ocean. We were fortunate enough to schedule in a trip on our last evening in Cape Town...and on this day there was no cloud, so we had neverending views of Table Mountain and the 12 Apostles, as well as over the city and out to Robben Island.We got fantastic pics of the Harbour and the local Guinea Fowl, as well as of the sunset and the city lights. And we had an experience and a half, as our tour bus tried to get down from the mountain when there were people and cars everywhere...which made what should have been a short trip very slow to get started. In other words, make sure you include this on your trip to Cape Town, but don't schedule anything in afterwards for at least an hour after sunset -- if not much much longer!

Great views of the city center, V&A waterfront, cape town stadium and sea point. If you not feeling for long lines to get up table mountain , then this is a place to be considered !!! Great views of the city center, V&A waterfront, cape town stadium and sea point !!!

Incredible views. Hubby and I on occasion go picnic there as the vistas are sensational. Gosh Cape Town truly is Gods country. Please take care though as I e heard about many people being robbed up there. It's best not to visit after daylight hours

LOVE it here, got engaged on the top of this hill in June 2015 :). Signal Hill is wonderful, and maybe I'm biased because I got engaged to my partner here in June, 2015. But, the view of Cape Town below was amazing, there were beautiful guinea fowl running around everywhere, people paragliding off the top and it was just stunning with both the view of the city and the ocean below. I know everyone wants to go to the top of Table Mountain, but I actually like Signal Hill better, as its more intimate and cuter. Overall, highly recommended and I can't wait to return someday!
My moms 60th birthday. My husband ,my mother her friend and i jumped off signal hill (tandem paragliding ) most fun ever. While my sister and her young ones enjoyed the nature and the stunning views
Spectacular views!. A pleasant drive up to the car park. Wow, what views both out to sea and Robben Island but to Table Mountain, Cape Town and beyond. We were there on a delightful warm afternoon.

2nd best views in Cape Town!. Perfect for picnics, relaxing, watching the sunset, paragliding and just taking Cape Town in. Its free to go up... pack a snack pack and enjoy the 360 degree views of the city, harbour and of course table mountain.
sunset on Signal hill. Best view of Cape Town day or night,Sunsets are awesome .GREAT for photograph lovers and just a place to relax and enjoy the beautiful views of the mother city.

Great views of Cape Town. Get to see a panoramic views of Cape Town from here, specially the sunsets. Easy to get to. Parking can be a problem on some days, and in summer it's packed with tour busses so you'd have to park further down the road and walk the small distance to the top. Parking area isn't very big.
Panoramic view on Cape Town and Table Mountain. very nice view on Cape Town, especially at sunset. A yellow frame offers National geographic like pictures of Table Mountain!

Good for most People. I have a fear of heights and my friends took me up to signal Hill explaining that it is a hill not a mountain. We went at night to see the lights and by the time we got to the top I realized it was hundreds of feet up and a very steep drop. Also a very narrow road without guard rails. I did get glimpses of the city through the panic of running down the hill and I think if you enjoyed that sort of thing it would be good. Anyone with a fear of heights should absolutely avoid this place.

Amazing view. Signal Hill is where they take you when the cable car is not running and there are great views as good as from the top of Table mountain Unless you are an experienced walker you need to drive up or get a taxi.. The 360 degree views are stunning and great opportunity for photograhs
drivable to fun city views. though there are walking options, it's an easy drive to the top where we were treated to 360 degree views of the city and table mountain.

Rivals Table Mountain. This is always a good bet when the Table Mountain cableway is not running or the queues are too long (or you don't want to pay to get a view!).An easy drive up, free parking and superb views. It is well worth walking a few hundred metres out the back of the parking area, through the trees towards the mast, for the best views back over the city and TM.

Great view ,Great sounds :). Its an amazing view from the top and we got lucky to reach there at 12 and experience the live shoot.back in days they used to shoot everyday at 12pm so the captains in the ships could calibrate their watches and the tradition has gone on despite now the technology has come up so much, but its a good tourist attraction

Ah... The view!!. Only went there for the sunset with a tour but the view was amazing! Take some snacks, maybe some wine and enjoy the sea, the sun and some of Cape Towns very famous landmarks like Table Mountain and Robben island.
Fabulous. Great views of the sea and Table Mountain. Brilliant! Free of charge, so if you are in the area it's a must!

Great Views. After a leisuarly drive up to the summit, we parked the car, and observed the great views of the mother city, and Sea Point.We also took a stroll/climb up on the trails, and even had a more better view of the surrounds. definitely a must for any visitor to Cape Town...but be beware, don't do it on your own, you might be mugged.

Sunset. A crowded but lovely place to see the sunset over Cape Town. We went in a car and managed to squeeze in a place in the carpark at the top, so if you do it get there at least half an hour before sunset. It is all about the setting and scenery so you will not be disappointed.

Great views. Asked the taxi to take us to Signal Hill- didn't realise that it was drive able to the top of the hill! As we was hoping to have hiked up and arrive in time for the sunset.It is a very popular spot for sunsets and would be a lot better for the sunrise as there would be less people. Got to the hill around 3.30pm and just wondered around the area, the views was amazing and it was just relaxing just chilling up there.There was a wedding at the hill- which was nice to have witnessed. It is definitely a romantic spot, where people have picnics, champagne, dinner up there.Would love to have hiked up this hill, the views are fantastic and the sunset wasn't that great unfortunately due to the clouds being in the way- but still good.

Great view but unchallenging. Our B&B hosts suggested we drive to the parking just off Kloof Nek and walk from there. Top tip: there are two parking places: if the first is full, don't give up: the next is a few hundred yards further on. The views are great but the walk is a gentle stroll. We were hoping for something more challenging. Also be aware that if you suffer from vertigo, the drive all the way to the top may be challenging!

Pass an hour here. From here there is a lovely view of Cape Town. Parking is easy and there are parking guards. Paragliders usually take off from here and that is an excellent choice of activity, but it is also very entertaining to watch. There are several stall holders here selling their wares.

Stunning View especially at Sunset. If ever you have the opportunity go to Signal Hill try and go when its close to sunset and take your picnic basket and watch the sunset what a spectacular view and romantic as well

Go for sunset. Go for sunset. There are wonderful views across Cape Town, of Table Mountain and down the coast and then after sunset you see the lights of the City. It is nice to take a picnic. It is usually busy however, for safety, make sure you are not the last people there but leave as others do.

great for watching the sun set !. visited several times during our vacation - primarily to watch the sun set, which can be quite spectacular on a clear evening. The hill is usually very busy at this time so you may not be able to park in the car park, but you can still park (safely) on the roadway approaching the summit.

What a setting. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a visit to Signal hill. It offers breath taking views of Cape Town with its magnificent coast line and also Robin Island.
It also looks down on Sea point and the new stadium.
It is the location where the paragliding takes off from which also gives an extra buzz.

Paraglide or watch the sun set. Choice is yours but there is usually a traffic jam at sunset in both directions. Parking is limited so be prepared to walk a bit and don't forget your picnic blanket. Paragliding is wind dependent so be prepared to be asked to come back later or the next day. Take your picture in the big yellow frame, it's a Cape Town thing.

A quiet moment in a bustling city.... My trip up signal hill for the sunset was so much more than anticipated. It was busy but somehow you could still enjoy the quiet. One of the most spectacular sunsets I have seen in a long time. Absolutely recommend it!
Views. perfect all round view of the city up to camps bay. Loved the rectangle installed there so u can take pics with table mountain as the background

watch the sunset. We went here on the sunset bus, got it free by taking the two day city sightseeing ticket. Left the depot at 6pm, drove up to signal hill (dont look out the window if you are scared of heights, the road goes very near the edge and it is a sheer drop). Sunset was around 8pm, so they wait for this and head back down. You have over an hour at the top, it gets busy towards the time of sunset, but glad we went to see it.

Nice lookout spot. Excellent views from the top. But be prepared to park a distance away and hike up, as the car park area are to small for the amount of visitors.Bring your best camera with, as the pics you will be taking will be awesome!

Super views. Took a drive up Signal on a very hot afternoon. Well worth it. The views were outstanding and the drive itself so beautiful. Loved every mile of it and would certainly take this trip again

Poorly marked trail to the top. The hike to the top is more like an urban hike. We ascended close to 30 flights of stairs to meet up with a hillside hike. I suppose one could hike the road to the top or just drive. It is a fantastic place to photograph Cape town. Be sure to make it there just before noon so you can see the firing of the old canon.

Fantastic view of the sunset!. We went there for a view of the sunset.The drive to the hill was fllled with breathtaking view of the ocean below and the cape town city.The table mountain can also be seen in the background.The view of the sunset was amazing and we tried to capture it in our lenses.

Perfect Cape Town Sunset Spot. Signal Hill is usually buzzing at sunset, with a combination of tourists, and a diverse group of locals. The sunset over the Atlantic is truly amazing. It is easy to drive to. Parking can be a bit difficult; and the guinea fowl tend to try and take control of the social setting. (Do not feed them).

Great view when table mountain out of action. Drove up here this morning after giving up on getting to Table Mountain due to low cloud - we got some great views over the city and really got the hang of the various areas!Right at the top was a bit crazy with the tour buses but our stroll around was uplifting as an acapella black African church choir was practising nearby!There are public toilets up here too!

Best views!. We went up signal hill to see the city lights. Wow, so stunning it was breath taking. The teenager drive us up- which was slightly terrifying with all the walkers parked in the side of the road!! Didn't feel 100 percent safe as some drink people in the parking lot, but views were unbelievable. Next time will go and watch the sun set!
Very romantic. Shame I was with a friend on business but a lovely experience. Maybe a little long and coolly in the end. Would be great with your significant other and a picnic.

New Year 16. Once at top the view over Cape Town is excellent and worth the trip. Limited attractions at top -a van selling drinks and someone selling paintings. Main attraction is the paragliding takeoffs which on the day we visited were abandoned due to lack of wind.
Sunset . When it isn't cloudy, you can see a beautiful sunset. It is easy to get there by car, just in front of the hill there are parking places.
The best night view in Cape Town. It gets pretty windy up at signal hill but by far the best view of Cape Town at night. A must see in Cape Town

Fantastic views of cable mountain. Easy to get there by car and if your feeling energetic you can walk up there in about an hour from the starting point further down. Breath taking views of Table Mountain and views of Cape town Harbour, Green Point, Robben Island etc
Popular sunset pointview in Cape Town. It is a good point to observe the sunset over the sea in Cape Town but surely Lion´s Head is better although it involves some walking.

Best Sunset in Cape Town. Definitely worth the visit; from the top you can see across Sea Point and Green Point and around to the harbour; unobstructed sea views. The best time to visit is for the sunset and a great photo opportunity. Try to visit earlier rather than later as it gets absolutely packed with tourist which makes it a nightmare to park anywhere!
Amzing Views. Signal hill is always a great look out point - the view is amazing and showcases the beauty of Cape Town. Sundowners on Signal Hill are picturesque!

Great night views. We went up there in the night to see the sunset and lights. It was unfortunately a holiday weekend and the narrow road to Signal hill was congested with cars and tourist buses. But we enjoyed the views very much.

Great for sunset. It was cold and windy when we went, but it was definitely worth it for the sunset view. If you know earlier in the day that you will be going, then bring a blanket and jumper. If you don't think you need that, then at the very least bring a few beers or a bottle of wine - perfect for watching the sun go down.Got an uber fairly easily - there were a couple waiting at the top after sunset.

sightseeing. It was bad weather at night when we went there, the wind was howling and we couldn't stand there at night , but it was a beautiful sight watching the whole of Capt Town at night, unfortunately we just drove around to see Signal from all aroundn

A lot of hype for a nice but not so unique scene. Good for an evening tour but beware of temperature changes and the wind. Quite busy and more of a group outing area. Nice views on Camps bay, sea, Table Mountain and Table cloth. A good place to spend 2 hours but do take some snacks.
good view point. one gets a very nice view of the city and the green park football stadium.Some times paragliding is also done from there.
So beautiful!. Lovely drive up the mountain. One can also hike up and down the mountain. Great hiking routes.the noon Gun is NOT on top of the mountain.
One of the best sunsets in Cape Town. You can visit Signal hill by using the Hop on Hop off buses, the cycle up there will also be worthwhile. Bring a picnic basket and enjoy the sunset.

Amazing Sunset . A short drive from CPT city centre, this spot offers spectacular sunsets with photographic opportunity for those inclined. Take someone special with cheese, wine and leave before the congestion on the way back.

A bird's eye view of Sea Point, Cape Town. By driving up to Signal Hill, you will experience a breathtaking view of the AWESOME Mother City and when reaching the top of Signal Hill, you will see the amazing Atlantic Seaboard of this beautiful city. Cape Town Stadium will be included in this spectacular view, as well as the V & A Waterfront, to name but a few. A definite on your to-do-list!!!!

one of Cape Town's gems. we celebrated my daughters 5th birthday, it was a picnic and they loved it. the views are amazing, the set up makes it the perfect family setting. the facilities are clean and theres a little tuck shop in case you never packed anything or forgot something. The sky diving is the cherry.

Wonderful views from here. Take the evening Sunset Tour bus which leaves the V&A Waterfront at 17.30 / 18.00 depending on the time of year and has you back at the V&A around 21.00. The views here on Signal Hill are awesome especially at sunset. The views of Table Mountain and Cape Town are
Gorgeous!. Such a calming and peaceful place! Take a hike or go for a run there and it's an even better experience!

Morning walk. Take a hike up the mountain with friends - amazing , when you come down have a nice breakfast in camps bay- heaven. It's safe and an easy walk for unfit people though your legs might be sore the next day, great for a family day out
Romatic Sunset. Took me girlfriend there for a romantic sunset - does get a bit busy but the view is beyond fantastic!

Beautiful Views !!. We took a tour and when the table mountain ques were too long (2 hours up and at least 2 hours to get down), our guide to us ip on Signal Hill instead to look at the views. We were not disappointed as this was a beautiful view as well!

Great views. Signal Hill is a small knob near Capetown that provides beautiful views over the city. The road to it is one-lane each way, narrow and winding. During summer weekends the road is a battle fighting tour buses up and down. The parking lot on the top has restrooms and usually a snack wagon. Parasailers often launch from here. Parking can be chaotic when tour buses and vehicles try to negotiate its narrow turns. A great place for a picnic.

Too crowded in Holiday season for sunset viewing. Excellent view but get their early during SA holiday season. Many cars stuck in traffic on way up and illegal parking limits no. of traffic lanes. Worth the trip but only if you arrive early.
Love the view. The place where the canon belches out a shot over Table Bay to signal 12h00. Hence the name Signal Hill. A must do drive to take some amazing pix during the summer period.

Sunset on cape Town. Signal Hill has long been the place to sit and watch the sun go down on Cape Town. We took our own drink and rug to sit on and had a lovely time. HOWEVER - is it beyond the wit of man to manage the traffic flow? Get everybody to drive up to the top and then to park facing down the hill. Leave the top area for the tour buses and as a taxi drop-off and pick-up point. It took us 25 minutes to move about 20 metres due to people having abandoned their cars rather than parking properly - it would not take much to organise this, the ending of our sunset at Signal Hill was marred by the departure process.
Great view. Signal hill offers a great view of Cape Town and the harbour as well as Seapoint. Almost a 270 degree view. Take a champagne and enjoy a special sunset memory!

Lovely viewpoint and well worth a visit. This is a must visit spot if you want a great view of the city, it's up there with Table Mountain in terms of views. We went on our last day and you can see for miles on a clear day.

Easy access to fantastic views. Very accessible. You can easily just drive up to the top or take a bus. Views spectacular and quite a few things going on from artists at work to para-gliding. You can get tandem para-gliding rides down to seafront in Sea Point below.

A great view of the city without any queues . We drove up Signal Hill from where you can see for miles and still feel in touch with the nearby city. This came immediately after spending hours in queues to get up and down nearby Table Mountain. The experiences are different but Signal Hill offers brilliant views, including the iconic 'framed' view of Table Mountain shown in some visitors' photos. Paragliders also take off from there, mostly early in the day, to add to the experience. I would recommend a drive up Signal Hill before you book Table Mountain, to see if your appetite for a good aerial view is satisfied, without spending 4 hours in queues.

Best view of Cape Town. Take a drive up signal hill during the night. There is no entrance fee payable. The view of Cape Town is unbelievable. The lights at night from Camps Bay, Stadium, V&A Waterfrontt, N2 Highway is amazing. you can also visit during the day but I recommend the evenings.
Best view of Cape Town and it's free!. This spot if great for photos of the beautiful city. You pay nothing to reach the top (probably better if you go by car) and the view is breathtaking.
The view is amazing. The view at night when at signal hill is mind blowing. The city all lit up leaves you speechless. If I lived in cape town , signal hill would be my chill out spot. love it

Fantastic Sunset. I had taken my entire family here during the sunset and the weather was awesome with great views of the city below, table mountain in back drop and then of course Robben Island. Great view and the sunset is just breathless. Spend a few hours there with a bottle of wine and with a loved one or friends. There is a area that you can sit and ponder over natures beauty while the sun sets

One of the most beautiful places in the world. Absolutely love this place. Every time I go to cape town I visit there and it never disappoints. Spectacular views and amazing scenery. A must see in cape town!
Awesome views. . A fantastic view point to see the city of Cape Town. Absolutely majestic on a clear Day! A great place to take panoramic photos of Cape Town. The launch site for the para gliders.

Traffic but amazing view!. I've never had such a pleasant time in a traffic jam! the vista is gorgeous and gets better with every turn! possibly better to park halfway and walk the rest of the way up. there is a trail to the top from the back end, but not many people know about it.
Mind-blowing . The most amazing views of Table Mountain, Robben Island and the city. Beautiful sunrises and amazing at night.
View point. Nice place to view table Mountain from. And must do paraglide from there. #hi5paraglide is awesome to use. Lunch time normally a good time to paraglide in December.

Drove up in the campervan for the view. Most of the crazy traffic goes to Table mountain so turning right at the lights instead of left ws a reliefDrice to the end then around to the car parkAnd enjiy watching the Paragliders takibg off by running down a slopeGreat spot all around for taking pics of table mountain, sea point, green point, robben island and the cityThen driving back down you can pull in on the side of the road and read like i did for an hour with a great view

Drove up just for the Sunset. Drove up for the sunset, althought some advice would be to get there a bit early as a lot of people go to take picnic blankets, food and drink etc. When I visited there were food and drink sellers at the top, although they were mobile so not sure if they are there every time!I personally preferred the sunset view on table mountain, but this was still a lovely experience - although I did sadly see a lot of people kicking and terrorising the wildlife! :(

Go for the sunset!. From signal view you get a great view of Table Mountain, Cape Town, and the water. We went for the sunset and it was gorgeous! Take a picnic with you and get up there before the crowd. The road is a bit narrow, and you have to park along the cliff. Once the sun goes down you get a nice view of the city all lit up.
Cape towns best hiking spot. Signal is a moderate to easy hiking trail. But provides people with the a nice workout. With an beautiful view of cape Town. This is a cape Town must.

Watching the Sun Go Down!. Took the Sun down tour and reached the top of the hill by 6:30 pm. Could click lot of good pictures. Tourists and Locals had packed food and wine and had a good time watching the sun go down.
Work going up for the sunset. We did a sunset picnic which, though busy. crowded was nice. Great views but there is b nothing else up there - except toilets so be sure to carry your picnic.

Miss Green. Not much to do. But the view is spectacular!
Cape Town is very beautiful, and this is like the perfect spot to view the entire Mother City!
Amazing view and a must see. Awesome view of Cape Town and a definate must see when in the mother city. The view of the city at sunset is absolutely breathtaking!!

Signal Hill experience. Probably the most versatile viewing and relaxing site in Cape Town. Whether on bicycle, hiking or driving there is a beautiful picknic spot, very good 360 view of Cape Town and for the daring a great launch with para gliding. Great sunsets and 5 minutes from city centre.

Nice all-round view. . After visiting the Table Mountain, went straight to Signal hill to watch sunset. Being 26th Dec holiday it was very crowded with snarling traffic. Navigating the car was a task in itself. The big yellow frame to click your photos with the Table Mountain as back drop was a very good idea. We waited for moon rise over table bay. It was spectacular. Good spot but avoid visiting on long holiday season if you can.
For those who don't walk.... Even by car you can have a fantastic view of the City and the Green Point Stadium (built for the Soccer World Championship)

Wonderful. Taking the road to walk up Hill is the best you can do. The curvey road with the city in the landscape and table mountain and Lions Head in the back, is like the tv cartoons ... Amazing. Realky beautiful.We went to see the full moon ... Mesmerizing. Will never forget that night.

Breath taking views of the Mother City. Best visited by car or bus . Entry is free, safe and has clean restrooms.A mere 10 minutes road trip from CBD and V & A Waterfront. Vantage point accessible everyday, all year round during all seasons. Bustling with constant tourist flow daily. Best visited on a summers day for a nice sunset view. Remain behind and see the Mother City light up. Be sure to pack a picnic basket. Picnic area on grass area. Child friendly area.No matter how many times you return, Cape Towns beauty from this angle never diminishes. A 3 in 1 view at no cost. With Table Mountain in the background, a City and Sea view of Robben Island ahead it will leave the curious on looker amazed.

Spectacular. Once you eventually have found parking,probably a mile away,you are rewarded with an amazing view to the ocean and the suburbs hugging the hill. If you are walking up at 12 pm you might see and hear the noon gun go off.From that viewpoint an interesting vista of the historic Malay Quarters presents itself just below.This is definitely worth a visit.

Come here to see Cape Town's lights at night. Signal Hill is a nice place to go at night (it closes at 22h00!) to see the city's lights. It's really beautiful! And a good place to go for a date with that special one. Or bring a picnic blanket with some friends and enjoy the view.Also, be careful, because crime has increased here as well. Don't walk around alone.
Spectacular Views. Signal Hill has amazing views and is a must for travelers visiting Cape Town! There is also the option of a tan-dam jump off the hill floating over Sea Point and Green Point

with out seening the signal hill at the Cape Town visit means u've been to half of the city. You must be there sunrice or sunset but better be there at the sunset to see sun goes into the ocean wow there is no word can tell you the feeling of it.

Sunset or sunrise views are superb. Signal Hill is accessible by care or on foot and the views are good . I visited at sunset and the colour of the sky was increduble as you look down on the City below.
The place for a sundowner. We watched the sunset from signal Hill - brilliant view and a great, festive atmosphere. Parking lots were a problem
a must - visit place. free entrance an free parking, you will see Cape Town city under your eyes, you will need a binocular to see many great features from there.

Great view of Table Mountain. This is a great place to view Table Mountain, as well as fantastic vistas over the city and Camps Bay, Clifton etc. It's free and easily accessible. Definitely worth some time during your Cape Town visit. And if you feel like tandem-paragliding, here's the place to try it!
Views. Great city view - though traffic gets busy and can get grid locked,also be careful of belongings - but fantastic at dusk

Great view, be careful... One has to go up Signal Hill when in Cape Town - preferably do the walk to the summit, or just take an Uber to the end of the mountain road, where one can see the city bowl and look down on Sea Point. The walk up the mountain itself is not to be advised for unfit people, dare yourself!Be careful or walking in small groups in the area below the summit road (where there are always many people and it is safe), there are some petty criminals around.
Majestic sunsets. Most romantic place for sundowners.. Great view of Sea Point and Robben Island and The Cape Town stadium..

Panoramic views of the city . This is a must for viewing the sunset in Cape Town. If u are driving - get there about an hour before sunset so that u can get a good parking spot and take ur photos before the sun sets. Picnic baskets, blankets and jackets are recommended. It's a beautiful spot to spend a couple of hours taking in the view and taking beautiful photos.

Nice views. We stopped here to take lots of photos. Cape Town is below and so are views of the nearby beaches. One silly item is a large picture frame that everyone must use to photograph themselves in front of Cape Town. Not really worth the wait. The photos are actually better a little farther down the sidewalk.

Stunning Sunset. Your trip to Cape Town is not complete without a sundowner at Signal Hill. Unsurprisingly, some TripAdvisor trolls are rubbishing the traffic and lack of parking. Newsflash, if there's lots of traffic, it means it is popular and where do you expect they create car parks at the top of a hill full of people? Take the tourist bus to avoid parking and traffic troubles or walk (for the adventurous - remember, it's a hill). Take a couple of blankets, a bottle of wine, your favourite snacks and make your way up. Honestly, some people would complain if the hiking track wasn't paved with 18C gold and embossed with original baby bull shark teeth.
Great view. Well worth the drive up the hill. Went in day time and was reasonably busy. I mention this as you should not expect a lot of parking.

This Should Be Sunset City!. If you spend one day in capetown, make sure you go to signal hill and witness the sunset. You would fall inlove with nature. I couldn't stop taking pictures and you can imagine that view where the sun behind to set right before you. I should post pictures shouldn't I? oH MY! make sue you dress warm. The cold breeze is freezing cold

Nice sunset view. We took a city sightseeing sunset tour up the Signal Hill and was totally taken away by the view and also the night lights of Cape Town central. Bring a jacket along, its cold and windy up there! Prepare food too! You can spend about an hour eating there and watching the sunset!Try not to drive up though. It gets jammed pack near the peak area. The whole trip took about 2.5 hrs.

loved it. we booked a paragliding excursion with icaras that had to be postponed due to winds but we took the opportunity to enjoy the scenery. there's a large picture frame that frames on table mountain. great idea!
South African roadtrip . Great views over the bay and full.of history this is a must on anyone tour of the cape. Easy to access and where else you going to see a cannon

Great views and seeing the para gliders go. Worth a drive up here. Great views over Cape Town as you drive up and when you get to the top. This is where all the paragliders launch from and you can pay for a tandem ride from here if you want. Not for me. I did it when I was a bit younger and more daring.
Took off for paragliding here. There was a big frame where u can stand on it with the backdrop of the real gorgeous table mountain!
Fantastic sunsets and picknicking. We drove up here on our last night, the views over the V&A and Cape Town are fantastic day or night. well worth a visit.
Peacefull. Anyday or night time. It is perfect! Great spot to chill and look out over the city. Wonderfull place to watch the sunset too.
Amazing view of the hill!!. I visited this place last week and found amazing and worth watching. Those who have at least 3 days to spend at Cape town must visit this place.

Paraglying. Sunset Picknicks or early Trail Runs. Paraglying. Sunset Picknicks or early Trail Runs...whatever you are in to , you can do that right here ! Take off on a Tandem Paraglyding and fly "downtown" see CapeTown from the Birds Perspective.....just wow, have a sundowner up there and take amazing Pictures or get up early and go for a nice tail run......you'll enjoy no matter what Kind of activity you are in to up there
Great View but Crowded. While in Cape Town we knew we had to visit. Great views but was extremely crowded...to the point of having to wait to leave because of traffic congestion.

Huge traffic jam for sundowners - go somewhere else. We went to Sigal Hill for sundowners and got stuck in traffic for 30 minutes after sunset. What a zoo! With so many great places to watch the sun set in Cape Town, I would avoid this one.
Excellent view. For an overview of the city it is a must to go here at sunset. It is easy to find by car and free. You are above The millions of lights of Cape Town which is a wonderful sight.
Beautiful views of Cape Town and Cape point. A must do visit! Such beautiful 360 view of Greater Cape Town and Cape point - lovely to take a bottle and sit and watch the sun go down too

Like all the best things, it's free!. In a city with many marvellous viewpoints, Signal Hill may just be the best of the lot. Of course Table Mountain is higher and more exciting, but from Signal Hill you see the whole sweep of the City Bowl framed by the ocean on one side and the mountain on the other. Turn around and you can take in Green Point and Robben Island beyond.We were lucky enough to be able to spot whales out in the ocean! Too far for a good photo but these big blow-outs couldn't have come from anything else.

Drive to Signal Hill. Don't miss the drive to Signal Hill. Get a picnic basket and some wine and spend the time enjoying the views from Signal Hill. Be prepared to wait for time to get a parking as it has very less parking space
Beautiful views of a beautiful place. I really love it up there and you are in for a treat if the icecream man is around! Go towards sunset and you will see it at its best!
Stunning night views. Even more spectacular than I remembered, lights over Cape Town are amazing. Definitely a must do when you are in Cape Town!
Great views of Table Mountain and city. Fantastic views of Table Mountain, the ocean and the city. A great choice for views if Table Mountain is closed due to weather.
Great view of Cape Town. From Signal Hill you can see most of Cape Town and its surroundings. A great place to do paragliding.

Good spot!. Signal Hill is a good spot for hiking or just taking a drive to the top and enjoying yourself by taking photos of Table Mountain on the one side and seapoint on the other side. You can also do paragliding. Great spot to enjoy a sunset with your partner.
the view. Nice place to go and relax, eat an ice cream and look out over the city. just watch out if you are there at 12 noon when the canon goes off.

Sunset over Capetown. We took the Sunset bus to the top of Signal Hill. The view of Cape Town is spectacular. The setting sun create wonderful orange glow. This is a very good use of a couple of hours to finish a wonderful day in Cape Town.

Great alternative to Signal Hill. Beautiful spot to watch the sunset! We went up here after Table Mountain was closed due to wind and it did not disappoint. We hired a cab to take us to the top. This is a perfect place to take golden hour photos at sunset.

View of Sea Point And Green Point. A fine place to just relax and Forget about everything.. the perfect view of cape town standium, green point, sea point and the beach.. the perfect place to do the paragliding.

Sunset Picnic. We traveled via the Cape Town Sunset Tour Bus to Signal Hill and I have to say: "Beautiful beyond expectation". The space set out for tourists to set up a picnic faces the beautiful west coast of the Cape and is a very relaxed family/group scene. If you have been at a beach facing west: you,ve ain't seen nothing yet!The only downfall is that you have to face traffic on your way down Signal Hill after sunset, but still worth it.
Great views of Cape Town.. Signal hill is the sort of place that, on a wonderful day, you could stay all day to marvel at the views.
Amazing views. The perfect place to get an amazing view of Table mountain. A lovely drive up and then stunning scenery.

SOMETHING DIFFERENT. A tradition that has been going on "forever" is the firing of the noon cannon from Signal Hill. There is some pomp and ceremony to the event, and it would beespecially impressive to children to hear and see a real cannon being fired.The views are impressive and the hang gliders might be making their jumps from the hill down to the beachfront if the winds are right. The drive can be a bit of a challenge to find unless you have a GPS.

A place not to miss. Enjoy beautiful views over the entire city and the Table Mountain. Walk around enjoying nature and wildlife. Next time we will try hang gliding. To sum up an experience not to be missed.

Breathtakingly beautiful!. I just loved the views from here it was amazing and we were one of many trying to get there in time to watch the awesome sunset. It took us a little while to get a parking spot so if you can try to be earlier and ready prepared with your picnic basket
The sunset view is worth seeing. We sat there with a picnic watching the setting sun. It was beautiful and mesmerizing with the beautiful view over Cape Town.

Wonderfully View. Popped by Signal Hill briefly and it was so refreshing to see our city from that vantage point. Just another reminder of how beautiful and unique Cape Town really is! It was very windy but the lovely views quickly make you forget that :-)

Worth the trip. Go by bus as there can be so much traffic.The bus takes you straight to the top. Take a picnic. I highly recommend the sunset tour on the red bus. Take a thick Jersey. The views are breath taking.
Gorgeous Drive. Beautiful views from the top. Wander around. Watch the hang gliders launch off the side of the mountain. Not to be missed.
Stunning views, easy drive. Stunning views over Cape Town. Easy drive to the top with a large car park. It gets windy, bring a coat!
Go up Singal Hill during sunset.... ...and you'll have the most amazing view! You can see the city, the ocean, Robben Island... Stunning!

Horrible. It is really boring and there is nothing to do there. You have to drive a long way to get there. It is also a steep road. The only thing they serve is coffee for 20 rand a cup. It is really horrible unless you like to walk up dangerous paths. The picnic tables are dirty and it is always really cold there.

Glorious view of City of Cape Town. A Glorious view of the city and surrounding heights. Busy at weekends and in summer but it is worth while the drive or cycle to get here. Few other cities have such glorious prospects.

Go for the Sunset Ride on the Hop on Hop off. We were very lucky and got a wonderful sunset, not so much the actual, but forchirty minutes after beautiful cloud and colour formations. The bus ride down was equally wonderful. Check temperatures and ensure you have a) plenty of warm clothing, ad the wind can get a bit chilly and a few food and drink provisions. Not forgetting a camera of course!

breathtaking views. After visiting Table Mountain along the same route one can take a drive up Signal Hill to just take in some breathtaking views from this altitude. If you dare there is tandem paragliding for adrenaline enthusiasts.

Lovely views and a great place to start a day trip around cape town. Lovely scenic drive to the top of signal hill where you can watch the paraglider taking off and see the lions head and table mountain in the back ground, gives you an appreciation of the city also. Plus there is ice-cream at the top so worth the drive!!!

Superb site for sunset. This is a wonderful hill to visit at the end of the afternoon to see the sunset. You can sit on the hill, there are some benches and tables. Friendly atmosphere, you can bring your own food and drinks

excellent view at sunset. lovely look from there ! veeeeeeery cold weather , take heavy clothes with you ,you can see all the city from there with panoramic view .. stay there to the sunset ;)You can go by a taxi or city sightseeing bus tour (Red one)
Perfect View over Capetown !. Because of Heavy Winds we could Not get on the Table Mountain !therefor brought US our tourguide there,which was perfect !

for perspective & peace. Lovely lookout spot where you can see the whole of Cape Town, without having to climb any of the peaks. There are optional walks - varying lengths and fitness levels - so a good idea to wear walking shoes. Be aware the weather can change in an instant and it's always good to "layer" clothing that you can put on / take off as the sun comes out / disappears. Avoid if it's foggy (no view and cold) or windy (very unpleasant).PLEASE be respectful. Signal hill is one of the most sacred sites for locals and international pilgrims and has a sacred burial site (kramat) on it.

Super Sunset. One of the best places in the country to watch the setting sun. Just breathtaking. Panoramic view of the City of Cape Town adds to the allure of this place. Bus loads of tourists come and it can be a challenge to find parking during the peak tourist season. But certainly a destination one should never miss while visiting Cape Town.
Breathtaking. Drive up, very carefully, park up and watch the sunset from this wonderful vantage point - bring a picnic.
Place to be for the sunset. Me and my friend drove up there to enjoy the views and the sunset. Definitely worth it even when it was little bit cloudy.
Forever views of the Cape. High up a hill in Cape Town one has the most fantastic vista of Cape Town and the Twelve Apostles mountains.
Big Bang at Noon. Well worth the journey for the view, talk and bang. Lots to see at the gun battery, with some really old guns
Great Lunch Spot. Cool place to eat your lunch and wait for the 12:00 canon blast from the side of the hill. A favorite of my boys.
Grand Central Station for sundowners. Not sure if it's worth the hassle unless you are a fanatic sundowner. Busloads of tourists come up, some left a lot of trash, not a peaceful place.

Great Sunset Spot. Signal hill is a great place to watch the sunset. You can also often see professional photographers when the clouds swirl around Table mountain and the city lights and lights of the ships in the harbor combine majestically. Joggers and walkers abound as do tourists who just sit and watch the sunset.

Awesome views and if you want to Kite down...a must. Easy access to to the top-- beautiful views. Enjoy an ice-cream cone whilst you wander around. Book for an exciting kite flight down with experienced kiters---seems they land in Sea Point.
Great views!. We didn't get the opportunity to visit at sunset although we will next time! Well worth the trip to see the views!

The most romantic spot in Capetown. It is easy to get there, but for sunset it is a lillte bit crowded. Combine it with a little picknick and watch the sunset there. Amazing!!! Do not forget to make a wish!!! ;-)

Lovely experience, if you have a car. Breathtaking views and a very Cape Town experience. Sadly there are reports of crime, especially if there is not a large group of people. Best done with own car and in a group, than on foot and alone. Fantastic photo opportunities.

I live here. And this is an amazing, five star, free place to hike, relax and generally improve well being.
Just be a little careful and make sure you have company in case there are thieves lurking about, although I live in Signal Hill and have never seen one.

Cape sightseeing Sunset tour is good value. On a clear evening this is a sight not to be missed although the area can get rather crowded. The service provided by Cape Sightseeing Hop on Hop off is good value (free with a 2 day ticket

Great way to start our trip. This was the first place we visited and it was a great way to ease us into the beauty of Cape Town. Coming here before we did table mountain was ideal. It's peaceful and offers wonderful 360 degree views of Cape Town.

Amazing views. The views at signal point are amazing. There are a few picnic tables there too. However it was a bit too windy to stay outside for too long. The found the drive up a bit scary too. Best to go up on a clear day, during day light hours. Drive carefully and be safe.
perfect spot to view a sunset. not accessible by public transport a car is required. the views of cape town is beautiful especially the sunset views

A good alternative to Table Mountain. If Table Mountain is cloudy then try Signal Hill for the views. You can still see all of CapeTown from here and the bay and docks etc. Good fun watching the Para-Gliders take off from here.

Wonderful Table Mountain and Coastal seaViews. Just the views of Table Mountain make this spot worth a visit. Terrific photo spot, and even a frame is provided. A walk around is worthwhile. For the more athletic, a walk up the Hill is not that hard. So glad we did this

fantastic. Due to bad weather Table Mountain was closed so we went to Signal Hill. Fantastic views of the city and surrounding area. Photographers joy plenty of good sites to take fab photos. Shows the real sprawl of Cape Town really well with good views to Robben Island.
Sunset. Went up for sunset and was rewarded with beautiful views, it is busy at sunset, as most places are but not overly. Great walks around here too. Definitely recommend.

Old Favourite! Panaramic views of Cape Town. . Signal hill is the best place to watch the sun go down and soak in the golden hour in Cape Town. The panaramic views offered of both the city, table mountain, lions head and the ocean are breathtaking. A must visit for anyone spending time in the mother city. My only negative comment would be the state of the ablution facilities. Although quite clean the loo's are pit-style toilets with no flush. Bring toilet paper because there is often a shortage.

Gorgeous Views. The perfect place to go and see the city lights. We prefer the evening or sunset views as then the city comes to life with lots of romantic views to savour. When going up try to stop along the road about half way up, the views are better here for lights at night and then if you go in the day you can see the sea and many suburbs from the top. This is a free attraction and we'll worth the drive. Note: not a good drive if you are the driver and have a fear of height or have had a few drinks.
great views of the city. We did a quick walk around here before dinner and it was a really nice time. Great for an afternoon hike before dinner.

MAGNIFICENT VIEWS OF THE ENTIRE CAPE TOWN. Often neglected for table mountain, but signal hill has 360 degree views of cape town and on a clear day, just magnificent! Para-gliders jump from here as well, but not much in the way of food or restaurants. Definitely worth a visit. Windy road to dive up through the forest.
Lovely views. Took a car up Signal Hill and just sat and looked at the beautiful views that are available. Stunning.Tandem hang-gliding is available.

Signaling the beauty of Cape Town. Great place to launch your paraglide. If one enjoys running, an early morning run along Signal Hill from Lion's Head car park and back, is magnificent. Awesome for sunset picnics too.
Beautiful views. Ideal spot to get a good vieof Capetown and the area around . Lovely walks as well up or around Table Mountain
Panorama view over Cape town. After a day To Stellenbosch, Paarl en Franschhoek we end our trip on Signal Hill. We had a very nice view all around the city, and saw how big the city is.

Signalhill . Offers a great cape Town view. Can see seapoint. A great view of table mountain. Tourist atrraction. Gets packed in the afternoon just before sun set. Offers a great view of lion's head. There's a little ice cream truck and stone market for interest.

Night time is magic.. This should be part of your Capetown experience if only to feel the amazing energy of the people who also take in the view. Most folks are in awe or dancing for joy. A few tips: Take the bus. Be patient. Nature takes its time. Dress warmly. It is windy up there. The hot chocolate is yummy. This is a magnificent place to view the glory of the sunset and night sky.

A beautiful View of Cape Town. The drive up is scenic and you can literally stop anywhere on your drive up and look out over the City. When you reach Signal Hill there is ample parking for all the early arrivals. You can have a picnic, to a walk or hike in nature there. Perfect for a solo or get together
Love the Cape Town and sea point view. It's good to visit during the night And the street and building lights will be on, they is a fury cool view, it's alway a pleasure to visit this place
Beautiful view and great trails. This is my favorite running place in Cape Town! Enjoy the beautiful views and watch the weather come in off of the ocean.

Stunning Views of Cape Town. The views of Cape Town from Signal Hill are stunning. We stopped to take in the views from this hill, and were not disappointed. The hill provides sufficient elevation over the city, which gives a great perspective. We were also amazed by the many parasails taking off from the slopes of Signal Hill. If you are pushed for time in Cape Town and the Mountain is clouded in, then head to Signal Hill.Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

Really great views of Cape Town. If you've ever wanted to paraglide over the Atlantic Seaboard, this is the place to be. If your courage fails you, you can stick with a more sedate picnic and watch the sun set over Table Bay. The wind does get quite chilly so blankets, jackets and scarves are recommended. You can buy coffee or hot chocolate from a van in the parking lot but service is slow so bring a bottle of wine and enjoy a lovely evening with a loved one.

Amazing views. Awesome drive up to Signal Hill. Views are brilliant. Dont forget your camera. Watch out for vagrants at top. Paragliding available. Must visit for Cape Town when the weather is good. Not much to see when the mist is up.

Lovely trail for a run/walk!. If you enjoy the outdoors and wonderful views, then Signal Hill should be on your bucket list.There is a trail that starts on the right side of the house at the base of the trail to Lion's Head. You can follow that trail through beautiful fynbos and other Captonian flora. During this time of the year there are flowers blooming as far as the eye can see! It is a magnificent sight and such a surprise as you reach the top of the hill - you are then greeted by the friendly faces of the hill's ecosystem.It is important to take along water, a hat and sunscreen. The South African sun can be harsh on our skin - even in winter. For additional safety I would suggest that you also take a flashlight and a warm top/jersey.Enjoy the astounding views from the different angles of Signal Hill!

Likely one of the best sunsets you'll see. This review is a little biased because I'm of the fortunate citizens of Cape Town ☺ Signal Hill is spectacularly beautiful on a warm evening with clear skies. Bring your picnic basket, lie on the grass and watch the sun go down, hiding itself behind an ocean of blue. There are nice walks (hiking) and the paths are also used for trail running. Younger kids should be cautious as they could get hurt. It can get busy so you'll need to find parking. But of course, car guards are everywhere (even up on the hill).A visit to the Cape is not complete without a sunset on the Hill.
Beautiful Views of CapeTown. Table Mountain aerial closed due to weather so we went here instead to see the amazing views below. Highly recommend.
More Great Views. Another good location for wonderful views of Table Mountain and the Cape Town area. Easy to walk around, just ensure you don't forget yur camera.

Amazing views of Cape Town (good alternative to Table Mt). I went on the Red Open Top Bus evening tour to watch the sunset from Signal Hill. As it turned out, it was cold, overcast and windy. There was a setting sun, but it was so shrouded in cloud that most of us sat inside the bus. So it's not recommended on such days. That said, the views of Cape Town as you drive up/down the windy road to Signal Hill are fantastic -- I probably got better photos here than from the top of Table Mountain. And, on a clear day, I'm sure you'd get amazing views from the top of Signal Hill too.
add to the itinerary. Beatiful viewpoint. It is very picturesque even with the fog rolling in. A car is the easiest way to see it but public transportation is available.
Fantastic views. Fantastic views of the city and coastal area.weather permitting,Parking good. Toilets. Part way up there is parking so you can watch and hear the midday fired
We were framed!. Great views of Cape Town, Table Mountain, and Sea Port. If you have a car or are on a tour, you've got to have your picture taken in the Table Mountain frame.
Cannon at 12. Don't park your car near the noon gun! It cracked my windscreen...However it's informative and historical. Nice grounds and great views.
Just a photo stop.. Just a photo stop unless you are a Paraglider. Again pass if Table Mountain clouded or fogged in. There is nothing there just beautiful scenery

An alternative to Table Mountain. When the queues are too long for Table Mountain, head up to Signal Hill. Views are lovely. Parking can be tricky but we were on a tour. You can also walk up to Lion Head.
Great view of Cape Town... A nice spot to go and walk around and take in teh views of cape Town. Also you can paraglide off here and they meet here a lot.
View. Lovely views of table mountain and the town. Limited parking, you see you people hand gliding etc, easily have a picnic there.

Take your time... enjoy the views. Perfect time to go is a few hours before sunset.You'll enjoy the most spectacular views of Cape Town. As with any other tourist attraction... beware of vagrants or beggars... not all of them are friendly and not all who receive a "donation" are actually grateful.

Great views of Table Bay, the city and Clifton Beach. For those who are scared to go up Table Mountain by the cable car Signal Hill is the next best place to get great views. You need a car to get up to the viewing spots but the drive is well worth it. Also great sights at sunset and night time with the city lights.
A great view of the town and surrounds. If you can't get up to Table mountain this will give you the next best views of Capetown. The hang gliders are an interesting side attraction whilst there

Unmissable for scenery. A perfect place to look down on CapeTown and the beautiful coastline the drive up is scenic to put it mildly and the views from the top wonderful. If you only hire a car for a day or two make sure this is on your itinerary.

Amazing sunset. The views from the top of Signal Hill are fantastic The best time to go there is in the evening to enjoy the most beautiful sunset and watch Cape Town lighting up for the night.Take a half a km walk down ther road from the top and enjoy some stunning views of different parts of the town. Venture into the bush a bit and enjoy the place from non-touristic section.
Best View of Cape Town. Great picnic place and best place to view Cape Town, well worth the drive up. Carry refreshments and snacks and of course your camera

Awesome Views. We drove up here for the view. It's awesome! you can see the whole site on all sides from here. Particularly liked the big yellow picture frame, aimed at Table Mountain photo opportunities. Amazing views, well worth a drive up there.
good views. nice views and good to see when you are in capetownit has a nice overview over Capetown and whilst driving you can really appreciate the scenery on a clear day

A highlight of a Cape visit. A frequent visitor to Signal Hill, it is always a thrill to show off our city to foreigners from this vantage point. Access is very easy and views stretch toward Table Mountain, across the city and the docks, across the ocean and of Green Point and Sea Point. If you are lucky, you will see a company doing paragliding from the mountain slopes. This is also one of our favourite spots to have take away pizza and champagne.
great sunset. drive up to see the best sunset also great views of the city. Close to Lions Head - many hikers go from one to the other.

Date nights. We love to drive up Signal Hill to have a picnic at sunset. The view is amazing. Area is clean and well kept. One of Cape Town's diamonds! Make sure to take your time and take in the surroundings while lounging on the grass. There are also food stalls.

Great view. Excellent views of the city and of Table Mountain. This is well worth a visit if the Mountain is under its tablecloth or the queues are too long. We enjoyed watching the paragliders launching themselves from the top of the hill.

Visit to Signal hill . Given my hectic travel and business program, took some time out to visit Signal Hill. Although there was a slight breeze, skies were clear. The views from the lookout points were amazing. Excellent policing presence; area was clean and tidy; lot's of tourists; good infrastructure.
An absolute recommendation to anyone visiting Cape Town.

Grat views. We went in the evening in early spring and the weather was very good. Fantastic views, and great fun watching the paragliders taking off. My daughter was pleased there was a van selling good quality ice-cream.

Sights and sounds at signal hill. Definitely less of a trek because you can drive to the point and overlook for the sunset. It has an amazing view of the whole coast to the north. An awesome location for those who are into fitness, great area to run and just observe the natural world and hear the birds.

Lovely views of Cape Town and Table Mountain from here!. We got here on the red line hop on/off bus and as the bus ascends the Hill, sit on the right side so you can take great photos of Table Mountain. As bus goes down, sit on the left side of the bus. We walked around the top of the hill and the beaches and oceanfront surrounding Cape Town can be seen.

'Great views'. We visited signal hill as the clouds were so low over table mountain that the cable car wasn't running. But the views over capetown from signal hill were spectacular. I can't imagine them being any better from table mountain. Got great photos. Views of town, warf, beach's, robben island you name it! And the beat part about this tourist sight is its free. The viewing platform at the very top is nearly completely overgrown trees in the way unless your super tall your better off stopping on the last few corners before top can get great pics from there.
A romantic moment!. A beautiful view over the city and Sea Point! Watching the sun set from this point is memorable. Lovely!
Spectacular view. Toilets smell terrible as they are just log drop with no flushing ability. make sure you dont need them when you go up. Views are spectacular.

Great hike, easy to access, but don't underestimate. Ths Signal Hill hike is great in that it's only a few minutes from the Cape Town CBD, has breathtaking views and is fairly easy for the non-hiker. Do wear appropriate clothing though, sandals are not recommended and carry water and a small snack. Watch out for the wind and remember that you're walking on a mountain, not taking a stroll down a street.
Beautiful sunset spot. The view of the city lights from here was just incredible! it is definitely worth doing, and you can take a picnic

Well worth a fight , A drive up Signal Hill at night !!. So my Husband decided to take me out for a drive up to Signal Hill after dinner. One drives up a hill in absolute blackness. Not for the scary cats and those who may have a fear of heights. The view of the harbour and Cape town city is breathtaking BUT I was very nervous . It just didn't feel so romantic up on a mountain with winding roads, no side barriers and a head filled with a whole lot of stories of those who drove off or fell off this hill. Something that needs to be done , some day, maybe but not essential. Go up there if someone is offering a free ride! HAHAHAHAHA
A must drive!. Driving to signal hill and seeing the city is a must do. It is the highlight of our honeymoon to south africa as the sea and mountains collide to give you natures best formed views

Ocean View. I've been here a few times, windy & sunny days. Great for beautiful views of Cape Town and its surroundings. Good for sundowners with friends or even ice cream. Also wheelchair friendly (noted & complimented by a friend from Hong Kong). You can also paraglide from Signal Hill. Parking can be a struggle if it's a stunner of a day, but that's Cape Town for you :)

Photoshoot . So I did my birthday photoshoot here. And it came out absolutely stunning. the views are incredibly beautiful. It does get a little chilly so I recommend on carrying a jacket. I also did the paragliding from here aswell , definitely something to add to the bucket list of things to do in Cape Town.
Get up on a clear day. Went up on a sunny day and the views of table mountain and Cape Town were amazing. Went paragliding from here the same day, can highly recommend it.

See Stunning views and people going off a cliff!. Forever views! Go on a nice, clear day and have your picture taken at the yellow frame with TableMountain in the background. No need to do selfies. All the visitors are willing and able to snap your pictures. And, a great bonus, try to catch a day when the hanggliders are launching themselves off the cliff! Wow! Live vicariously! The only drawback was the rest room. Below par, for sure.

I should have packed the wine and cheese!. If the Table Mountain funicular is closed, Signal Hill is a great alternative for the view. Loved the many picnic spaces available and the locals out having a drink. Best view of table Mountain in town.

Great views of Beautifu Cape Town. Not only is signal hill beautiful to look at from a distance, but to drive up signal hill and watch the sunset over Cape Town is amazing! You have amazing views in all directions. I recommend driving up before sunset and watching it go down over this beautiful city!

on a nice day you can see for miles. try to get up on a nice day as you get fantastic views across cape town both from the top and along the road up. it is an easy drive and can be linked with a trip up table mountain as the road is just across from the road to the lower cable car station.you can watch the paragliders take of and have a snack or coffee while up there.

Great place to see the city easily!. Easy to get to and well organised tourist attraction that gives stunning views of the city without the hike! Great for any evening or day to sit and watch the world go by in peace and mesmerizing views!
Beautiful!. Stayed in the Bo-Kaap area, beautiful view of Signal HIll, the entire Cape Town area is simply fabulous, make sure you see everything!

Commanding Views. The views, in all directions, were amazing. They give one a very good feeling of the lay of the land and sea in Cape Town. I'll save the visit to the top of Table Mountain for next visit.

Stunning View. This is a must for everyone in Cape Town as you can drive right up and that view took our breathe away.Do yourself a favor and pack a picnic too and watch the sunset as you will be sure to earn brownie points if you want to impress the special person in your life!

Awesome view!. Wow what a beautiful place. The view from the top of the hill was really amazing. You could really see the whole city! I bet it would be even lovelier at sunset when you get to see all the lights.. loved it!

Quick sunset tour with the Hoho bus. Lovely sunset view. Terrifying bus ride up on the upper deck of the bus through the sharp turns of the steep and narrow hill climb. Took the free night tour that came with the HOHO ticket. If I do this again, I would sit on the lower level. Haha! Bring a very small picnic. They barely give you time to wolf down a sandwich before you have to get back on the bus.
Great Phot Vantage Point. Definitely worth a trip up here at night to view the city and all its lights. Great photo vantage point

Romantic Evening on Signal Hill. There's no better spot in Cape Town for a nice romantic evening with other couple friends than being at Signal Hill. The view is beautiful, and the vibe is just lovely. Sitting there with friends, watching the sunset, it's just amazing.I love my Beautiful Cape Town. :-)

Just a short drive to the top. This was a lovely little hill to drive up and they were parasailing right from the top over the sea. It was really cool to see. You can take a hike on trails and its well maintained. After doing table mountain we road up and took a great picture through the huge frame of Table Mountain. Go up its nice.
Worth the drive. Lovely drive, with a great Kodak moment of Table Mountain framed by a yellow metallic structure...take your pic here on a clear day.

A fun stop if nearby. We had a fun experience at Signal Hill and we went for the canon fire at noon. The guard let me son "load" the canon -- but cover your ears, it's loud! A small stop, but don't go out of your way.
a summary of Cape Town. I loved the view and the fact that the whole of a city can be summarized from a location high above the city.
Good View. Gives you a good view of the city and Robben Island. Can get very busy especially if the Cable to Table Mountain is closed

Breathtaking views. We went at night. Try and go on a clear night when its a full moon.
Views cannot be describes, they have to be experienced.
Terrific view of Cape Town. Loved the view. Went twice - once for the view and a second time to watch the "noon gun". It was a cold windy day, but worth the ride up.
