My favourite place in Cape Town. Enjoy and aerial view of the City of Cape Town and the neighbouring harbour, especially at night. Although, please be vigilant as the level of crime has increased of recent times.
Great mountain drive. Wonderful drive along the mountainside. Great views of the city and other mountains. Be careful after dark.

Sunset. Obviously this is a great view of the ocean and the city bowl and is an easy drive from Cape Town. Sunset from here is a must do and the paragliders can be great entertainment. Take a bottle of bubbles and some friends and have a sun downer.

Nice View. Signal Hill is driveable and does give a good view of the city but it is not nearly as magnificent as the Table Mountain view which you take the cable car up. I would go see Table mountain if you have to choose between the two.

Spectacular. 10 mins drive from Table Mountain Cable Car, this hill offers a closer view of the city with Atlantic Ocean in backdrop.An ideal place for paragliding takeoff. Make sure you book in advance with one of the tandem paragliding companies.This hill is used as a takeoff point for para-gliders. All you need to do is be prepared for a couple of hours before you start flying over the city and ultimately over the ocean.Also ideal for sunset views. A drive down the signal hill towards camps bay and beach road has some amazing sea front restaurants. WORTH IT

Wonderful Overlook of the City. Unfortunately we arrived at the top of Signal Hill on a terribly cold, rainy, and windy afternoon, but we were on a tour, and that was the only time we could go there. The views were spectacular, and I imagine it would be a great place to visit on a nice day as one can walk around the area, picnic and enjoy 360 degree views.

Wonderful views. This place had great views. Most people seem to stay near the parking area but we took a little stroll away from it and were greeted by some of the most impressive views we've seen while in South Africa. Naturally we also took a picture with Table Mountain in the background.This is a must-go place, but absolutely go on a little walk away from the masses.

A very Beautiful Mountain piece. Signal Hill is a very beautiful attraction which is not far from Canal Walk.It is a breathtaking hill to see.Beautiful trees surround Signal Hill.The very essence of nature is seen all around it.Too Awesome for words.

Wonderful views of Robben Island, Table Bay and the Atlantic Seaboard. Visited here on a beautiful winter's afternoon. Parking is a problem and there are no attendants to help monitor and direct cars to parking bays. It was heartening to see how many people were braving the chill to enjoy the fresh air and spectacular views. We took a lovely stroll along the pathway surrounded by many spring flowers already in bloom in spite of the chill. Overall, a most enjoyable outing.

Amazing sunset....must do when in Capetown. As a fan of sunsets this has to be the best yet.Signal hill offers a great view of Capetown sunset, the hill is also well set up for viewers, netting on the ground, car park etc.Get a picnic and a few drinks with your friends and spend a few hours up there watching the amazing sunset.Definitely a must do when in Capetown.
Picture This. It can get a little breezy and cold on top of the hill in winter. However, the beautiful panaromic views of Cape Town are worth it. The giant picture frame is a blast to pose in!

Spectacular view. Awesome view of Table Bay, Robben Island and Lion's Head. Not much shade, so sunscreen and a hat is a must on Summer days. Awesome for a picnic or if you just feel like getting out of the buzz of the city... with that said, you may struggle to find parking at times. A must see!
Best Sunset Ever. Just don't miss the sunset, one of the best photo shots i took in my whole trip. There is a toll fee that you have to pay twice, when going there and coming back.

Disappointing, nothing special!. Ohh where do I start! it really is nothing special, and the chaos and amount of people arriving on top for the sunset is just not worth the time! View is average, Lions head and table mountain are WAY better. It took us 2 hours to drive down. TOTAL WASTE OF TIME!

Alternative to table mountain. During early days of August, table mountain cable was closed. Hop on hop off bus (Red line) ascends to the signal hill instead. It is not as high as the table mountain and no need for waiting cues , but definitely easier and cheaper to visit but it deserves the visit. The view is spectacular. Wild life is diverse. Ambience is cool and comfortable. There are several food stalls and comfort room.

Fantastic views. Fabulous views across to Table Mountain when the Table Mountain cableway is closed. Good parking and walking trains. Also visited by the Hop on Hop Off bus if you don't have your own transport

Disorganised Chaos At Sunset. The drive up is initially very quiet but don't kid yourself... you won't be the only ones who though this would be a great place to watch the sunset, at the top of the single lane road there are HUNDREDS of people who though the same, all in cars trying to U-turn!Great views but park down the hill and walk :)
The Noon Day Gun. At 12 noon every day the noon day gun is fired. It is an exciting moment as the gun goes off. The provides a very good view of the city and suburbs

Nice Views, but nicer nearby. If you have the time, it's much better to climb up Lion's Head, or if you aren't quite athletic enough to do the climb, table mountain seems like it would be an obvious alternative.

Best place to watch the sunset. Very close to the city and easy to get to. Drive your car all the way up and park on the top of the hill.Enjoy the spectacular views and take some photos of the city and the amazing views of Lion's Head.The best time to visit is before sunset. Be careful when driving down at night.
Amazing view!. Amazing view! Took the hop-on/hop-off bus, sitting on the upper deck. It was amazing (and "scary") driving the rather narrow roads to the top. It is safe though....

There is a view worth seeing. I came here with the red sightseeing bus and this was the reason I came here. Anual maintenance on the cable car to Table Mountain and the bus went to Signal Hill instead
Stunning views. Parking may be a bit of an issue, but if the weather permits, its avery unique experience. Must visit
Great sunset. Great vantage point to watch the sun go down, parking available and offers a different angle of the sights of Cape Town.
My Beautiful Cape Town. Another very nice lookout point. Nice to visit. No restaurants. Some walking trails. The flora is very interesting and there is also a Muslim shrine close by to visit, Enjoy!
Best view for sunset. Be sure to drive here for sunset! You can simply park and enjoy the panoramic views from the top. Well worth a visit. Parking, picnic tables and clean ablutions.
Amazing Views. The cable car was closed for maintenance so we drove to the top of Signal Hill. Amazing 360 degree views. Great way to see Cape Town from up above.

Great Views over the city, the coastline to the south and across to Robben Island. We visited Signal by car at night and during the day on the bus tour. There was a 'Law Enforcement' presence in the car park on both occasions and there are public toilets there too.

beautiful at sunset. Went up by taxi for sunset, very reasonable prices. Wonderful views and you can even paraglide!
A great stop off before dinner

Enjoy nature. Signal Hill is the back drop to our guest house....we walk the trails often on winter and summer. There a beautiful views all around and many spots to sit and watch the sunrises or sunsets.

Stand Guard at Signal Hill!. The Signal Hill site is an intriguing one that lies in amongst Cape Town CBD and overlooks Sea Point, Green Point and Waterfront.The whole of Signal Hill resembles the body and head of a lion! On one side is the historic Lions Battery, which is home to Noon Cannon and various other battle worthy guns! As you leave the Battery and look across to the other side of the ‘hill’ you can see the iconic Lions Head, which is very striking and worth viewing!If you do get a chance to visit Signal Hill then aim to visit around 13:00 so you can hear the cannon being fired at extraterrestrial invaders! Only joking! The Battery was introduced for protection during old wars and also as a weather warning station, provide mooring instructions to ships and to warn the people of Cape Town of ship’s that are in a spot of bother and of those that may well crash into the harbour area.In any case, a chance to get a good vantage point for seeing most of Cape Town makes it a worthwhile venture!

Incredible Views, Horrendous Traffic. The view alone is worth going up for. Watching the paragliders is amazing. Its definitely worth going up to view the sun set. Although I wouldn't recommend going up late at night or alone. It is a hot spot for crime once it gets dark .
Good Views of the City and Robben Island. Good Views of the City and Robben Island,Worth going at night to see the lights from up there, but don't go alone, as there are robberies etc.

A view of the Cape. Here you will find another lookout destination for parked cars at midnight - making out or midnight snacking! (who knows?!)Quit romantic isn't it? Hence it is a popular picnic spot!
Alternative to table mountain. if the time you go the CT is cloudy and the cable car is closed, this is an amazing second best, so all is not lost

Sunset splendour. We drove here just before sunset on a beautiful clear winter's day. The sunset was superb and gave great views of the whole of Cape Town. We also watched a couple of hang gliders leaping off the hill and soaring into the air.
Flying High. Good fun, wonder photo opportunities, thrill seeking paragliding launch sight, great walking trails, see the lights of the Cape at night.
Great views. Great views over Cape Town and the seaside areas . You can paraglide off here, which is pretty fun .

Signal Mountain. Because Table Mountain was closed, we chose this next highest point from which to view Cape Town. It is extremely windy up there, and helps you to understand the winds experienced in this beautiful city on the Atlantic. Every noon a cannon is fired.

Amazing view for cape town. Its hard to get there without a taxi. But i think city sight seeing provide a lift their with a reasonable charge. It was windy and cold so if you are going in winter bring something warm

Views for days!. Great viewpoint to watch the sunset over the Atlantic Ocean, or early morning for the sunrise. Pack a picnic, bring a jacket and blankets as it can get chilly. Great photo opportunity of Table Mountain. Do not leave your valuables in the car!
Take your time. My parents told me that they used to see the new year in from Signal Hill. It must be fabulous at the start of the year but glorious at any time
Breathtaking sunset!. Make sure you go there to view the sunset! Take some wine and some blankets if you go in the winter. Its absolutely worth it!

For the not so energetic. If you are not feeling energetic enough to walk up Lions head then this is a good alternative to get a lovely view of the city and Atlantic sea board as you can drive your car to the look out point.

Great views over Cape Town. Although nowhere as good a view of Cape Town as Table Mountain, the top of Signal Hill does offer a good alternative if one cannot go to Table Mountain because of the weather. The road snakes it's way up the hill and eventually arrives at a picnic/parking area at the top. The views are great of Cape Town itself and only miss the beach side that one can see from Table Mountain. Robben Island can be seen from this look-out.

Short drive and fantastic views. It is a real short drive from town to go up Signal Hill, and has very rewarding views. Good if considering suicide - just joking, but very steep hills! Wouldn't want to drive over the edge

return from signal hill after sunset. Hop off Hop on bus offer to enjoy sun set over there but they don't provide return trip. It is close to table mountain but to return into the hotel is risky at night
Great overlook of the city!. Our driver took us to Signal Hill when Table Mountain was closed and we were pleased with the gorgeous views. Great place to stop and take pictures!

Must watch Sunsets!. Cape town is truly beautiful but nothing beats the unmissable sunsets on the top of signal hill. A good trek from the bottom to the top of signal hill takes a good one hour but to the end that by watching the sun go down is truly spectacular.

Great Sunset Views. Oh I love taking friends and family up Signal Hill for sundowners. It's a beautiful spot to see the sun set over Cape Town and a must for visitors. You can also bring a picnic basket up the hill or go tandem parasailing for a fee. Plenty of spots you can stop while driving up the hill to take in the beauty of Cape Town.
Fantastic Views. Views are out of this world. There are different stops and you can park and view the stunning views. At night the lights are quite amazing and the sea views are out of this world.

Cape Town from up high. If your time falls short and there is to many people at the Cable way up Table mountain your next best option is to visit Signal hill for an exceptional view over Cape Town and Table Bay. Great to spend some quiet time here overlooking Cape Town.

An easy car ride or hop on red bus. Signal Hill is a popular sight seeing spot for locals and visitors, especially if Table Mountain is clouded over. GREAT VIEW including Waterfront. Bloughbergstrand, Cape Flats and it all Free. You can have an unspoilt view from West to East overlooking the whole of Table Bay. Walk to LIONS Head above Signal Hill dress warm and take a jersey and water. From Lions Head you can see more of Sea Point, Bantry Bay, Clifton and Camps Bay etc. NIGHT VISITS ARE NOT ADVISABLE unless you go in a group.But the City lights are a beautiful sight. It maybe a lovers spot but can be dangerous. It's almost a mini Table Mountain . No restaurants and weekends are busy.
Plan B. If Table mountain is closed due to weather, Signal hill is a nice option for viewing the city. You get a nice view in all directions and is worth the short easy drive

Kannonkop. Other than Table Mountain, Signal Hill is one of the best spots to view the Western Cape area. On the way, you pass through some delightful seaside towns such as Seapoint, Hout Bay, Camps Bay, etc. Signal Hill is just what its name signifies. A cannon on top of the hill signaled the arrival of ships to the farmers so that produce could be hauled to market for sale. Fruits and vegetables were important to curb ship-born diseases such as scurvy, rickets, and other vitamin deficiencies as ships were at sea for months at a time. Signal Hill is a great stop on the way to the wineries located in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek.

Amazing Running Route. While nothing can compare to the grand Table mountain, however, the signal hill, its beloved little son attracts hordes of athletic fanatic everyday. If you love an easy hike, trail running, or road cycling, this is the place to be. When there is no fire, the main scenic road is a lot less busy than other roads in cape town that offers this kind of view. I run the signal hill everyday and it gave me the legs of steel.Pro: Free view, legs of steel.Con: Possible mountain fire.Tip: If you are an runner, begin your route at the end of Poyser road in Tamboersloof, that route is one of the best kept secret of running route of Cape Town and don't you tell anyone about it. You will somehow always end up on the signal hill, no matter which cross road you take along the trail. It will take you about 30min max to the top of the main road.
No Necking on the hill.. This is a great spot to view the magical Cape Town. Keep your doors locked though. Like lots of places like this in the world, break ins can spoil a night out there.
quite boring. We went for the noon gun. The lecture about the history was a it too long and the gun shot was just a bang. nothing special

Perfect View. Go at dawn or sunset the view is spectacular
Take picnic basket, watch the artists at work or go paragliding.
Or just simply take in the breathtaking view. It is truly a must see. And the drive up is quite an experience

Sunset and Moonrise at the same time. One of the few places where you can really catch the sunset and moonrise at the same time.
Just beware of heavy traffic just before sunset as you may miss it. Parking is horrendous at the top and may warrant a short hike if you don' want to get trapped in traffic after the sun sets.
Very good place for families. I went with my 2 young kids and friends. We had a picnic there and enjoyed watching the sunset. The scenic view was fantastic!

Biggest BANG in Cape Town . The excitement builds as the seconds ticks down, ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one BANG......... THE LOUDEST THAT I HAVE EVER HEARD. Stand on the city side of the cannon to experience the sonic wave coming from the cannon. For the first time I got sone sensation of what the sailors, firing these cannons, sometimes a hundred of them on a tall ship, would have experienced. They all must have been deaf.

Easy access and great views. Signal hill is great because it's the only hill/mountain in Cape Town that you can drive to the top of. It was a 15-20 minute drive from central Cape Town. The top has great views of the city, Robben Island, and the southern suburbs.

Beautiful but not safe alone. The view is incredible and it's a definite must for any local or traveller to go to our beautiful Table mountain and others - but they are known for muggings and are generally not as safe as we'd like them to be.This being said, apply some good common sense and go in a group during the day and be vigilant. Don't carry valuables and while I'd like to say leave your expensive camera's at home, we all know you want those amazing shots... just be careful please.
Best Sunset Views. Great views of the city. Great sunset viewing. Grab a picnic or just a bottle of champagne, sit back, and let nature blow you away...

Look at the view. Peaceful to forget of the city nice view of Cape Town nice to have a picnic at sunset BUT very unsafe to not go there alone, ladies please to not go there alone they will try to target you and rob you please be safe there

What a View!. I took my kids up to Signal Hill for Ice-cream as the sun went down over the ocean, the view was spectacular and made for the best photo opportunities, with a 360 degree view of the whole of Cape Town City, beaches, Robben Island & Mountain this is a must

Limited time? This is a quick tourist attraction.. A great vantage point to see the whole of Cape Town as well as the Atlantic Seaboard. While it is roughly half the altitude of Table Mountain, it is accessible by car, is free and usually no queueing. An ideal venue for first time visitors to Cape Town to get their bearings.
beautiful views. beautiful views of Sea Point,Green Point,Camps Bay and the sea.Best to go early morning.Take your camera with

Venture early morning😎. A must do on my 'bucket list' Was I disappointed ' oh No' ! What a fab view of Cape Town , table mountain & the ocean. Breath taking is all you can say. Once again this is a photographer dream. But most people will not fail to take some amazing photos. We decided to venture up very early in the morning. While it wasn't to hot. You will not be disappointed I guarantee you.
Noisy but wonderful. Great experience unless you don't like loud noises. The cannon is set off at noon and there is an explanation of the history of this location. The view is fabulous.

Great Views..!!. Signal hill provides great views of Cape Town, Table Top Mountain and the Sea.!! There is a yellow stand overlooking the signal hill for taking pictures.We were with a group and had a great time!

Best view!!!. Most amazing view when on top of Signal Hill. You do not have to be super fit to do this. I had a major back operation a year ago and that did not stop me. Important: go in groups or early morning. Do not go on you own. The last part is a bit steep, but not impossible. Families with pets are climbing which makes it a nice outing. Definitely recommend!!!!

Spectacular viewpoint. Signal hill is a great outing and best of all it is totally free. Signal hill has a great look out over Cape town and a panoramic view of the sea. Often para-gliders launch from this hill which is a great spectacle. Many walking trails also start from the parking lot. Overall this is a must see when you are in Cape town.

Sunsetting bliss. Compulsory "to do" on your bucket list. Grab a bottle of sparkling, your picnic blanket and take in the breathtaking sunset on this magnificent venue. For the more adventurous, hike a little further and capture the moment on the rooftop of a derelict building a few meters down the trail.
Nice place. We droved up here in the afternoon. Difficult to find parking lot, but we managed that. Nice place to be.
Romantic view.. Wow its impressive to see the view from here. Pack a picnic basket of a beer or two and watch the sunset from there with friends or your loved one.

picnic and sundowners. great place to watch the sunset.. take a picnic... grab a few friends...don't forget a blankie... also.. be sure to take some lighting for once the sun goes down.. and something warm to wear when sunsets...
nostalga. Lovely views of an awsome view of Cape Town. The road is good and we were blessed with perfect weather

Great Views. We visited Signal Hill in November 2014 and go back as often as we can as we really enjoy the views from up there. We visited when the hope star was still up there and man was it a beautiful sight!!!

Must See in a Cape Town Visit. What's great about Signal Hill is that you can drive there in 5 minutes from downtown, drive to the very top, and for free, enjoy your sundowners or just enjoys the views. It's incredible when the sun is going down over the ocean, and from different points along the drive up there you can see the entire city of cape town, and across to table mountain. I like looking down on Sea Point and the beach below, at Robben Island in the distance, at the big tankers waiting for clearance to come into the sea port. You can also watch the paraglider take off, or go paragliding yourself with one of the many companies that take off from here. Great, short, free visit.
Great place for a picnic. I love to go up here and have a picnic with friends and watch the sunset and maybe have a beer or two ! highly recommended.

Full Moon Hike. This is amazing and really fun to do with friends and family and also good for fitness. you can take some food and water with and enjoy the sunset and watch as the moon lights up cape town really amazing views and lots to see at the top.

Short drive for a view. Signal Hill provides nice views of the city and ocean - but we didn't find a lot more to it than that. If you just want another viewpoint other than Table Mountain, then the drive up is worth it. We have not hiked on this mountain yet, but I believe there are trails around which may cause me to improve my current rating.

Different views of the city. We have visited Signal Hill numerous times and for different reasons - we have sat and watched the sun go down and enjoyed a glass of wine and a picnic. If you plan to do this in the summer and at the week end then be warned - it can be very difficult to find a parking space. We have been a taken pictures of us in front of Table Mountain and pictures of the 12 Apostles and Robben Island and the city of Cape Town.My girlfriend is much braver than me and also went for a tandem paragliding ride off of Signal Hill and down into Sea Point. This is not a cheap experience (approx R1100) but for the adventurous it is a tick in the box and great fun.This is another place to chill out relax with a food, or a nice cream or just coffee. Every day the views are different from here.

Beautiful cape view from signal hill. Giving a panoramic view of the cape coast and the waterfront, Signal Hill is a beautiful place one can admire the beauty of nature while overlooking the amazing expanse of Cape Town. The road, although uphill/downhill offers pleasurable curves and enough room to maneuver. It however should not be used for drifting and drag racing -- especially in areas where there are no guardrails.A haven for bikers and joggers, the ascent (and/or descent) from signal hill is a good exercise for many and will be one pleasant and memorable experience.

Best views over the coastline. My super duper mega tip: come here when the city is drowned in fog and you will get a spectacular view of a "floating" table mountain. And it's also a great spot for sunsets. You can hike up here or come here by car. Both are scenic ways to see the city from above. It might not look like much if you are down but once you are up the view is so much better than you expected. You can see the iconic face of Table Mountain as well as Lion's Head, the stadium, waterfront and city centre. Just stunning! And you can do paragliding as well!

best for Sunsets. a great experience to join all the other expectant visitors with their drinks and picnics waiting for the magical sunset. A great atmosphere and the views of Cape Town in the dark on the way down after the sun has set are just as impressive.
A great place to watch the sun set. Stunning views of the centre of Cape Town and the Olympic Stadium. A perfect place to watch the sun set. Not to be missed

Sunset. If you want to watch amazing sunset then you must go up to Signal Hill. The view of Cape Town from signal hill is beautiful. It gets really cold when the sun sets so be prepared. The parking and traffic is the only issue so better go early.

Perfect is the word. took a sunset tour with capetown city sightseeing and it was magnificent... to watch the sunset over the ocean was wonderful then the city lighten up ow boy the most amazing thing ive ever seen!! the star of good hope was also beautiful... visit this its worth a try
Great views. Great place to visit if the clouds are over table mountain. Drive up and park, walk around and even stay for the sunset, such great views and it's Free

Great view of Cape Town and the Table Mountain. If you want to see Cape Town and the Table Mountain and you are looking for an easy hike or hill you could even drive to Signal Hill is your place to be in Cape Town. When we were in Cape Town we run up the hill (and met there many others doing the same). Up there you have on the one site Cape Town and on the other the ocean. So Signal Hill is the more easy choice for good view over Cape Town where you can also see the Table Mountain and enjoy the sunset. The tougher but even better place would be Lions's Head.

Good replacement when cable way is closed. Still a beautiful place to visit when the cable way from the table mountain is closed.The view one get from various directions is also very good.unfortunately when weather is windy or misty to get all the way up there could be a bit disappointing

View Cape Town bu night!. It is a very nice drive up Signal Hill, very scenic.Time yourself such that you can see the sunset going up, great view! Once at top the view of the city is amazing, as it starts to get dark and the city lights come up, the view changes dramatically.A must visit.
Go at dusk. Great views of Cape town from this vantage point. Some fantastic photo's obtained in particular of table mountain. The city lit up in the early evening looks wonderful.

Noon Day Gun. It is known for the Noon Gun that is operated there by the South African Navy and South African Astronomical Observatory daily @ 12noon. The guns on Signal Hill were used to notify the public when a ship was in trouble and there was a possibility of casualties on the coast near Cape Town. Three guns would be fired from Chavonnes Battery, followed by a single gun in answer from Imhoff Battery. A definite must do!

A drive with a view!!!. Every time we visit Signal Hill we enjoy the lovely view of the bay-area as well as watching the para-gliders coming and going. A nice place to visit with out-of-town guests and definitely a must on your sightseeing-list if you go for a drive on a lovely sunny day. If you don't mind a bit of traffic and are willing to wait patiently for a parking-space you'll be rewarded with the beautiful views and wonderful photo-opportunities. For the more-active - a nice hiking trail as well.
Great views. Great views. Peaceful, and a reasonable climb/hike too. Best go with friends though. Has had its fair share of falls.
best view of the whole cape town. this is nice place for picnics and to sight seeing especially at night where the beauty of cape town lights illuminating the beauty of mother city
Great view. A great view of Cape Town. Parking is limited and is full at peak times. Better to go early.Make sure you have your camera as you will want to take photographs.

if you want a view of CT. This is one of the first places i went when we moved to South Africa, here you can do paragliding as well as have a picnic with a great view to Table Mountain on one side, and the sea in the other side. At the top you have a place to park as well as a public bathroom. Many poeple goes for a run here. And whilst you go up (i recommend by car) you can have a spectacular view of all CT city. There is no restaurant but in summer there are little moving car posts selling ice cream and sodas.
Signal Hill view. If you want to have a nice view over the Cape Town get up to the Signal Hill - you will see nicely the Table Mountain, the city, harbour and Lion head as well.

Great views of Capetown below. Although not as tall as Table Mountain, one gets great views of Capetown. If the weather is not good to go up table Mountain, one can get great views from Signal Hill, and it's free to drive up. If you get there by 11:45 AM, you can get a free guide that explains the history and significance of Signal Hill. This culminates with the firing of a cannon at exactly at noon. You could set your watch by the loud boom. This is actually what people did at one time.

need to visit at night. I think during the day time, it is good to see the city from Table Mountain, but at night the view from Signal Hill is so beautiful, when I was visiting it was fullmoon, so view was spectacular, I could see the night city and mountains.
Why not. Free lookouts or a walk up the heights. In some ways the views are as good as from the top of table top mountain.
Wonderful. beautiful drive up signal hill, great scenery along the way, amazing views of cape town, perfect for a quick sun downers and getting out the camera
Great view. The noon gun always welcomes everybody. Spectacular view above Cape Town. Wonderful Setting with the view ont Table Mountain as well. A must see for all visitors to Cape Town.
Sunsets. The greatest place to see the sunset. So many people and a wonderful atmosphere. Unfortunately the traffic/parking is a bit of a problem.

Interesting view of the city. Nice view of the city and Bo Kaap neighborhood.
This hike can be completed by climbing Lion's head (even better!)

Boom!. Signal Hill - where the BOOM goes off for the noon gun to signal the noon of day at 12:00.
Also a lovely view from the top on a clear day and there also I believe walks from there.

A great place to enjoy a Cape Town sunset. Cape Town is filled with places to enjoy great views. One place that I recommend visiting once is signal hill for a sunset viewing. The viewpoint looks out over the ocean from 350metres above sea level. There is limited parking so I advise going early to get a spot.

Stunning View. Whilst a fraction of the height of Table Mountain, Signal Hill affords stunning views of the city, the mountain and Ocean. We have been here many times and in some ways, it is better if the sea mist/fog has come in. When we drove up this time, there was extensive but shallow sea mist that did not really extend beyond the ocean making for some spectacular views. Well worth the very short and easy drive from the city.
Views & more. was a bit foggy when we were there the 'track'up there a bit 'hairy' make sure you can convert your money from Rand back to your currency at the shop
Great view. A wonderfull place to take pictures of table mountain and Robin island. Spend an hour at sunset with a bottle of bubbly and watch the sun set into the Atlantic.

Awesome walk. If you afraid of heights and want an easy hike up to a stunning view point so you can see Cape Town then Signal Hill is perfect. They even have paragliders (I think that's right) on top if you brave enough. We ran back down on the road just to change it up a little which was awesome.

Not for the fainthearted!. So, one morning after breakfast my metro-chick sister decides we should tackle this little hill in her backyard. Only 30 degrees outside, but who am I to argue. I come from the Karoo after all - we are hard core there. Half way up the slope I knew that this hill is not for those of us who find a more than 5 km stroll a bi taxing. My hubby and the boys kicked its bushy tail and told me after that it was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! Be sure to do it in the early morning. Take a hat and at least two bottles of water.

Have to visit this place during the day. Beautiful views, you can bring your picnic basket and chill out. At night may be a little dangerous (from what i've heard) Rather do a day trip and visit Signal Hill.

Unique views of Cape Town. From Signal Hill you get very unique views of the city bowl, the harbour, Seapoint, Camps Bay and even Table Mountain. The current huge art exhibition adds an interesting touch.
Fantastic viewpoint. Great spot to appreciate Cape Town. Wonderful yellow post card like thing with Table Mountain in the back that you can pose in. Paraglided off this - highly recommend.
Burning Horizon. Excellent view of Cape Town, day or night. Sunsets are special. Take a picnic basket and camera and wait for the sun to set or the moon to rise. Both are equally stunning!
Worth it. Not a place for many activities but worth visiting the place for good view of the town ship. NOON GUN is a bit funny but very traditional.

Stunning view of Cape Town city lights at night. We lived in Cape Town area for a number of years and every time we return we still go to Signal Hill to see the city lights at night - truly stunning.CAUTION - be security conscious - recently there have been some violent attacks on tourists - mainly to rob them - so if you stop to leave the car make sure you do so in the company of others - don't stop alone in an isolated area.

Excellent View. Sure, everybody knows by now that for sunset you have to drive up Signal Hill. But we especially enjoyed the views to the other side than all the tourists that have been there. Most people have a quick look at the town when driving up but then concentrate on the sun setting over the sea. Even more spectacular, however, is the view down on the city with the table mountain in the back. In our case the mountain was again covered by some clouds reflecting the light of the setting sun. Amazing.

Fun throw back activity. We were with a guide who got us to Signal Hill just before noon to hear the short amusing talk by the cannoneer. After a warning to stand back & protect our ears, the count down proceeded. The force of the cannon will ripple through your body & surprise you. The view is excellent.
Pretty lights. Signal hill has a great view of the city lights at night. I would recommend buying a coffee and driving up there to view the sunstar light and also the city lights.

Not a lot to do but definately worth it. It is a local tradition to drive to the top and toast the sun going down over the ocean.. On a clear day you have a perfect view of Cape Town and the Table mountain. Worth doinf for these views and the inevitable photo using the Yellow Frame.... :-)You wont spend much time here but it is definately is worth doing.
They were jumping off WHAT???. We were at signal hill as the folks were jumping off the mountain with para gliders. What fun to watch.

A Quick visit to Signal hill Magnificant. We stopped there for a half an hour before we headed to Aquila private game reserve its very nice view from there you can take nice pictures and you can ride from the hill to the beach by Parachout .

Signal Hill. Another great viewpoint. Met an artist who tried to make a difference with apartheid and was very passionate about his art for political reasons. Very nice place to stop with more beautiful views.
cool history lesson. our tour guide took us here for the noon gun. it was a beautiful sunny day so we got to take in the city below. the gun explosion was very loud, and so cool to see.

sunset at signal hill is a must!. Took the city sightseeing hop on & off bus that took us up to Signal hill for sunset - AMAZING! Definitely a must to do - just make sure you carry something warm (sweater/cardigan/jacket)as the winds are something else!!
Great view. This spot is well worth a visit. The view of Cape Town is excellent and if you are a photographer it is well worth the effort to take your camera for a few snaps.
VERY HILLY. Multicolored houses in narrow but steep streets...very nice coffee bars and eating places.Only for the fittest to walk to.

Awesome Cape Town Views. I grew up in Cape Town and did not go up Signal Hill even once. When down on holiday now and put off by Cable Car ques, I decided to go up Signal Hill. WOW, what stunning views of the City and surrounds. Even more fun was watching the para glider crews doing tandem jumps. Its well worth the drive, easy to get too and no crowds.

Take Your Visitors Here To Impress!. We always take our visitors to Signal Hill with impressive views of the area. Parking a bit difficult at times, great site for watching the tandem para gliders. Great place to take a picnic.
Watch the sun go down. Go early, take a blanket, dress warmly and snack on some cheese and wine while Watching the sunset over the ocean and the city lights switch on in the city bowl.

Check out the Sun Star too!. Awesome views here, and much less weather dependant too.Some good hiking trails are available but we chose to drive to the upper level and check out the " Sun Star"!This should be an attraction on its own. Made from wire, metal from Robben Island, it's is solar powered and well designed art.That leaves no carbon footprint. Also visible from most of the town at night. It is best described, as a star with a globe inside, that faces Robben Island and offers a beacon of hope for all.
Highly Recommend. This is a great spot to get that perfect photo of Table Mountain. Not very crowded, at least in April. Easy to get to via car.

Great views at sunset.. this is a must for anyone looking for a romantic vista in cape town. get there about 15min before sunset.it will be busy, and the road will be congested, But it is well worth it.The photo opportunities are great, walk to the the top after the sunset and look back over the lights of cape town.we caught an uber up there and had him wait, $32USD for 90min.
Watch the paraglider launch. We enjoyed a spectacular sunset on top of signal hill. We had been up earlier to paraglide and came back to enjoy a sundowner.

city of lights. So you did table mountain in the day, Signal hill is where you want to go to see the city at night. Not as high which is what you want to appreciate the city with lights glittering like a treasure chest
Beautiful. Great view for sunrise or sunset. I rode my bike up there - well worth the effort with great views of Table Mountain and the city!
Great view. If it's too windy to go to the top of Table Mountain (which has an even better view), then drive up Signal mountain for an excellent view of the city and the coast line.

Amazing sunset. During my 10 days in Cape Town, I found myself on signal hill 3 times. Once I saw the sunset, which was beautiful. Amazing view of cape town and table mountain, and more accessible than lion's head or table mountain.
Beautiful drive. Well worth the drive to watch the sunset and enjoy the beautiful scenery and views of Cape Town. It is a lovely spot

Nice but nothing out of this world. Pretty spot for pictures. We didn't do any exciting activities while at signal hill; however we did hear that there are all sorts of adventurous activities from this spot (i.e. paragliding). If you are looking for nice views, I would recommend Table Mountain instead.
Worth a short visit. Good photo opportunities with table mountain in background. Some paths for walking but not really suited for younger children.

Excellent drive and views spectacular. This is the best drive to get great views of the bay and the city. Get your bearings and don't forget the camera. It is not safe to be here when it is dark. There are a couple of picnic tables but tends to be very windy. This is a must do drive
Stunning and breath taking views. It was amazing to see the sunrise and sunset - absolutely breath taking experience. Definitely recommend that you hike up the hill if you can.

Great views . Went up with my family but had to park away from the main area as parking limited, but gave us an opportunity to see more of CT from the "HILL". Waited for an amazing sunset n watched as it turned to darkness & the mother city lit up. If it wasn't for the kids a few extra hours would have passed ... ☺

The view!. Many ways to reach this top, but we choose to drive up. A nice road and views all the way :-) On the top you can see the City Bowl, Robben Island, the whole Waterfront, beaches towards Clifton, and a lot more! Nice weather is a must! This is also a popular launching spot for paragliding. Enjoy! :-)
Good for sunset. Recommend the hike or bus ride up, take a couple of beers to enjoy as the sun goes down. You won t be alone up there!

SUNSET SUNSET SUNSET. If you're in Cape Town you MUST see the sunset from on top of signal hill, you can walk, cab, bus, or drive up the hill and on the top there is a man that sells coffee and drinks, and there was another man selling ice cream. Bring a bottle of wine and a blanket and sit out watching the sun go down. Amazing moment!

Rump of the Lion. For an unparalleled panoramic view simultaneously of the Cape Town City Bowl and Atlantic Seaboard, take the winding road from Kloof Nek to Signal Hill outlook. Filled with history of passing ships, kramats (Muslim shrines cladded in satin) and the contemporary Noon Gun, one can spend a satisfying 2-3 hours here.
Glorious sunsets. You can never get tired of the views from here but parking is limited and usually quite full. Its about a 8-10km drive from the City.
Great Scenes!. City Sightseeing Tour have a night Tour that takes you to view some breathtaking scenes at Signal Hill during the sunset time.

Sunset with a picnic is a must. It is a lovely end to the day to get up signal hill to watch the sunset. Do it on the site seeing bus to avoid the parking problem. large areas have canvas sheeting so that you can sit on the ground with the picnic but don't be surprised if the guinea fowl want to join you!

Best view of Cape Town. This is a free drive and is well worth the drive up the hill.Spectacular views of Cape town and Table Mountain. Great panoramic shots. Drive down is a little scary due to there not always being railing and the very sheer drop at points - there are guard rails at some of these. Highly recommended.

good views. Great views we paraglided off here but while we waited had an explore not a lot on top but if you want good views without loads of tourists good half day there is a cafe but would recommend a picnic
What a view.. You can view Cape Town and Table mountain from here. Do not forget the canon signalling every day at 12:00.

Nice view but about it. If you have extra time, by all means it is a nice view. But if only time for one place-or unless you want to hike Lion Head- kind of a time filler. However, the noon gun, which is lower down Signal Hill, is nice. Two cannons cast in the late 1700's have been signaling noon for the town and ships for 206 years. Quite a tradition. I was there for the 65,659th firing.
Awesome views. Well worth the trip up the hill, you get good views of the V & A waterfront and out to Robben Island, as well as down to the CBD and all the bays.

Sunset. Took the open top bus evening trip up Signal Hill to watch the sun go down. It was Easter Monday so the road was jam packed but would think it would be more sensible at other times. Brilliant view on a super evening
Amazing views over Cape Town. Amazing views over Cape Town. Also a good spot to take some amazing pictures to Table Mountain. The view of th eocean is amazing.
Oh what a lightshow. went there during the night to see Cape Town fold out below the mountains. Unforgettable view. Not sure how it looks at sunset or sunrise,but should be good as well

Go with sunset. You can come here by car. And this place is really special with sunset. If you go on sunday, go on time because a lot of people do this and there is a rally traffic jam just before sunset and you don't want to miss the sunset
Nightly event for locals and newcomers. Beautiful sunsets, they have even laid a cover on the ground to make it easier to sit on. Be sure to take a sweater or jacket.

A great way to see the city from another perspective.. Sure you will go up Table Mountain for the views but Signal hill gives a different perspective and is worth a trip up. You can walk around at the top and get views from all around the hill. Lots of people up there doing paragliding and hikes so didn't feel unsafe.
Best picnic sundowners. bring picnic to the paraglide spot. get a parking space at least 30 min before sundown, it gets packed and you can't get up/down

Mindblowing View. This was an awesome trip...Signal hill has a spectacular view to offer, no matter in which direction you look. There is the Table Mountain in the backdrop on one side (with a giant yellow frame giving you postcard type photo-op). The view to the sea, the mountain, Robben Island, V&A Waterfront, etc. is phenomenal. Parking is generally not a hassle but in peak tourist season you never know.

Spectacular views. Signal hill is an awesome place to view the sunset in cape town. It is easily accessible as you can drive to the top of the hill. Parking is however a problem especially during summer where you may be forced to park then walk a few metres to the top.From there you have a view of the Table Mountain, Lion's Head, City Centre and the atlantic ocean. The sun sets into the ocean so it makes for spectacular sunsets as well.I'd recommend this place if you like taking photos because you can photograph all key features of cape Town from here. There is no entry fee or closing time so you can hang out here all day and night.

Nice views!. Signal Hill is just uphill from the entrance to Lions Head hiking path (5 more minutes or less). It is where we went because paragliding takes off from this hill. There was a photo- op of Table Mountain in one of the famous Capetown yellow frames. It has a parking lot (free) and is a good stop for at least a peak around.
Well worth a visit. It's free but still offers excellent views over Cape Town. Also great fun watching the kite surfers.
Panorama. An excellent position to take some beautiful panorama photographs of Cape Town. The traditional cannon is fired at 12 noon. It can get a little windy but great for a little walk

Sunset drive on red city bus. A magnificent experience to see the sunset on Signal Hill. Add good company and the Hamper ordered from the Red City Tour office, and the evening is perfect. Good value for money.

Incredible view. The trip to signal hill is pretty and worth doing anyway, even though it is short.
Easy access from the city.
The view of Table Mountain from there is a must.
The view to the sea, the mountain and even Robben Island is phenomenal and should be added to your visit to Cape Town.

The Place to Start for Understanding Capetown's Geography. This is the first place to visit if you want to really understand "where you are". If you walk around and definitely on the drive up and down, it will give you a full 360 degrees views. This is especially true if the Table Mountain is fog covered or inaccessible because of strong winds, and if the weather or your physical fitness do not allow you to climb to the Lion's Head. Signal Hill is accessible to everyone and at any time during the day. Obviously visit it when it's not covered by mist and fog as well. We arrived on a much expected rainy day, after some terribly hot days which brought serious fires in the area. So Signal Hill was also with zero visuality and literally empty. No one was there. But then we continues to beautiful Hout Bay and returned towards the sunset. By that time the weather has changed dramatically, and dozens of people (mostly couples) were there to await another fantastic sunset, with amazing views.

Great alternative to Table Mountain. When we were in Cape Town it was particularly windy and the cable car up Table Mountain was closed so we decided to go and see the views from Signal Hill instead. It was definitely worthwhile! You can circle the top of the hill and get views from all sides including great views of Table Mountain and the V&A Waterfront. You can drive all the way up and there is parking available.
Fantastic views. Could have spent hours here. Great 360 degree views of city, Table Mountain, Signal Hill etc. Don't forget your binoculars to try to locate your accommodation!
Great view at sunset. Took the sunset tour with the Double Decker bus. Relaxing place with a gorgeous view of the city and its harbor.

Great viewing opportunity. Although not as high as Table Mountain, there is a road to the top with parking facilities and washrooms.The view is amazing with Table Mountain and its cable car behind you, and the V & A Waterfront, Cape Town Stadium and Robben Island in the distance.On the day we visited, para-gliders were launching from a designated area and we were able to watch them gently 'floating' down with the air currents towards the beach below.Although we had no problem parking in the middle of the day, I suspect it gets very busy around sunset if the weather is good.Also, apart from mobile vendors, there are no snack facilities up here but there is a washroom.Well worth making the drive up here.

Perfect Place to Watch the Sunset!. The views from signal hill are breathtaking and watching the sunset was simply beautiful. We also enjoyed the views of Table Mountain, Downtown and the V&A Waterfront on the drive to the top. Just a few tips if you plan on going to Signal hill at sunset; it gets very crowded and there isn’t much parking so get there early so you don’t miss the sunset trying to figure out where to park. Many people ended up parking on the side of the narrow road and had to walk a long way to the top so if you get there late you may not be able to get to the viewpoint before the sunset. Also be patient when you are ready to leave because the road will only have one lane open due to the cars parked on the side of the road. Traffic was pretty much at a stand still until the cars could zig zag around each other. But even with the traffic jam it was worth all trouble to view the sunset.

Always one of my favourites. Always one of my favourite places to visit with overseas visitors and it's free!It's a great drive to the view point, where there are toilets but no other facilities. From here you can enjoy spectacular views of the city, Robben Island, The Cape Town Stadium and of course Table Mountain.If your feeling brave take a paragliding trip back down to the bottom.From here if you have a vehicle, you have easy access to climb Lions Head, visit Table Mountain or drop down into Camps Bay to visit one of the many restaurants on offer.

View from Signal Hill. What a breathtaking view while you stand on Signal Hill watching the sunset most beautiful I have ever seen and the pathway bit narrow so not very accessible when high volumes of tourist arround and busses can become a bottle neck. Experienced this as the tour busses tried to turn around and with cars parking on the side of the mountain made it a bit congested.

Signal Hill. We ate at the Cape Malay Kitchen it is situated on the steep slope of Signal Hill which over looks Cape Town it is a very traditional Malaysian Restaurant No Alcohol served here but the food makes up for that. An amazing assortment of traditional dishes, egg rolls, very spicy potato rolls,and a buffet that was explained to us by the owner that had curries,carrots, and pineapples, shepherds pie with egg topping and curried beef spaghetti. wonderful food at this place excellent service and all at a great price.DM.WB

Nice view over the Capetown city. Defintely worth the visit with a lovely car ride up the hill. The cannon blast was worth filming the video but do cover the ears as it was deafening! - Tripod useful.. LOL
Beautiful Views. A great sight seeing expedition. Wonderful trails, bathroom facilities, and the most amazing view of the ocean and even Robben Island.

Higher than it looks!. Walked up from Bo Kaap. It was actually quite difficult to find the pathway up and had to backtrack several times. I am told, from my Cape Town friends that this s quite a dodgy thing to do as apparently there have been incidents of muggings in the vicinity. There is, of course a road which goes to the top which avoids all the nastiness but you miss out on historic Bo Kaap. Great views from the top.

Great Views of Cape Town. Great views once you're on top of Signal Hill. Best thing to do when you're here is to watch the cannon go off at noon everyday. It's something they've been doing for over a hundred years so I definitely recommend trying to make it.
Sunset view. Beautiful view from the top and actually all along the drive up ! Worth taking a picnic and heading up top for the sunset views.

Best view of Atlantic ocean. This was the first time we visited south africa. I tried to take unforgatable photos in the trip.we found it in signal hill among about 10 beautiful beaches near to Capetown.but if you had physical dyscomphort , you may some limitations to see there.
Don't miss this.. You get a fabulous view of Cape Town and surrounding area, plus the view of Table Mountain from here is brilliant.
Great Views!. The views over the city are brilliant. It is a great drive up there and its ideal to take a picnic. Ice cream and soft drink vendors are always around.
Great Sunset. Took a tour to Signal Hill for the sunset and a picnic dinner a very popular destination but well worth a visit views are spectacular well worth a look

It's all about the View!. Take a picnic basket and make sure that you are there before the late afternoon crowds.Find a pleasant spot en enjoy Table Mountain to your back and the Atlantic Ocean and Sea Point in front if you.Stay for sunset because on a sunny and wind free day,this must be just as spectacular as Table Mountain itself.And the best part,it's free!!!!!!

Great Views of Cape Town and Clifton. Really worth while doing this trip. Probably easiest if you have your own car. I think this is where you can book to do a par ascending trip. There are places to get coffee and snacks.

To enjoy the sunset. This is a place to enjoy a spectacular sunset if the sky is clear. It is only a within an hours drive from city center of Cape Town. Be there in time, it might be a lot of people arriving late, and there are a limited amount of parking space.

Most beautiful free sunset in Cape Town. The sunsets at Signal Hill in Cape Town are absolutely breath taking. The hill looks out over the ocean and the surrounding areas. You can take a bottle of wine with to enjoy. There is no entry fee of charges involved. I would recommend that you go an hour before sunset as a lot of people enjoy the scenery. There are also many walking routes up the hill if you are that way inclined. I'm not sure but I think you will need your own transport to get there, we used a friend's car.

Signal Hill Night Tour. Did a Cape Town bus tour to the top of Signal Hill. Watched the sun drop behind the ocean from the lawns on top of Signal Hill. Took with us our own picnic and found plenty of other people picnicking. Got some wonderful pictures of Cape Town Weather was perfect. Took the bus back to the Waterfront. We had an awesome time and found it a safe way to view Signal Hill during and after sunset. For a tourist - a must do.

Excellent view of Cape Town at night. We went up Signal Hill at night to look at the view of Cape Town. It is a spectacular view and worth the trip at night. Best to stay in the car when going at night.
View with a bang!. To listen well to the guide's story I moved closer and when the canon went off I went off too: I made a jump of a meter high, but it was an experience to never forget.

Perfect sunset location. Whether it's for an intimate wedding ceremony, wine for two or a family picnic Signal Hill is an ideal space to create happy memories while you inhale the stunning view. The addition of the Sun Star simply adds to the whole experience - http://www.suninternational.com/sunstar/Pages/default.aspx. If you go when its cold there is a coffee truck to help warm you up from the inside. There are toilet facilities and we have never experienced any safety issues.

Awesome views both night and day. Make sure to go both during the day and at night. The views are amazing!! At night, it is unbelievably different than during the day. A must do!! Great photo op for many reasons.

A good place for sunset and night view of the city. We follow the city sightseeing bus night tour to go for the sunset view at Signal Hill, it is a great experience to watch sunset and sea from the Hill with some quick bite for picnic. After sunset, you can have a great night view of Cape Town on the way down, which was fantastic.
Be Hear for the Noon Gun. Great elevated position above Cape tow with awesome views and they let of a Gun at noon daily! Worth a visit just for the views

Amazing Views. Signal Hill is the place to be in Cape Town for a fantastic sunset. It is gorgeous at any time of day, but dusk is particularly amazing! Once it's dark, start to head back down the hill and admire the breathtaking views of Cape Town at night. Safely pull to the side of the road and get some great shots of the beautiful city. There's a few trails on Signal Hill that are fun to check out and there's a great photo opportunity of Table Mountain.
fab sunset. viewing part of the city and the sunset from here is spectacular. it's a view that will stay in my eyes for long, long time
Easy Drive for an amazing view. An easy drive to get to the top and well worth it for the view over the city. Parking is easy at the top and, of course ther are braai facilities!

My favourite place to come just before sundown. If you head up to signal hill as the sun starts to set you won't be disappointed. It's perfectly safe as there are always lots of people around and the view over Cape Town is simply breath taking. This has to be on your to do list - if only for 30 minutes - if you are visiting Cape Town

SUNSET. I was invited by a photographic club to view the spectacular sunset, which is exactly what it is, spectacular. Unfortunately, as soon as the sun set, everyone started to leave quite hurriedly and, as this was my first ever visit, of course I questioned this - it seems that, after dark, Signal Hill is not the place to be. The new 'starburst' sculpture was amazing, totally off the grid and powered by many solar panels and can be seen from all around the 'City Bowl'. The parking was horrific with cars parked almost the entire drive up to the top of the hill with the actual car park itself being a nightmare with 2 of the tour busses also fighting for space. This is definitely a place to visit but only if you are aware of possible dangers.
Great view. table mountain closed so signal mountain a good choice for great views of Cape Town. Easy access by car. Good choice
Stunning Art. The new sculpture on Signal Hill is a must see. Its a beautiful compliment to the hill which at one stage was nothing more than a first date couples hang out.
signal hill. We liked the view, the peace and quiet and the old cannons.gives one a real sense of history.nice views of the harbour, the new stadium and the coast line

Short run up. The views from the hill are very good. But if you have already visited Table Mountain, then you can give this a miss. But in case the weather has been bad, and you cant go up the table mountain then you can get some good views from here. Its a short hill and the road is even, so you can try to run up the hill if you like to trek.

Sunset view to remember. We did this trip as an add on to the City sightseeing trip. We were taken by bus and by prior arrangement we had a picnic with wine waiting for us. We sat at leisure waiting for the sun to dip into the sea. It was spectacular. If you go up under your own steam you will find parking extremely difficult.
Good view. A very nice view for the sunset. Bring some wine, bread cheese and have a nice pic nic there. It's awesome.

A closer up, impressive view of Cape Town area and the surrounding sea. Recommended.
Signal Hill offers a closer up, impressive view of Cape Town area and the surrounding sea than the more expansive view from Table Mountain.
Drivers beware: there's ruts on the shoulders of the road, and, there's almost NO shoulders. Pay attention!
It's worth a visit.
Alternative view of Cape Town. Great place for great views. Gives one a great photo opp of Table Mountain with a huge yellow frame mounted that people can use to make instant framed photos!.

One of the oldest spots in Cape History. Haven't been there in years. It's never changed for over 200 years :-). It has has held cannons since the late 1600s for signaling purposes. Still does. a2 gun salute for in coming VIP ships, Noon day gun every week day :-). Visit once and enjoy. As I said.....hasn't changed much in 200 years. Okay It hasn't changed much in about 350 years lol......except the technology of the canon firing the charge :-).
Sunset is amasing. This is a view you will treasure all your days. Sunset at signal hill sitting at one of table drinking a glass of wine.

Lovers hill?. Great views and a great place to take a picture with Table mountain in the back ground. They have a postcard frame you can take a picture in. Many brought their bottle of wine and snacks, or you can order a picnic with your tour company. Beautiful views, great sunset, only issue.., it was freezing! :)

Use the Red City Sightseeing Bus for this. The traffic and parking up Signal Hill is crazy so the best way to do this is by using the Red City Sightseeing bus. The views are spectacular over the bay and of Table Mountain. Bring a picnic or at least a bottle of champagne. We didn't and were jealous as everyone around us was popping corks and munching away happily. Especially good for couples as it is a very romantic experience. Lots of Guinea Fowl wandering around which is cool to see especially if you have kids with you. If you drive yourself get there early and wait until everyone has gone before attempting to leave!

great views. Great views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Make sure to visit the artistic installation of the sun star. The structure was fashioned from repurpose fence from Robbin Island. Nice spot to have a picnic and no fees. Parking may be an issue at peak periods.

wonderful night tour, fabulous birthday treat. In January we took our daughter and son in law on the wonderful night tour, akk around the Peninsula and finally arrived at the top of signal hill. The views were stunning and, we enjoyed a wonderful picnic. If you want the tour company to provide a picnic hamper for you, it also looked nice and was ready and waiting for them when they arrived at the top. we stayed for about an hour to watch the sun set, and the best surprise of all was that there was lovely hot coffee available, as it does get quite chilly once the sun has set. Overall a wonderful evening, and really very reasonable - only R100 a head is really worth it, the entire trip lasts just under 3 hours so its money well worth it.

Okay - Great Views, too many cars and busses. The views were great. I would not suggest driving up in summer months as parking is inadequate and traffic is tremendous. Got stuck for hour+ and struggled to get car through spaces at time. Stressful overall

Great views, no entry fee. We visited Table Mountain but the wind had closed the cableway so we decided to try out Signal Hill for a view. It was fantastic and there is no gate or entry fee - just drive on up.

Amazing views, great for picnics and even paragliding!. Whether you want to just sit and relax taking in amazing views of Cape Town and the endless ocean, or have sunset drinks or jump off the hill on a paraglider - it is a wonderful spot to visit in Cape Town. No entrance fees but parking can be limited.
Fabulous views. Worth the drive up a rather narrow road for great views of the city and Table Mountain. And it's free!

Another good view of Cape Town. Another good view of Cape town from a different angle, view the new Sun Star sculpture which is a temporary art installation. It was constructed in a large part from the steel from the original fence that once surrounded Robben Island. The ultimate symbol of Apartheid has been transformed into an inspiring piece of art that stands as an invitation to the world to share their hope for the future of South Africa.

Paraglide your pants off!. what can I say?? If you care for even a little adventure, coupled with the most breathtaking views in the world.. Then, get yourself to the top of Signal Mountain, harness up with one of the friendliest tandem partner's you will ever meet and JUMP!

The Unforgettable View. The ride to the top is convoluted...like a road to nowhere...until you get to the top and city and the ocean comes alive below.The sunset is something to die for. And for the adrenaline junkies, a para-glide down to sea port will be an icing to the great experience
Excellent viewpoint. Signal Hill does not really offer more than a great look-out over Cape Town, Bloubergstrand and Robben Eiland. Worth a visit.
Great view of Cape Town. A drive up Signal Hill takes you to a great viewpoint to see Cape Town, and Robben Island in the distance.

Lovely Sunrises. I think Signal Hill is the lazy alternative to Table Mountain and Lion's Head, however, it's just as great. If you're not so fit, you can drive up and park the car safely. Sunrises are great there. Make sure to get a good spot because it's unfortunately not a secret anymore that the million-dollar snapshots are taken from this lookout, so you won't be the only one up there starting your day with a fascinating sight!

You must see the sunset from Signal Hill.. It is stunning to see the sunset from the top of Signal Hill. It is important to leave enough time at weekends as it can be busy, but it is worth every second.

Half way Table mountain. If you do not want to go up table Mountain, at least drive up Signal Hill and enjoy the views from there. Experience a sunset is even more spectacular. It can be very crowded and packed with cars.

star a star. new star artwork very thoughtful and clever.
robben island scraps and solar technology very appropriate for the hope powercuts and vision of future.

Hop on hop off sunset tour. Watching the sunset at Signal Hill was an amazing experience.
We did it with the hop on Hop off busses (tour included in the ticket) and were very pleased with the organisation. The picknick we ordered to go along was very nice as well. Highly recommended

Amazing views!. I went up at sunset, and it was amazing to see Cape Town with the sun going down over it. It was busy and hard to find a parking spot, so make sure you go up early to avoid the rush for sunset. The decoration on top is also amazing to see, a great dedication.

Go up to hear the gun. They fire the signal gun every day, well worth going up to hear it. Watching the hang gliders jump off the hill is exciting too, and if you're feeling brave you can even have a go.

Sunset. We went with the City Sightseeing Bus for the Sunset at Signal Hill. It is a beautiful view from there. It was very busy the night that we went but had a nice evening watching the sunset and have a few snacks and drinks
Freezing cold. Went in the evening to see the sunset. Unfortunately it was so cold and fairly cloudy we didn't get to see the amazing sunset.

Must Visit!!. Signal Hill is a nice palce in cape town.From there you can view the table mountain.There is a frame there for taking photo,wherein you can fit table mountain.One can climb and go till the signal hill.Place is very beautiful.I think one should go in summers only to get the best view of the nature.
S Afica 2015. Almost better than going up Table Mountain! Sunset up there with views of Table Mountain and the city were outstanding. Take a bottle of fizz and sit up there for an hour, memorable.

A Sunset Drive Up Signal Hill. Signal Hill - Cape Town’s best loved sun-downer spots. If you prefer to hike to the summit in the comfort of their car, this is an ideal sunset drive. Take a picnic basket and make sure to reach the top well before sunset. I will recommend an arrival time on the top of approximately 7:15PM as it gets really busy. You might get stuck in traffic to the top and miss the sunset completely. Don't forget your camera / iPhone as you would want to capture that breath-taking sunset. Stay a while after the sun set completely behind the horizon and watch the sky turn to beautifull pastel blue and pink. How to get there: Drive up Buitengracht road towards the mountain, which becomes Kloof Nek Road. On the top of the hill turn right into Signal Hill road. Drive further up the hill. There are many lookout points with the main Signal Hill lookout point. What you will see: The hill offers great views across the City Table Bay. It’s a truly magnificent spot to sit peacefully and take it all in. Please note to leave sufficient time to drive down as traffic is always at a stand still. Find something fun to do while being stuck in the traffic down hill.

Sunset. Great place to spend time as a tourist in your own city!! Pick a day with a few clouds in the sky for the best sunset. Take a picnic or snacks and some Grapetiser or MCC to celebrate the beauty. Spend time and savour the views.It gets very crowded around full moon. When the sun drops it can be chilly so take a jacket / sweater ... just in case.
Beautiful views. Relax and experience the views. Or hike and get some exercise. See Table Mountain and the Ocean. It is nice to be able to buy a drink at the top of the hill.

In 19012 or so Grandfather walked his family of 8 up the Signal Hill drive...... It was for the view, which as they climbed the hill from Carstens Street. It became wider and more interesting. While ascending from Tamboerskloof they viewed the mountain, Rhodes Memorial, many significant buildings and early shops in the major streets of the City. John Parker's Architecture and Buildings stood out so clearly to the naked eye.......Robben Island stood out from its limestone quarries - just apperntly a stones throw from the shoreline. The climbers then really appreciated the view of the 12 disciples caught in the afternoon sunlight. Fortunately the mayoral horse and carriage collected the family after a refreshing picnic - enjoying the 360 degree view and delivered the family back home in the Firs.

Panoramic Peninsula Views. It was a beautiful sunny Sunday afternoon and paragliders were very actively flying from Signal Hill. We could enjoy breathtaking views of Robben Island in the distance, Green Point Stadium below, the Port of Cape Town, the city center, Table Mountain and Lion's Head. The temporary 8-pointed SunStar sculpture was not quite as impressive by day as it seems to be by night. Signal Hill is great for hiking and has nice picnic spots.

Perfect to photograph Table Mountain. I was torn as to whether to rate this as Excellent or Very Good. I chose Very Good simply because the view doesn't match up to that from the top of Table Mountain. Signal Hill Road is quite a scenic drive and there is a large car park at the end with toilet facilities. Stop along the road to photograph Table Mountain; this is a perfect view of the mountain itself. At the car park there were cold drink and ice cream vendors [December] plus para-gliders launching from this vantage point.After your visit drive from Signal Hill Road along Kloof Road toward Clifton Beach; the narrow road takes you through the thick tree vegetation at the base of Table Mountain and Lion's Head.

Spectacular. 360 Degree View from Table Mountain to Robbin Island to a Birds Eye View of the City of Cape Town.Day or Night its worth the Drive.Pick Up a Picnic & Bottle of Wine and Relax and enjoy the View.

Nice view. If you are looking for a alternative to getting in a cable car to go up table mountain ,signal hill is a good alternative,nice scenic view from the top ,would be a good idea if they sold some refreshments ,good opportunity for some small entrepreneurs .
Perfect view point. Signal hill must be seen in the day time and the sunset as well as at night. You get to see a different view at different times

Great Views. Drove up signal hill in the evening great views from the top. Wouldn't recommend driving up in the dark lots of cars just pulling over, stopping and blocking roads. But well worth it, you can see for miles and view a lot but not all of Cape Town.

You have to paraglide. It was simply amazing everyone has to do this at least once in their life. We went up signal hill to have a look stunning views of table mountain. Then we decided to paraglide with parapax it was great fun good memories made. Thanks

Gorgeous views. Signal Hill is a must-visit place in Cape Town. It sits next to Table Mountain and has a terrific view of it and the city, leading up to the base of TM. There are also beautiful views of Green Point, the ocean, and Robben Island. My husband and I were in Cape Town in August and access to TM was closed for maintenance, but our visits to Signal Hill more than made up for it. Go at sunset, it's absolutely gorgeous.

Tandem Paragliding. Came here when we couldn't get up to Table Mountain, fell into the paragliding by accident but what a great experience. the wind perfect. the staff were great and made you feel very safe. What great way to fly and what a great experience.

Not special. Signal Hill is right next to Table Mountain and therefore share soem of the good views you can have from Table Mountain. There is nothing really special enough including its outlook to warrant a visit in that table Mountain is right next and offer many things which are just unavailable on Signal Hill. As I was there as part of the itinerary of a packaged tour group, I found that the tour leader's saying looked correct. His saying is that if the weather is so poor that taking the cable car to go up Table Mountain is impossible for suspension of service, a Signal Hill tour will be offered. If you do happn to be on Table Mountain for the things it offers, there will be little point of visiting the neighbouring Signal Hill. Table Mountain offers much better views from the height as a matter of obvious fact.
Amazing views. Fantastic views over Camps Bay. We went for sunset and if you are planning to do that get there in plenty of time as there was limited places to park

Fantastic views of probably the most beautiful city in the world. Beautiful views of the city during the day, but amazing at night. Well worth the drive up Kloof Nek to see the vista. We didn't get to see (or hear) the Noon Day Gun being fired at noon, but I'm told its quite an experience.The evening we went up was a Sunday just before dusk. The narrow road up was packed with cars, so come early, or come later. The traffic jam was dead stop, in my opinion, because some drivers wanted to park precariously on the edge of the road. Bit dangerous, so drive carefully and don't let other drivers force you near the edge of the road. The inside of the road has a deep drain and the outside a steep drop down the hill.
Awesome views. Great views and awesome mountain trails. Had a great sit down around the point and beautiful sun scapes around sea point. Always a pleasure.

Amazing views. Came up to watch the sun set we was on a night bus tour. We had a picnic at the top n then watched to sun set. The views wer amazin. Just make sure u wrap up warm as if it is windy it does get very cold.

The views are stunning. Well worth the time as the views of the coastline are breathtaking and you get a great photo of table mountain through one of the many yellow frames conveniently situation around the city.

beautiful. one of my most favourite places in cape town, drive up and go look for your self, breath taking views of cape town and surrounds, will help ground you with where you are, also tip the car guard and ask if he has a map found the map very usful and informative.

surprisingly gorgeous!. Went there on a lazy afternoon because we had nothing better to do and I always wanted to go there but never went before.It was really special. The weather was great and when we arrived we were overwhelmed by the view. The whole city is on your feet. You can see the CBD, the harbour, Greenpoint, Soccerstadium and Robbeneiland and the Waterfront. You get a very good impression of the city from this point. There is a small park and picknick area and we had no trouble finding a parking place. I think everybody that visits Cape Town should come here
Views..... we drove to the top of Signal Hill and then had a little walk around.. we were above the clouds and were watching free jumpers. Again the views are out of this world and its so peaceful!!

Awesome Sunset. Sunset at Signal was always a Story, and i made it MY Story. I lived this moment , it was ...... so difficult to describe. the sea from Signal Hill was like liquorice, yummy. Robben Island could be seen,however the sunset was a dream ! It just disappears in a blitz second, what an experience!! People bring their picnic baskets and Rugs and enjoy this experience. it took us an hour an half to move approx 200m, traffic congestion.

SunStar installation and stunning views. Drove up to signal hill to get a closer look of the Sun Star installation which can be seen sparkling at night from Cape Town. Designed by Christopher Swift to honour CT as the Design capital of the world this year. The installation is made from the 'repurposed fence that surrounded Robben island'. Good time of day to go - near sunset. Why not take a sundowner picnic. You could hike up to Lion's Head too.

Amazing Scenery - well worth a visit. The drive up there is pretty scary if you don't like heights but well worth it the views are amazing. You can watch the launch of the hanggliders and get a fab view of table mountain.

party environment after sunset. windy, cold and picturesque. please get ur wine bottle and glasses if u want to take real fun of this place. u can see and witness the whole city changing from sun light to bulb light in front of u.

Sunset!!. Must experience a sunset on the side facing Clifton. Pack a picnic basket (or grab some fast food), wine and admire mother nature for a few hours. Good to do this mid-trip as it relaxes you again!
