Nice Views. Great place to view the cape and city but it can't beat Table Mountain. If you can stomoach it sign up to paraglide to the beach from the top of Signal Hill.
Just beautiful. We visited Signal Hill on a beautiful summer's day in December and enjoyed a breathtaking sunset. The view over the bay is incredible and would recommend a visit here.
Unrivalled views. Best place to view sunrise and sunset. Has the best easy access 360 views of Cape Town and Robben Island. Parking is limited so do allow time for getting in and out.
Stunning views!. Great views of Cape Town not to be missed. Although it was peak holiday season parking was available.

Well worth visiting. its a breathtaking drive to get to the parking spot and gives a great perspective of the layout of the city and Atlantic seaboard. You get a great view of Table Mountain with a large frame to climb on to have your photo taken with the mountain in the background.It also exciting to watch the tandem para gliders jump on their way down to the grass at Seapoint.We love the trip up there but be warned, traffic at peak holiday time can be a nightmare unless you know the back route up.
Breathtaking. Incredible views from up there, easily accessible by car. Shows Cape Town at her best. We go every time that we go to CT because its so spectacular

Excellent view of the city and nature. This is a great option if you don’t have the patience to fight the thousands of people waiting to take the cable car to Table Mountain. Signal Hill offers an amazing view of Cape Town, the waterfront and the mountains. Parking is limited so you may have to be creative, but coming here on a nice day will give you some of the best pictures of the city available. The Sun Star is also beautiful and lights up at night for the whole city to see. This hill doesn’t take long to see and is well worth the great pictures you’ll take!
Breath Taking!!. One of the best sunrises ever! Get there when the sun is still up so you can witness the whole thing, it tends to get full during peak seasons but its definitely worth it!
Fantastic view . We went up here on a sunny day. It was a magnificent view over Cape Town. A bit hard to get a parking place. It's definitely worth the trip.

Be prepared for that sudden cloud!. Great spot but you have to be prepared for sudden weather changes. We were all prepared for a magnificent sunset when, within 10-minutes, a rush of cloud changed everything!
Great spot.. Had a great time there last Saturday. Gliders everywhere and views to die for. A picture snappers heaven.

Beautiful as ever!!. Wow...as usual...takes one's breathe away!! Always droves of onlookers...to picnic as well as just take some snaps with Luv'd ones...or of the Beautiful outlook of the City & Ocean.The main reason for our trip up was to see the newly displayed SunStar...which is unusual but quite eye-catching. Weekends up Signal Hill are busy & this evening was a tad chaotic with queues of cars heading up to see the view as well as the "shiny star".On google'ing the SunStar, it received some controversy & will be moved...according to one article...in 6months time...so hurry if you want to catch a viewing whilst still on Beautiful Signal Hill...but keep coming back to breathe-taking Signal Hill ;)

Beautiful views. When everything else is full this is the place to check out stunning views of Cape Town and surrounds. A scenic drive, convenient ice cream truck, and amazing views and photo opportunities means a pain-free outing even on a crowded day.
Amazing views. Beautiful and breathtaking views! Issues with parking. Great location to watch the sunset! Advised not to be there after dark if not accompanied by the locals.

Go for the sunset ... but don't be in a hurry to get out. A truly magnificent spot to see the city of Cape Town from, the best time to visit is in the evening for the sunset. But remember, this is Cape Town, so even if you are visiting in the middle of summer, take some warm clothing. Go early, be prepared to park a distance away and walk the rest of the way up as trying to find a spot in the parking area is a nightmare. Pack a blanket, some drinks and snacks, and find a spot to watch the sun set and after that take a walk to the other side and wait for the Sun Star to switch on. But be warned, it gets extremely busy (especially over weekends) and it can take a while to make your way down, so don't try to rush the experience.

Beautiful view point. We went up Signal Hill one evening to watch the sunset. There was a lot of people there -tourists and locals. All to enjoy the view. It is worth it. Beautiful spot. Also fun to see the para sailers in the distance. Take the time -go on a week day if you can, when it's clear, and then you will also have an easier time finding parking. Also take time to take a picture at the Cape Town "picture frame".
worthy of a stop while driving. If you are taking the M62 take the half hour detour to see it. It is a nice spot with a great view, and doesn't take long to visit or appreciate.
excellent. Mrs G, 60 something, had a cracking paraglide with a handsome young man who said she was 'very brave'!
Lovely visit. Lovely visit - drove up to Signal Hill. Walked around the hill which is connected to Lions Head by a long path/road. We enjoyed the views, the artists, people watching.

Great Views.. We took wine and snacks to enjoy the sun setting however the day was overcast and we did not see the sun set. The atmosphere was very good but trying to get out after the sun set was a nightmare. We traveled up on the hop on hop off bus and it took over 20 minutes to exit. Crowds and parking can be a problem in the busy season so plan accordingly.

Alternative to Table Mountain. This is a great spot to just watch the sunset over Cape Town. Get amazing pictures of the gorgeous city as it comes alive at night, see the stadium from above and get a view of Table Mountain up close. Recently there was been artwork erected which can be seen from the CBD below. This has been additional security around the clock to ensure the safety of visitors at night. This spot does very full with most tourist buses stopping here for sunset though. So plan a trip in advance to ensure you get parking right on top. Take a camera, some snacks, some drink and chill on the slope as you watch the sunset.

Great views. Thankfully I was on scooter so had direct access to park at the top. Felt a little sorry for the bazillion other people who thought the car would get them there. Busy, busy, busy.Beautiful panoramic views of Cape Town and coast.

Great for sunset or sunrise experience. When we visited it was packed, parking a bit of an issue but worth it for the awesome views and great vibe with all of the locals and tourists mixing and enjoying the sunset
Panorama. The blue sky,the endless sea,the table mountain, Signal Hill.A nice vieuw.Many things to look at in a beutiful setting.

Amazing sundown overlooking the sea!. On summer the sun goes down around 8pm but, 1h before you csn see people just going to the hill to see the sundown.There is a good atmosphere, friends, families... All them bringing their picnic and a bottle of wine to enjoy and relax while the sun is going down.Tip: be careful about the weather, change fast and you can be there waiting for the sun and, in less than 5 minutes, you can be seeing only the clouds comming up and hide all the views. If that happens I recommend to take your car and go the road down until you find an amazing spot to see the views.
Very Busy. Seeing the sunset from the top was really nice, but it was very busy and people were standing to take photos.

Wwa marvellous place for tourists. This is a fabulous place for a trip to experience spectacular views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. It is extremely popular so can be busy, especially on holidays and peak times.
Ideal sunset spot. always busy in summer, an ideal spot for the family to watch the sunset with a picnic blanket. Safe when keeping with the crowd in busy season.

Spectacular sunset!. We travelled up signal hill on the City Sightseeing bus specifically to see the African sun set. It was spectacular! Great views over Sea Point. Very little car parking so it was packed with cars and buses trying their best to park their vehicles so they could see the sunset. The night we were there people had literally abandoned their cars anywhere as it was a very clear night so the sunset was just lovely. It took us ages to get back down signal hill as the bus just couldnt get past the abandoned vehicles. Whist it delayed us quite a while it didn't spoil the visit at all. The African sunset was well worth it!

great views. If like me you are not very good with hights , maybe this is is a nice alternative to the table mountain cable car !You can go up on the "Ho ho " bus for a sunset viewing , which we missed due to lack of time , but luckily we got a free lift up there on our final night in Cape town and it was great to see all the lights of this big city below .A great way to end a short but memorable visit to lovely Cape town !

Lovely views of the coast can be enjoyed from here. We visited Signal Hill to watch the paragliders taking off. There were great views of the surrounding coast. There were quite a few people visiting when we went but we had heard that you had to be careful of muggings in this location although the area certainly didn't seem unsafe.

we live on Signal Hill. I think it's a really nice place to live and has very good views!!We don't mind having visitors to the area, it helps with the economy, just take any rubbish back to your hotel or put it in the bin!

Whenever I return to Cape Town, this is where I go to say hi. I love the lookout point on top of this hill. With 270 degree views of Cape Town, this magnificent site is ideal around sun set. Take along some wine and enjoy how the view changes as the sun sets and the lights come on.Be aware of security and don't wander too far down the paths that lead away from the summit. Plenty of picnic spots and plenty of space for kids to play. You cannot buy food at this venue so take along whatever you need. Most tour companies will include this in a city tour so getting there will be easy.Plenty of safe paths for hikers with safe parking along the road leading to the summit though as these are not covered by trees which restrict views.Muslim visitors will know of the Kramats that are within easy strolling distance.
Great sunset. Came up here to watch the sunset and it was fun. Lots of people milling around having barbecues and enjoying the place.
Gorgeous.. Beautiful views anytime of day from sunrise to sunset. Do check the weather before you go as it will either make or break your experience.

Give it a try. One of the highlights of Cape Town why not try a tandem jump from Signal hill truly amazing easy access by car and some great photo opportunities once in a life time.Then walk back around the sorounding mountain for more views
Ideal sunrise and sunset. Amazing place to go for a sunset or sunrise. It is advised that you bring a blanket because it can get windy sometimes. You will love the place. Worth the tour.
Signal sights. We went for the sunset visit and again a tremendous view and occasion.....but take some warm clothes as it gets windy and cold up there

check weather first. .. Clear day not a cloud in site, long way up ,don't try and walk it to dangerous. We went up by car ,a bit scary on some corner, but been up worse ,road is in very good condition and small car park at top , some places to stop on the way up or down . is a national park area so is is gated but free so check sign . When at the top you can see all of Cape Town and surrounding area great photo job ..

Go at sunset. The road was a bit scary on the way up but well worth it for the view and when I saw buses at the top my fears subsided as if they could get there and back ok then my car could! Take a picnic and watch the sun go down, it's wonderful.
beatiful sunset. The sunset and the views from signal hill is just too beautiful, This is a must for every tourist to see cape town from the Top

Panoramic view. Good experience. We did paragliding from there. You get an panoramic view from the top of the building. we took pics from there of the stadium. It was equally amazing at night. You get to see the whole city with the lights on and very beautiful view of the sky with lots of stars.

Nightmare......... Trying to get onto the top of Signal Hill is a nightmare. Cars parked illegally makes it very difficult for cars going up to the top to get passed. There is very little space on the left of the road to move over safely. We need some Metro Police to start giving tickets....that may help. It's a place we will not visit again.

Great lookout spot.. Perfect spot to look at table mountain and surrounding areas. Not a lot of parking and it will definitely be full on a sunny day and Table Mountain has very long queues. It is a great opportunity to look at the city and out at Robben Island on a clear day.

Too windy for the table. We couldn't get up table mountain as the cable cars were closed because of the wind, and therefore we went up Signall Hill instead, as you can drive to the top.
Well worth the trip with fantastic views, both of Cape Town, and of Table Mountain

Breathtaking!. We did this as part of the City sightseeing two day bus tour. We went on a sunset drive up the hill which offered amazing views of Cape Town city and the Atlantic seaboard. Arrived atop the hill in time to watch a breathtaking sunset over the Atlantic. Bring a picnic to share with friends :)

worth a visit for the view - watch or participate in paragliding. It's a nice view of the city without as much of a hassle as table mountain. the Hop off Hop on doesn't go there so unless you have a driver may not be my top priority and/or if you're going to go paragliding which is a blast. It's really beautiful to watch all the paragliders in the air...it's almost like watching a ballet

Best spot to watch the sun go down. Walking up Signal Hill offers magnificent views of Cape Town. On a hot summer evening, you will definitely not be alone on the mountain as Capetonians come out for "sundowners". As the sun sets, the sky is filled with lovely colours. Though uphill, it is easy enough for the moderately fit too. You won't regret the effort

Table Mountain National Park. The walk up to Devils Peak provide you with the opportunity to view the city in all its splendour as well as the whole of the Southern Suburbs right up to Muizenberg on a clear day.

Signal Hill. When ever we have visitors from outside if Cape Town Siganl Hill is a must during the day and at night. The views are both different. The view at night is breathtaking overlooking the City,Summer nights are beautiful up there with people just chilling with some music take care to be safe up there

Stunning. Sometimes I forget how lucky I am to live in Cape Town. It's truly one of the most beautiful cities in the world. There are many ways to experience the beauty of Cape Town, but none can really do it as well as Signal Hill. The views of the city are absolutely breathtaking. It's no wonder so many couples (and many tourists) spend the evening at Signal Hill to watch the sunset. It really is something to behold. The views of the city, the ocean and surrounds are simply spectacular. Just be sure to head up well before time, as it tends to get really busy and finding a suitable parking spot can be a pain, as is getting out of Signal Hill after everyone has seen the sun set. If you're in Cape Town, you owe it to yourself and your significant other to spend the evening at Signal Hill. You won't regret it.
"Sun Downers paradise". Great to take up a bottle of wine or pack a picnic basket.This looks over Cape Town and one can get some great shots and selfies with orsum back drops
Scenic views. Well worth the drive for the views from the top. You can walk up but we are in our seventies! The view over Cape Town is stunning, also the view over Sea Point

What a view. Love going to signal hill. Great views , but the sunsets are absolutely mind blowing. The traffic is a bit of a problem , because i am not the only one loving it , so use the "Topless bus.

Surprisng little Hill. I was pleasantly surprised at what is available in terms of views etc.On the way up, there is a stop at a muslim "Dargah" or 'Karaamaat"- which I never expected and is a must stop for believers.The views at the top are very good, especially of the town, harbour and the sea.There were some people engaging in para-gliding at the top, so that was good as well, and the Tabel mountain as a backdrop view gives a very good picture for souvenirs.

Wonderful views over Cape Town. If it's too windy to take the cableway up Table Mountsin, this is an good alternative for views over Cape Town, plus you can look at Table Mountain as well! Marvellous onn an clear day.

Unexpected. 10 minutes before noon naval officer gives a tour on the firing of the guns. I have it recorded and posted on youtube. When it is fired and you are that close, even though you know it is coming it still is loud and makes you jump. Worth while to experience.

Lovely spot to watch the sunset. We went on the night tour with City Sightseeing bus to watch the sunset.Thought it would be easier to pre-purchase a picnic, which was advertised for two people including a glass of wine each for about $20 Australian equivalent. For that price, we weren't expecting enough food for 4 (or more)! We got large packages of cold meats, salads, bbq chicken pieces, cheese, crackers, brownies and chocolates! We nibbled away on our feast, enjoyed the sunset over the ocean which was a real treat since we live on the east coast of Australia and never see that! Lovely spot to watch the sunset in Cape Town and very popular with locals and tourists alike. Definitely take a light jacket even in warmer weather as it can be breezy and cool once the sun goes down.
Coldest Night on the vacation. Went up here on the evening Hop on Hop off tour. Bring a coat! It was windy and cold (and we're from Canada) but the views spectacular!

Excellent but crowded. Fantastic views but it has become extremely crowded. A pity but that's to be expected. Although it's good that there are amnesties, I'm glad that one didn't see a cafe there as this will spoil the place further.

night time on Signal Hill was worth a visit especially romantic views. awesum views very romantic settings was well worth the visit, night time was best going up oneside and down the other made the night

Great panorama of the city. As the title suggests super panoramic view of the City. You can also paraglide down to the shore level. My friends did the tandem flight and said it was one of the best experiences they had. Toilets are basic and this time there was a camper van with an cooler full of chilled cans.
Great views of Cape town area. We actually walked here from where the noon cannon goes off. Fantastic views but no facilities apart from toilets so take water if walking there.
What a sight. Its great at night. Quite safe as there are many tourists visiting the Hill. A must even during the day.

Great sunsets. This hill is popular for the amazing views while sunsets. Unfortunately, I had no view as it was foggy or cloudy (not sure) but it has been an experience. You can go there as a tourist by a HOHO nigh tour bus of ~$10. There are tables for picnics, get prepared, so. Good luck for the clear sky!
Great. Lots of space to park and wonder around. Great views of Robben Island and Cape Town too. Not hard to find. Don't go on the weekends as it gets too busy!

Lost my favorite hiking hat on Signal Hill. HIKE AGAIN: Yes, from Lion's Head to the waterfront was a great hike, although I failed to look at my map and ended up descending the hill too early. Worse was losing my most favorite hiking hat somewhere along the trail.

view the mother city. a beautiful drive from the city centre to signal hill. as one drives up signal hill, one can constantly enjoy the view of the city. a good trip with the family as well as one could enjoy a picnic day at signal hill

Beautiful. This is a lovely viewpoint with great vistas and awesome sunsets. This part of cape Town is windy (I am told it always is) so come prepared. Stunning scenery and great for photos. Very highly recommended

Great place to see the Cape Town from. People usually take panoramic pictures of Cape Town from Table Mountain, but it is even better from Signal Hill (you get Table Mountain IN your shot). No entry fee, just drive up the road leading there and park in the parking lot. I would recommend going there during the day - the sun is in the right place to illuminate the whole town and the mountain.Lots of people come there in the evening to watch the sunset. I did not find that particularly exciting - just another sunset over the ocean like anywhere else. And parking is VERY hard in the evening - we had to leave the car down the road and walk up to the parking.Make sure to stroll around the place, there are guinea fowls living there and you can usually find these fun pretty birds.
Amazing views. Amazing 360 views. Great place for picnic (if you don't mind the wind). Parking is an issue and toilets are not very clean.

Breath-taking sunsets. I have rarely seen sunsets such as those over the sea as viewed from the peninsula at the end of Signal Hill.I have a friend Braahm Malherbe who lives in the only house on the ridge of Signal Hill, leased to him by Cape Town City Council.He is the head of the Volunteer Fire Fighters amongst other things, and some years' back completed a run along the Great Wall of China with his chum David Grier, a well-known Cape Town chef.I mention all this because when one goes to the house, the view over the edge from the garden is incredible and vertiginious.Braahm leases the house to film companies for shoots and he is extremely lucky to have the chance to live in such an extraordinary place.tAnother extraordinary building is the tiny shrine a little down the hill from Braahm's house, which may be Muslim, and it is looked after by a resident caretaker. Painted in vivid primary colours it is quite arresting.The view from Signal Hill over the City is stupendous, with Table Mountain to one's right, and Lion's Head to the right of the mountain whilst the port is visible way down past City Bowl.
Wow wow wow. Lower than Table Mountain but free at a different view. A must do also for all cape town tourists!!!!

Great country walk, stunning views of Cape Town far below. In glorious sunshine, we walked for an hour or so on clearly marked paths towards the summit of Signal Hill. Good exercise and glorious views in the sunshine. At the top we watched intrepid youngsters being launched in tandem paragliding off the hill and gliding down to the bay. Always something interesting going on in S Africa!

Best View Site for Cape Town. Take a sunset drive up to the top of Signal Hill, a cooler with a good bottle of ice cold wine [ really its a champagne moment ] and watch the sun sink below the horizon to the west. You'll get a fabulous 180 degree overview of the city and the harbour as well as a chance to take a stroll. Bring a sweater even Cape Town gets chilly on summer evenings.

A view to treasure. The drive up signal hill is not for the faint hearted but it's well worth it, the views are sublime once you reach the top. Note that many people during peak season come to see the sunset so it preferable to leave hour or two before sunset or else you will get caught in traffic. Once you reach the top you can sit back and relax, have some meals with friends and family as there is facilities that cater for this. If it's too windy and you got a car that's light rather avoid as it can be treacherous. When hiring car try to get auto as it will make it easier on the steep inclines. All in all well worth a visit. Enjoy :)

Great view. In our 4 days in Cape town we never made it up to Table Mountain because it was so windy and they closed the cable car. Driving up to Signal Mountain and enjoying the view was the next best thing.

Sunset Wow. Signal Hill is the place to visit for a picnic dinner and a romantic sunset. The Hop-On/Hop-Off bus offers this combo as one of their options. An extra bonus is Table Mountain as a backdrop to the setting. So prepare to take a "selfie" with Table Mountain in the background along with an incredible sunset.
Great views. Pack a picnic and watch the sun set. A great vantage point to watch the paragliders.Every day at midday the noon day gun goes off from Signal Hill.

Beautiful, windy, cold, best spot to see the town!!!. I have no idea how it look during the day, cause I went there around 8pm and it was beautiful. Signal hill is the best place to see the whole city. I wish I could stay longer, but it's quite dark and cold. Would recommend you guys to come.
Very good. Good view of the city, the water and the table mountain : All from one place.What more does one want?Dont miss the beautiful sunset.

Beautiful views. Be sure to have your camera. The photos you take will be treasured. If your trip up Table Mt. is not The views are spectacular. If you can be there for sunset you won't be disappointed. Make sure you have your camera.

Nothing Beats The African Sunset. Take it from me, up the hill, the city looks magnificent and hey, what can beat the African sunset. If you want to revive fading love spark, make your way to the hill and glaze at the most gorgeous God creation of the African sunset into the ocean

Great views without an hike. If you want to get a good view of Cape Town and Table Mountain without having to hike/walk at all, then I would recommend visiting Signal Hill. You basically drive past Lion's Head entrance and just keep on going till the road ends to get to Signal Hill.

Great place to visit at sunset. Great at sunset - take a picnic and a jacket as it can be cool and windy. You can visit via the Hop on Bus or go by car or taxi. There are toilets and there is some seating available but most people sit on the grass to watch the sunset. Also provided great view of Table Mountain

Cape Town at its best. We took a few overseas visitors to Signal Hill on a beautiful clear spring day. Fantastic views of Table Mountain and the Twelve Apostles, Green and Sea Point and Robben Island. Add the excitement of the launching of the paragliders and our visitors left with good memories of the city.
Signal Hill. Beautiful view of the city of Capetown and the Sunset. A very popular destination during the evenings.
So fun!. What a fun experience to hear the noon gun at Signal Hill! I am so glad we got to witness this. It happened so quickly, I wanted them to fire it again!

Great setting to reconnect and get perspective. Signal Hill is a wonderful place to look out at, and over, the amazing Cape Town environment. It puts most of the city and greater metropole in perspective and certainly helps us appreciate what a phenomenal city we live in. It's a good layout and all the visitors are there to appreciate the view and the setting. It's well managed and I always felt safe... But have always been there when there are other people around. The views are spectacular, whether you're looking at the coastal views, the greater ocean perspective on the Atlantic shore, the white never ending beaches in Table Bay or even at the the city itself (my favorite is sunset and watching the endless variety of the lights transform the city)

Sunset delight. A friend of mine and his family has a tradition of eating pizza on Signal Hill and enjoy the sunset. It is an idyllic picture when the softness of the sunset offsets against the harsh cliff of Table Mountain. It can certainly be the place for a romantic picnic!
An easy add on to your Table Mtn excursion. Fantastic views and great walk ways make this a popular stop. Parking appears to be free adding to things you can do in Cape Town if on a budget!

Amazing views again. Our taxi guide took us up here to round off one of our day trips & the views are amazing. The best part is you get good pictures with table mountain in the background but a bit nearer.The Capetown views are some of the most amazing pictures I've ever taken.

Wonderful views .... ... and if you can't get up Table Mountain because of the weather, go across to Signal Hill. (But do go anyway!) The views are stunning and you can just sit there for hours taking it all in
Weather worked against us. Went on the sunset trip but it was very cloudy and windy, making photo ops limited. I bet on a clear day then one can catch a fantastic sunset over the Atlantic Ocean.
Romantic end of the day whit sunset. I liked the beautiful sunset and the romantic atmosphere. I disliked the bit crowded atmosphore, tough this felt me also more save after the sunset.
Such a beautiful sight!. So proud to live in Cape Town and have suce beauty on our doorstep. Im so happy to see the public toilets have been renovated because they were a disgrace before!

it's not lion head or table mountain, but the views are still nice. my wife and i stopped here during a private tour of cape town on 09/22/14. there is parking at the top free of charge and you don't have to walk far to get some great views. for thrill seekers, you can go hang gliding from here.

Gorgeous views. The drive up was lovely and you really do get a lovely view of the city from here. If you can't get up table mountain d/t time, queues etc this is a really quick alternative for some nice pics!
Wonderfull view of Cape Town. Its is a nice drive up the hill. On a beautiful day there are many people windsurfing fr4orm the top.Excellent view of Cape town from there

Go at sunset. Our guide took us up for a sunset photo and it is a happening place I tell you! Paragliders were jumping off, music was playing, guinea fowls running around, lots of picnics and drinking to the end of another day. Oh, and we got a nice sunset photo looking down at Camps Bay.

COLD WET AND WINDY. Great views with an interesting WC on site. The day was not the best for sightseeing, but we did get some good pictures from here as Table Mountain was covered in cloud. A good vantage point, if you cant get up the mountain.
Great View. This viewpoint is easy to access and gives you a great orientation to the whole area. Don't miss the view up to Table Mountain from here!
night view. Our driver took us up there after a great meal. It was a beautiful evening and a great view of the city at night
Great views of sea point and surrounding areas. Wonderful views of table mountain on the one side and Sea point on the other. Try go when the wind is not strong as that will spoil the adventure.
Attraction. Good View but suggest to visit at night which is excellent. Must see. Uphill climb motorway from where you can view Cape Town.
Beautiful views of beaches. REally nice of views of Capetown beaches. There is a great spot to take you photo facing Table Mountain, too. Parasailing is offered from up there as well.

Wonderful Views when Table Mountain is cloudy!. Great views, plus a few in our group took the 'optional' (run by locals, not any organized tour group) para-sailing (Tandem) 15-20 minute 'excursion'. The views are fantastic, good option if Table Mountain is 'socked in'.
Breath taking sunsets. The vibe is great. Sunsets are spectacular and you cannot get a better view of Capet Town. Lovely location to take photos. You can also pack your picnic bag and bottle of wine.

The Noon Gun is really loud!. Visit at noon to experience the firing of the Noon Gun - BOOM! - signaling the time in Cape Town since 1806. Just be sure to cover your ears, as suggested by the naval officer in charge - it really is loud! Good city views on the drive up the hill.
Great view of the city. Took a friend for a drive around yesterday and this drive offers such a stunning perspective of the city.

Great place for a sunset. We had superb conditions for a great sunset. Sat in the carpark watching it when another vehicle blocked my view. My colleague asked the driver to move back, explaining my mobility problems and his response was 'Of course, we must let our visitors see what I can see at any time!' Thank you sir whoever you were.

Loud!. Loved this, make sure you go in time for the Noon Gun. Lovely talk by the staff there just before they fire it....and even though you know what's going to happen, it still takes you by surprise - it's loud!Signs for getting there were not that obvious so check your maps before setting out - that said, its near all that's going on in Cape Town, you don't have to go far and definitely worth a visit.
Wonderful views. This is a great place to bring a family. Lovely views all round and some very active guinea-fowl, too. There are lovely backdrops for your photos.
What a view. Definitely go before sunrise, Make sure the flask is filled with some good Java and enjoy the sunrise as it hugs Cape Town and bathes her in its glorious ray's.
Great view of the city and Atlantic. This is great place to go to just for the view but if the wind is right you also get to watch the paragliders take off and ride the currents above your head.

The best spot for sunset. Spending two days in Cape Town on business I didn't have much time to sightsee. I did rush up to Signal Hill after the end of the summit to see the sun set over the Atlantic Ocean. Being a Friday evening it was great to see so many people out and about enjoying the good weather. There were people on every lookout spot (and in between) there was. Couples, families, tour groups, photographers, people having sundowners, people having picnics and folk jogging along the paths. I didn't feel unsafe at all (not sure if there would be as many people about during the week though) and the sunset was absolutely breathtaking.
An alternative to the cable car.. Take a scenic drive to the top of Signal Hill and get a different perspective of the city and Table Mountain.

Nothing to see. Well. I did not like it that much. Does not have anything there. It is just a place that you could see some of the Cape Town from up side. However, if you go to Table Mountain so do not lose your time here.
beautiful view of Table Mountain. as you get later in the afternoon/evening, it's unpredictable weather up there, even on a beautiful day below. go early in the day!
Worth a visit. Well worth taking the bus to the top as views on the route are something else when you are on an open air bus.
GreAt view fun time friendly locals. To many folks, greaT beauty worth seeng and experience easy to access fun way to spend the afternoon or morning, people friendly
Relax and chill on the "Hill". One can view the beautiful Atlantic Ocean, you can see Green Point stadium and the peace and quiet up the hill is magnificent. Great spot to just relax and "chill".

The hill with the best views. There is no better place to be when the sun sets across the ocean.The lookout point is at the end of the road and no hiking is required to appreciate the stunning view. In the summer the sunsets are fantastic and occur after 8pm. Even the drive there will take your breath away as you view Cape Town from above, with Table Mountain and the bay to complete the picture. For the budget conscious tourist there is an alternative way to have the views as well. The hop on hop off bus does the route to Table Mountain and passes the entry road to signal hill. By strolling up the hill from the left side it is a totally different perspective and the views are just as good over Campsbay. Well worth a visit for that memorable photos that would make your friends wishing they were there.

Awesome view. I just love this awesome amazing ''lion''...as I live on the slopes of Signal Hill and as a child we,my siblings and I would climb this hill in a few minutes.We would bask in the sun and enjoy the view from the whole of the Mother City walking around the slopes towards the Waterfront,Green Point ,Sea Point n Camps Bay.My dislike would be tourist messing up the place with just discarding their litter.

In the Shadow of Table Mountain.... Great views from here. My best photos of Table Mountain was taken on this stretch of road. you can walk it, ride with a car or cycle it. Lovely piece of road. From the lookout point at the end of the Signal Hill Road you can see the Atlantic Ocean, Lions Head, Table Mountain, Green Point Stadium, The V&A Waterfront and much more. Do yourself a favour and take a walk around the bend and you will also be able to have almost an aerial view of the CBD. Sunsets from the lookout point is amazing!
The Hill. Views over the entire bay; safe and accessible; can see to forever and back again! Was there at night too and the spectacle below was amazing!

Hiking in town. Our splendid Lions Head is right in the middle of Cape Town. If you enjoy nature and you love hiking, this is a must. Whether you are unfit or super fit, there is an opportunity for you hike up Lion's Head. You may decide to stop at any point in time, put down a blanket and check out the view while waiting for your super fit friends who want to climb to the top. On nights with a full moon, many hikers go up to watch the full moon and enjoy the dusk view of the town.
Nice view over Cape Town. Such a beautiful site.Can see most of Cape Town from here. Can take the most beautiful photos from here, choose between mountain, fynbos,ocean, stadium.

the views, the views. This is a great spot to take in Table Mountain, the 12 Apostles and the entire sea front area including the stadium and the city. Even with cloud shrouding the mountain it is beautiful
stand in for table mountain. when the funicular is closed this is the next best option for stunning views across the bay and city. Watch the sunset in the west and the lights come on in the city..

Sometimes Things Don't Go As Planned. While in Cape Town in late June, our guide drove us to Signal Hill where a cannon is fired at exactly 12:00 noon every day - hence the name "Noon Gun". Two cannon are used (one as a back-up) with the "active" cannon being fired by electronic signal directly from the South African Astronomical Observatory. The Navy staffs the site with a representative traveling from garrison to the Hill each day to prepare the cannon, etc. On the day we visited, the Navy man in charge was in an automobile accident and didn't get to the Hill. However, he was able to call for a replacement who rushed to the site and frantically prepared the cannon to receive the signal from the observatory. The crowd watched with anticipation as the time slipped away. Fortunately the tradition was upheld when the gun was made ready with what turned out to be 12 seconds to spare. What could have been an interesting, albeit routine, event turned out to be really exciting for all those in attendance. So...take a chance and pay a visit to Signal Hill just before noon. Perhaps your visit will be as exciting as ours. Signal Hill provides a very pleasant view over much of the city center and is a close-in and free alternative to going to the top of Table Mountain. Parking at the top is somewhat limited so allow sufficient time to park along the road and walk the final yards to the top.
Fantastic views. Great panoramic views of Cape Town and surrounding bays. You can also paraglide from the top, and see both Table Mountain and Lion's Head.

magnificent views. it is part of the red bus tour so you should pass by it on your red route. You can also paraglide from it to green point if i am not mistaken and that is not to be missed. i missed it!

For sunsets and kisses. My boyfriend and I drove up signal hill to watch the supermoon rise and I must say the view of Cape Town is utterly breath taking. The perfect spot for a romantic picnic with a bottle of champagne
beautiful sunset. the view from table montain is amazing but also seeing sunset from here is speachless.

Glorious views. If you are lucky enough to have good weather when in Cape Town, you should definitely make the effort to get to the top of Signal Hill, where the views of both Table Mountain and the Camps Bay area are stunning. One word of warning, the toilet facilities up there are not the greatest!
Tremendous views. Just go! Very easy to drive up to - and tremendous views of the City, the mountain and Lion's Head. Toilets too.

Great views during the day Beautiful sunsets at night. Signal is easy to get to, very close to the city centre. During the day there are great views of the city, Table Mountain and the Atlantic ocean. Picnic tables are provided (just beware of the Guinea fowl), the parasailing / hang gliders take off just in front of you and towards the south are some very nice, quiet walks, with lots of wildlife.The sunsets are exceptional,with unobstructed views over the Ocean. The city by night is also spectacular from above.

A must if the cable car isn't running.. The view of the city from here is fantastic. It's not quite the view from the top of the mountain, but when we were there, the cablecar was closed for maintenance. This is an excellent alternative. Easy to get to --- and free!!!
Beautiful . My favourite thing here is you can drive to the top. We went up and watched the gliders jump off...amazing. have not been for sunset but would imagine it gets very busy.

Stunning views. You have to go to Signal view to take in the stunning views. You get to see the city bowl on one side and out to sea on the other. We went just before sun-set and the views were just spectacular!
Interesting bit of history. Definitely schedule the noon gun into your day. Listen to the story told by the care taker of the canons. Very interesting.

Amazing view. I have been to Signall Hill many times now and it never gets boring. We always go there to watch the sunset, which is beautiful. Everyday it is different,pink, orange, red, blue, yellow or purple. Bring some food and hang out! If you are lucky you can also see some whales in the ocean. When it is dark, you should go to the other side of the hill to have an amazing view of the city. Everything is completely dark, but you can see all the lights from the city. Super cool!
Nice views!. I para-glided off of Signal Hill. The views of the city and surrounding mountains was beautiful. It is a nice place to relax and enjoy a packed lunch.
Wonderful. Couldn't do Table Mountain or Robben Island due to weather so this made up for it. Views wear brilliant.
tradition. Take a trip up here for the view and to witness the canon shot at noon. It is a tradition in Cape Town
Easy to go. A brillant view over Cape Town and everytime possible. The trip is also possible with the red city tour.

Quick alternative to the mountain cableway.. Lovely views of the City and surrounds. Here you can relax and walk around at leisure without having to line up and wait for the cable car. If you have limited time this is a worthwhile alternative.
Great viewing. Great view over Cape Town and the harbour and an absolute stunning view on Table Mountain. Put on your tekkies and take a walk on one of the short trails.

Great view!. Its a really nice hike up to Signal Hill, not as tiring as the hike up to Table Mt or Lions Head. You will still have a great view over Cape Town and see Table Mt in the background but the view from Table Mt is better because you get to look down onto Camps bay. Signal Hill is still a really good place to hang out at and just relax
Great view of Table Mountain. If you have time it is well worth a trip for some spectacular views of Table Mountain and the Lions Head
Great views for little effort.. Great way to get your bearings in Cape Town. Definitely wait for a clear, sunny day. An easy drive up the hill.

A nice view from the top. Very nice drive up the hill, was not to busy and the paragliding company was in full swing with the tandem flights. An Ice cream truck provide with desert and the weather was excellent.Was the first time there and we where not disappointed.I will include in the future a ride to the top in my road bike.Not as high as Table Mountain but a different view of the sea and the city, highly recommended if you have some time to spare.

Group visits only. Signal Hill is perfect for the best view over the city of Cape Town,...on a clear day...but people should not go there by themselves. It is too isolated and unless going there between 11am and 12pm when the Noon Gun is fired, there won't be people around. Go in groups and wait for a sunny day.
Great Views. I loved going up there to see the great vies of the city. We walked all the way around and really enjoyed it, allow at least 1 hour.

Noon Gun. We walked up to Signal Hill through the Bo Kaap area at the end of Longmarket street. A steep walk. We didn't go to the summit of the hill, we only went as far as the old army base where they fire the noon gun. This was one of the highlights of our stay in Cape Town. The views of the city and Table Mountain were fabulous. The history behind the Noon Gun was very interesting and hearing and seeing the canon being fired was a great experience. As there were only a few of us there it felt like we had stumbled across this ancient tradition that very few people are aware of. Worth doing.
The NoonDay Canon. The walk up to signal hill is great for an early morning exercise and getting there just in time for the noon day canon shot.
Amazing View. A great place to have a romantic picnic or take the family to see the amazing view of the beaches, Table Mountain and Cape Town.

Struggle to find a better sunset in the world. This is one of the best places in Cape Town to watch the sub set. Remember get there well before sun set on weekends and busy periods as you may have a long walk to be able to get to the "sunny" side. Great evening views if city as well.
Signal Hill. Beautiful high on the mountain top. Can see forever. There were facilities to use which was nice. The weather was beautiful. Not much to do but admire the scenery.

Really pretty sunset. Come watch the sun set here when in Cape Town. Great views of the city. Note: towards the bottom of Signal Hill Road, there is a "road closed" sign/detour. The road is NOT closed, just drive around this, right to the top :)

a great view place. signal hill is one of all the nice places you can climb up to and enjoy the views. to signal hill you can also drive up. be careful walking around on your own since mugging has been reported and especially after dark a warning is appropriate.

A Must for View Lovers. If you take the 2-day-ticket for City Sight Seeing Tour Bus, you get a free sunset trip to Signal Hill. We brought food with us (more like a snack) as you can have a picnic there while waiting for the sunset. The views on the way to the top is amazing, also when the bus was going down the hill, it was just such an unforgettable experience. Cape Town is really beautiful.

Beautiful but lacks information. The views from this peak is truly amazing, with an unspoiled view of table mountain on one side, Sea Point on another and the city and harbour on a third. If at all cloudy, don't waste your time - rather wait for a clear day to experience the beautiful view. The only gripe that I have is the lack of information. One doesn't know, for instance, what you are looking at. You see an island in the distance, but there is no information or sign telling you that the island is Robben Island. There is also no information on where to stand to view the different parts of the city.The road up to the viewing point is long, but very well maintained. The parking is ample, and well demarcated. There is a park official present as well.Definitely worth a visit!
Stunning views at night. We visited Signal Hill at night. Stunning views over Cape Town, Robben Island and Table Mountain. Well worth the visit when in Cape Town
If you have time. It's something you can easily miss if you don't spend a lot of time in Cape Town. The view is nice...

Don't miss this view!. The best part about Signal Hill is that you can drive up to this wonderful panoramic view. With all the hiking around Lion's Head and Table Moutain, it's nice to just drive to a great viewpoint.
wonderful place. in Signal hill, you get a very nice view for the city... don't miss that hill if you're in Cape town.

Not as good as Table Mountain. Obviously this won't be as good as Table Mountain; so if you want to do this easy drive, make sure to do it before you go for the real deal (Table Mountain). This is where the paragliders launch from, so that was cool to see.
A sunset worthy of applause!. A lovely spot to watch a spectacular sunset. It was so good that the many people gathered applauded!

Bird's Eye View from Signal Hill. Excellent spot to witness the spectacular scenic beauty of mother city - Cape Town. Drive to the peak was awesome and breathtaking. I simply loved to visit signal hill.

rewarding hike up. Driving up spoils most of the experience. Hiking up from any side is usually rewarding, bundubashing a bit and avoiding the insects. I've gone up in the middle of summer and winter. Both times memorable due to the views you'll have of CBD, waterfront and sea point. You also have an unique view of the mountain. The noon gun is halfway up, get there before 12noon for some history, or have a picnic nearby. As much as i dislike the hike pn the way up (notbig on insects or cardio :p ), im always happy to have done it.
Not quiet as popular as the mountain. May be not as busy or as iconic as Table Mountain, but certainly still worth a drive up to take in the view across the city.
Great views of Ocean and Tabel Mountain. Excellent place to view Cape Town from up above! I really liked the Frame they have for Table Mountain photos.
Beautiful view from the top. Take a drive up to the top and the view is spectacular. Well worth a visit to go in to 'neutral' and stare at the beautiful surrounding areas.

Amazing view of the bay. The drive up to signal hill is picturesque. The view from Signal hill of the Table Mountain and Lions head with the opportunity to take a photo in a giant frame with yourself and Table mountain and Lions head is not to be missed. The view of the bay is spectacular. You also get a few more amazing views on the drive up and back. We passed a number of bikers and trekkers along the way.

Good trekking trail. We went up on a nice clear afternoon. There's a nice trekking trail that you can do. The views are amazing. Great views of the lions head and table mountain. It's good fun to see the para gliders take off even If you're not doing it yourself

Free Aerial view of the City of Cape Town and the Penninsula. Not much is free! But driving or hiking up to Signal Hill is free.Quite a busy place - with visitors and locals enjoying the view and the fresh air. Excellent lookout points and trails to give you a vantage point to the sights in and around Cape Town. Excellent views of the City of Cape Town, V&A Waterfront, The Port, Cape Town Soccer Stadium, Table Mountain, Robben Island, Mouille Point, Sea Point, Western Suburbs, Eastern Suburbs, etc.This is a must visit when in Cape Town - for both visitors and locals.

Signal Hill - a sunset to be remembered.. Signal Hill is a view point over the city and sea which is perfect for sunset viewing. It costs nothing but you have to drive to get there. Get there early as people come waaaaay before sunset to get seats and parking may be an issue. Bring wine, food & enjoy!

If you miss this especially if the weather is clear and sunny then you have lost out on the photo opportunity of a life. The title tells it all bring along your camera and your nerve if you think you would like to try Paragliding you can sign up for a ride if weather permits or just stand by and watch others enjoy the adrenalin rush

Paragliding Haven. This is where paragliders take flight. It's a 15 minute ride to the beach with a professional and they took to the skies one after another. There were bikers, joggers, photographers and picnickers all gazing at the spectacular views and fabulous sunset.

fun with the noon gun. Mant visitors will only enjoy the view from Signal Hill...but there is a wonderful opportunity, if you can manage to be there at noon (12.00) when the noon gun is fired. My grandsons and I love going to hear and see the gun being fired and they know the history and explanation well enough to offer to do it for the naval person who usually does it. They also enjoy climbing on the old artillery that is parked there. A caveat though, it's best to go in a group or at noon...the pace is a little isolated at other times.

Sunset to die for. We travelled up on the City Sightseeing evening tour open top bus. There was a round of applause when the sun set - there is nothing between Cape Town and Argentina to spoil the view.Badly parked cars stopped anybody leaving for almost an hour but we were not in a hurry and used the time to take extra photos of Cape Town from above.

Climb at full moon!. Beautiful to go hiking during full moon! In summer, start around 5, when it cooled down, enjoy the sunset during your hike, admire CT in the meantime. Make sure you have a headlight, good shoes, enough water and perhaps something to eat. Pretty safe to do, and could be even busy sometimes.
Gorgeous Views Of The City. Absolutely breathtaking views of the city especially at night. Bright, shinny lights. You can even see the ocean. A must see if you're in the area!

Stunning View with easy access. Having lived in and near Cape Town for most of my life, I have never ceased to be excited and in awe of the beauty of our mother city as seen from Signal Hill. The vantage point offers a panoramic, spectacular view of the city, Robben Island and outlying areas up the West Coastas well as the mountain ranges in the distance (as far as Stellenbosch and Hottentots Holland Mountains) - a photographer's dream. Night time views are also spectacular.

Nice view. Nice place to take a view pics during the day and enjoy the views other than that nothing more to do. Most times very full but worth a visit at least once to have a look at the view but toilet facilities are bad and parking becomes a nightmare getting in and out.One is more than enough.

Priceless views. On a good clear day, one can see Robben Island (prison island where Nelson Mandela was held). The view of the Atlantic ocean is simply amazing. You can basically get an almost 360 degree view of Cape Town, Table Mountain, etc on a good day, and it's all for free. A definite must for all first time visitors; it's also a great place to have a picnic with a good panoramic view.

Definitely worth a visit. High above Cape Town this was on our tour - and was the best vantage point we had that day as Table Top was shut in fog and cloud. There is a metal frame for the obligatory photo of you with Table Top in the background. Lots of birds wandering around very tame. Cold in May though.
Great view of the city. This is an awesome FREE view of the entire city! We went after dinner, but this would be a great sunset spot
great views. its a long way up but well worth the steep climb by cAR BUT THE VIEWS ARE STUNNING,hang gliders from the top beautifull birds lovely nature and a wonderfull view of tABLE MOUNTAIN
Great spot for photographer!. Signal hill offers the greatest view of Table mountain. All photos taken from Signal hill are spectacular!

What a View!!!. Once at the top you will love the views of the scenery around cape town- you will see the beaches, town. waterfront, stadium, ships at sea as far as the eye can see, very little in the way of food so take your picnic baskets, and ensure you have sun lotion, shades, binoculars, and you will enjoy and don't forget the camera

A lovely way to end the day.. After work, we packed a picnic basket and some warmer clothes, and drove up to watch the sunset from the top of Signal Hill. The site has been vastly upgraded, and is now safe and spotless. We found a space to spread our picnic blanket, amongst the many other people there, opened up our basket, shared some wine, and settled down to watch a beautiful sunset. What a wonderful way to end a busy day! And of course, Mother Nature did not let us down! If you are going to do this, make sure to take warm clothing - even in summer. It can become very chilly in the evenings, and one is quite high up. It is a most breathtaking and lovely experience, and if you are an international visitor, one that you should not miss. The stunning images of cloud, sea and setting sun will stay with you for a long, long time.

Wonderful views, easily accessible. Just a short drive from central Cape Town and you can see a panorama view of the bay without worrying about the cloud or waiting in line for a cable car. Worth stopping along the road for different perspectives as well as going to the far end.

spectacular. Beautiful views from the top. We met the artist, Ishmael, and heard his story of letters he wrote to Bothe during the apartheid years. Then we had time to watch the loading of the cannon for the noon gun. Thanks DC Tours

What a View. Had a great experience at Signal Hill the day was clear and you could see for miles over beautiful Cape Town and while standing doing the admiring and taking photos the lunch time Gun went off what a noise but so pleased we were there to hear it. On the way down took photos of a beautiful tree out in flower reminding me of New Zealands Pohutakawa which is always out at Christmas in the North Island

Ohhh what a sunset!. Friday evening, nice wine, a blanket....jsut the perfect time to enjoy a wonderful sundet.OK, the Signal Hill becomes more and more popular to ALL tourist. Thus it's getting crowded. You need to like buses full of tourists.

A nice climb to watch the sunset. i have not climbed the rock for a while (reviews only go back so far) it is a lovely climb with chains to assist the last part. When you reach the top you are rewarded with breathtaking views. I suggest to walk in a group for safety.

Walks, views, paragliding. I walk up Signal hill from time to time. The effort of the walk is totally rewarded by the view at the top. I'd recommend this to any visitor to the city. If you don't enjoy walking, you can always take a car or bus up. Do pack a picnic - there's lots of space at the top to enjoy a meal while checking out the panoramic view over the ocean, Green Point Stadium, Sea Point Promenade and the new park. Also look out for the paragliders who take off from signal hill and land on the Sea Point promenade. Join in if you have the stomach for it. It's an amazing ride. A bit expensive for locals, but if you're a tourist it might not hurt your pocket too much.

Signal hill. It took me a while to figure the top of the sign hill is actually a lions head. It was such a great contour. You must go up n see this. Its quite different from the top view of the table mountain.
Sunset heaven. We went to see the sunset on signal hill and it was the most beautiful... Guy with coffe and hot choc from his van was surprisingly good. A must see when traveling to Cape Town!

Amazing views!!. Amazing views of Cape Town and Table Mountain! We drove up just in time to watch the sunset over the Atlantic ocean. It was beautiful! We stayed to take some pictures of Cape Town at night. Would highly recommend!
The place for sun downers!. Just across the way from Table Mountain and not as busy which is nice. Superb views over Cape Town and an awesome place for a sun downer watching it set out at sea.

Sun-set trail running. Signal Hill, sitting stately alongside Table Mountain is a must see attraction for all. If you would like to go for a picnic, then head to the parking area, find a nicely located spot over-looking the Atlantic Ocean with Robben Island perched below and enjoy the breathtaking vistas. If you find the parking area too full then just before you reach there are a number of smaller stops where you can pull into and enjoy a crowdless picnic. A nice spot is actually by the Kramat which sits hidden away about half-way towards the parking-area.If you are a fitness enthusiast then Signal Hill has no shortage of trails. A favourite is the trail which runs long the ridge of the lion towards Lions Head. A good tip is to go early and not to park your car in the parking lot - it gets very crowded - and makes getting off the hill a time-intensive exercise. Rather park your car just outside the parking area in the direction you will be leaving so that when the sun sets you can just get in and go.Enjoy!!

Sunset not so romantic with 500 other people there too. We went on the evening bus tour for a 'romantic' picnic on Signal Hill. I suppose I should have realised that my notion of romantic should have taken into account that they run BUSES up there. It was pleasant enough, but there were lots of people milling about and jostling for the best place to take their photographs.The bus ride was worth it though for the panoramic views of Cape Town, especially on the way back after dark

Beautiful view and interesting piece of history. We were there for the noon firing of the cannon, which I would definitely recommend if you are planning to visit signal hill. We were not able to go up to Table Mountain due to weather but enjoyed the view and learned some interesting history about Cape Town's very important role as a shipping port.

If table mountain closed, go to signal hill. not as high as table mountain , from there you can understand and see the beautiful scence of cape town.and you can see closely the island that Manda spent for years from signal hill !
Cozy Comfort. Small but clean and welcoming. Gerhard is so accommodating. Pool and close to downtown in City Bowl. Upgrading now to boutique status. Perfect for those on the go.

Great views of Cape Town. As a runner, I get to see Cape Town in a different way to many people, as many people are still sleeping. Do yourself a favour and get up early during your stay in Cape Town, take a drive to Signal Hill Parking Area, just before the sun comes up, you will not be disappointed. It's brillant, the different colours and sounds that time of the morning are completley different.
Beautiful spot to view the sunset. Outstanding view of the sunset was a very nice end to a fabulous day of touring in Cape Town. I highly recomment a stop there to see the sunset if time permits.

Beautiful views of the Cape and paragliding!. There is nothing better than going up in Cape Town so you can appreciate the incredible view of the city. The drive up Signal Hill is easy and brief. From the top, you can see amazing panoramic views of Cape Town, Camps Bay and Table Mountain. There isnt much to do on the hill but it's worth the visit for the views. A number of paragliding companies operate from the top of Signal Hill also.

Great views. Lovely place to come for the views of Cape Town and of Table Mountain. There are tandem paragliders jumping off the hill and heading towards Camps bay. Great place for photographs. Well worth a visit.
Signal Hill. This is a must see & visit place. Amazing views of Cape Town in the day time, but just as amazing at night ( if you visit at night I would travel in a group).

Sunset. The place to see the sunset and rise
Wish I'd done both
Need to visit more than once
Great place to take a bottle and snacks whilst the sun goes down
Lovely for a sunset visit. In good weather it's great to watch the tandem paragliders jumping off signal hill. Great views of Robben island, the city and the west coast suburbs.

Amazing sunset. No matter what time you go up Signal Hill, the views are just unbelievable!! During the day you have beautiful views of Table Mountain and the Atlantic Ocean, and when the sun sets you wish you could just stop time!! When the sun has set, you can sit and watch how Cape Town lights up, and its amazing to see all the lights from the top of the hill.

What a sunset. We got there witht the night tour of the red bus, entertaining drive around the beaches until you get to signal hill to watch the sun set. Bring some good wine and something to eat meanwhile whatching this unique spectacle

Sunset place. The sunset up here is fabulous and you can picnic at tables and take your photo in the yellow frame. The views of the coast are fabulous and road back to the city offer great views of the city and the mountain

Go to Greece. We were told that Signal hill was a must see whilst in Cape Town. It allegedly had " the most beautiful sunset you will ever see."We got there about 6.30 and had about an hours wait. It was quite cool and was getting cooler. The lovely yellow, yet hazy sun gently descended to the horizon. The crowds cheered as it disappeared. What an anti climax! If you want to see the sun set I recommend any of the Greek isles. There you can sit with the drink/meal of your choice and watch a huge red/orange ball disappear into the sea. That's a real sunset to enjoy.

Great starting point in Cape Town. This was the first place we were taken to by our friends when we arrived in Cape Town. I think that it was a great choice in that you're able to have a terrific view of the city itself and a wonderful view of Table Mountain. Great for getting your bearings.
Signal Hill. Beautiful view. Toilet facilities were horrid. Dirty and no loo paper available. Very full car park and lots of locals picnicing

Boom.. This is the place to be for the noon day gun. Get there a little early and listen to the history of the gun from an expert. Very interesting. Fabulous views over Cape Town and Robben Island in the distance.

Great viewpoint over the city.. Fabulous views from the top, short walks provide better viewpoints, car parking is patrolled and it seemed safe here.Paragliding is an option for further adventure. No baboons in sight on this visit.

Views of the bay, Table Mountain and Robben Island!. On a clear day I was very glad to have excellent views of everything and with Lion's Head too.
Friends had said 'go here for having views, if it's clear, of Table Mountain' (it's easier to see the Mountain when you're not actually on it!) - and so much else.
Views are excellent. Drive up (especially towards sunset)...excellent views and a place to always visit when the opportunity presents itself, walk and observe, locate yourself and take a camera!
Part of history. We drove up to the top but some people cycled. Good view but not as good as Table Mountain. Extremely windy.

Amazing views. We didn't have time to do the cable car as it had been shut most of the week so one evening we came up Signal Hill. There is a small car park at the top. The views were fabulous in every direction. There is a table mountain picture frame and a kiosk selling drinks/ice creams plus loos but not much else. It was full of people waiting to para glide as the wind had dropped there was a backlog! However when they did go it was fun to watch them too!
Great views!. Logical for a place with a name like this, but you have a great view of all directions, not just the Table Mountain.

Use the Hop-a-bus for sunset view. The Hop-a-bus service offers an evening trip here for 30Rand. The sunset view across the bay, over the city, and toward Table Mountain is stunning. An even better deal is the 2-day bus package for 250Rand which gives you this evening trip plus unlimited use of the hop-a-bus to tour all around the city and the beaches during the day, go to the wineries for tastings, and takes you to the Table Mountain cable car station. Its a great deal!
Beautiful. You get a great view of the cape town city as well as table mountain. Great spot to click pictures. Must visit place because of its view. Also has historic value as well.

Overview. See most of Cape Town from the top view. Lots of opportunity to shoot panoramic and wide angles. Be cautious though when visiting with young kids as I didn't notice enough safety rails or barriers on the edges of the hill.
On top of the world. Stunning views. Be careful, don't get separated from the crowd. There have been a few incidents of violent crime in the area

Go for sunset and enjoy the view. The view of Cape Town, Table Mountain, and the ocean is really magical at sunset. We loved watching the dying light here as the tourist buses left and the city lights came up.
Photo Opportunity. Great views over the bay and of robben island, we went up for sun set and it did not disappoint. Be warned tho it gets busy so get there early if you're heading for sunset!
Sunset visit. Did the sunset trip with the Hop on Hop off bus - great place to see the sunset - take a picnic. Toilets available, tables and stools and a large mat if you wish to sit on the ground.
Great Views. Great views of Green Point and Cape Town and wonderful to go and watch the sun go down. If possible, take a picnic and enjoy the atmosphere.
Signal Hill. There are little hiking trails throughout. You can overlook the city from different vantage points. The sunsets are spectacular!
View the sunset. This is the place to go to view the sunset, try and go on an evening when there is some cloud cover as this adds to the spectacle.

well worth the 5 min drive. as table mountain was closed due to bad weather we made the short drive to the top of signal hill -awesome panoramic views of capetown. good parking and many photo opportunities.
a view to kill. brilliant views of CT city bowl, table mountain and Robben Island. nice hiking trails- romantic spot for a picnic.
Sundowners. The perfect spot for sundowners with friends. Pour yourself a GnT or relax with a beer and watch the glorious sunset over Cape Town from up here.

Lover's Lane. The view from here overlooking the city is awesome at night. This is a poplar spot where locals take their girlfriends. The road is narrow and it usually get misty but it is well worth the vantage point it offers. You need to go all the way to the top to find the parking area.
Fantastic views!. One of the must do's in cape town, 10 mins drive up there and if u can find parking a great way to end a day on the beach before heading out for drinks/dinner!

Watch Atlantic Ocean Sunset from here!. My husband and I made a last min plan to visit signal hill as our citysightseeing bus tickets come with free night tour to watch the sunset. We went without not knowing what to expect as it's our first trip to south africa. When we arrived, we were immediately captivated by the beautiful view of the table mountains, Atlantic ocean and good aerial view of cape town. The sunset-watching itself was a breathtaking experience. It happened to be valentine's day when we were there. And i think this is as romantic as you can imagine it to be :)Be sure to add it in your bucket list when you visit Cape Town!

Sundowners. One of the ideal places to watch the sun go down. Pack a picnic basket with some good wine and good company. Parking space too small, arrive early to find parking. In summer the sun goes down anywhere between 19h00 to 20h00

Next stop after Table Mountain. If you've enjoyed Table Mountain then you're also enjoy this view of Cape Town from this hill. Signal Hill offers multiple spots where you can park and take pictures. Be advised of the narrow road going up and down the hill.

Worth a visit. We have stayed in Cape Town area for last few years and have never done Signal Point. It was worth a drive up and have a little walk around as the views are excellant. When we went there was some security guard about who advised us to be very carefull with our belongings as there had been some attacks there, which is a shame because you cant walk about comfortable and investigate the area. we did walk a little back down the road to take some photographs etc out of shot from other people and became very much aware of some small groups of locals appearing like they were tourists too and we did not feel comfortable so we headed back to our car. This is was the only place in South Africa that I have felt a little nervous and we were the last car in the car park too so it was,nt that busy- go and enjoy Signal Point but just err on side of caution.

Sunset and noon gun. everyone goes to watch sunset here so it gets a bit crowded (coaches too) but if the 'tablecloth' is in place on Table Mountain it looks spectacular from here.I didn't manage to get up here to see the firing of the noon gun, but will try again if I ever get back to Cape Town again!

Don't miss it and come early. For some unexplained reason, this place was not in our tip list of Cape Town, the one we received from people we met several days back. Did they regard it as OBVIOUS? In any case, this IS one of the first places to go to, especially if the Table Mountain is covered by clouds or fog. Several hundred meters lower, the Signal Hill is very easy to access, and apparently far less covered by fog and clouds. On weekends, come rather earlier than later, when hundreds of cars block the single road that takes you up there. The views are simply fantastic and most versatile, and it seems that many local residents join the tourists and simply come to look at their city's beautiful beaches, shore suburbs, the harbor and also the inner city. They bring folded chairs and simply set them by the road and enjoy watching the views. In addition you can also join or watch the many parachute gliders who take off from the top of the hill. Beautiful atmosphere, great views, awesome place. And by the way, at some point in the late evening/night, the road closes. Tried to go the there with the car, one last time before heading to the airport, but the road was simply blocked by a police car.

hard way up, but amazing view!. i prefer this view even over the one, i had from table mountain...but you sure have to be fit to hike (i´d better say: CLIMB!) this way up! some parts of the path i´d even consider dangerous...but once you are on top, the view is really cool!

Come early!!!. As this place is to be found I think in each and every guide book of Cape Town and it is very easy to get there... nearly all tourists and a lot of capetonians will visit in the afternoon.That measn that the traffic circle where you turn on the road to Signal Hill will get crowded a long time before sunset and especially on weekends a long time before sunsets all places at the end of the road will be taken. So come early with a picknick and spend some time or come late but then chances are high that you won´t get to the end but, the pictures half way up are also pretty stunning.
Sundown. Beatifull place to view the sundown and the city at night. I mademy nightphot's over there. Be shure to be on time to park our car.

FANTASTIC NIGHT VIEWS. excellent viewing which never ending only the thought of fires when on the hills is scary i must admit that our visits on signal hill is mainly to visit the shrines of muslim saints

Free picnic spot at sunset with a glorious view. Pack a picnic, a jersey (it can get chilly after sunset if windy, even in peak summer!) and take your favourite person in the world. Do not forget your camera to capture the moment. You won't want to forget this - a really romantic spot for some and simply a lovely place to enjoy sunset and a short walk while admiring the city from up high. You can easily spend 3 hours there, although you can do this in half hour if pressed for time. Plus it's a quick drive to get there and no hiking necessary - great if you're lazy like me :)

A signal to fly. Wow, what a journeynu this hill. Pity the people wh had to create the roadway up and up. For us in a car, it was a slightly hairy experience as there are not crack barriers along every stretch of the road. That said, oh my, WHAT an experience when you reach the pinnacle! We were fortunate to see 3 para gliders on their descent and a fourth was preparing to take off as we got out of the car so I was able to photograph him as he took off and soared. It is another spectacular part of Cape Town and yet another experience you would be foolish to miss.

Stunning Views Accross Sea Point & Cape Town. Really good view point to see for miles across the city. Watch out for the Helmeted Guiniea Fowl. Also, go and watch the Para-gliders they can be hilarious.

Cracking sunsets and no charge!. This is a cracking spot to watch the sun go down with a bottle of fizz. Lots of couples all have the same idea every night and if you are lucky there will be a man with a guitar adding to the ambience. An easy drive and a few rand to a parking chap will make the whole experience a cheap thrill
Great views. A really cool place to watch the sun go down into the ocean. Take a few drinks and some food and a great experience!

Dont Miss This Location if Visiting Cape Town. We always include Signal Hill in any tour we give our visiting friends & they are always happy that we did. Our most recent visit we were also lucky enough to coincide with the tandem paragliders taking off with guest & making the descent over Cape Town & down to Seapoint. It was thrilling to watch them even though I doubt they would take off with my weight ! Spectacular views in all directions. Couple this with Table mountain as a two-stage day is my recommendation.
Alternative views. his certainly has been cleaned up and a lot safer than a few years ago. No harassment at he top by car guards and great atmosphere

A great place to watch the sunset. Take a picnic and get up Signal Hill about an hour before sunset to grab the best spot. The views are amazing – across the sea to one side and towards Table Mountain looking across the City Bowl on the other. Watch the sun sink into the sea.

Breathtaking place. Amazing view!!! Lots of families spending time together, watching the beautiful sunset!!! If you want to go there... travel well before sunset as it disappears too quickly. Also the traffic tends to build up a bit towards the evening with a lot of locals parking alongside the road which makes it difficult to travel up the slope. If you enjoy riding and are good at it... try going uphill with your bike... it will double the pleasure. Make sure to take your camera along :)

Stunning Views from the top. We took the easy way using the hop on/off bus tour to get to the viewing point near the peak.The view were stunning even though weather not brilliant.As it was off season it was just as well we were dressed in warm clothing.We did not stay and took our pictures from the top of the bus rather than wait for the next bus in biting wind.This is clearly worth visiting for the views alone.

Beautiful Views. Its a short drive up to Signal hill from the main road. We went during the morning and there was plenty of parking bays. The views from there is absolutely stunning. You can see the most beautiful views of cape Town. If for any reason you cant get uo table mountain, take a drive here. its well worth it.
great views - worth the walk. if you cant get up table mountain for any reason - climb this one. less people and just about the same view.

Overly rated. Parking is a major problem during a peak season. I think its good only during sunset. Otherwise the views from table mountain are the best.There is a picture frame where one can take photos with the table mountain behind. worth doing for that

Beautiful views. From here you can see all of the most beautiful views of Cape Town. Grab a picnic basket and a bottle of wine. very romantic or a great time with buddies. A Must do and see experience.

Great views!. Whilst visiting Cape Town I climbed Signal Hill to see the Noon Guns which are the oldest SBML guns in daily use in the world.
