That experience alone was worth the climb, but, at the expense of just a little more energy, I climbed to the summit of Signal Hill to find a great picnic area with amazing views of Cape Town, Table Mountain and Lions Head, as well as Seapoint, Greenpoint and Robben Island. Well worth the visit and the effort!

If you like sunsets........ If you like sunsets then get yourself to Signal Hill.....pack a picnic or a nice chilled bottle of Constantia's best white wine & head up there at least a couple of hours before sunset.....leave it close to sunset & you'll find parking a nightmare & all the good spots already bagged.....

A good Hike from the City. We had planned to go up Table Mountain but the cable-car was closed for maintenance. Instead, we walked up Signal Hill from our waterfront hotel . Having checked the approximate route on a tourist map, it was not difficult to find the right paths. A good workout after a long flight. Excellent views of the city from the top.For those who don't want to walk, the hop-on hop-off bus goes there.

Stunning views. Worth the drive up there, great views and photo,opportunity. There are toilets but 'not as you it Jim'. It's basically a hole in the ground and a little smelly. No food up there as such but an ice cream van who sells water too.

Not worth the time. We went up her on the night tour of the hop on hop off bus tour and it was a waste of time the sunset the night we went up was very poor, there was a lot of traffic so it took ages to come back down and the toilets are the worst we saw in South Africa

Great views, weather not ffected. When in Cape Town, I spent one week, and tried for three times to get to the top of Table mountain with cancellations due to the weather. On signal hill, you don't need t worry, since the altitude is lower. The views are wonderful on all sides from the city, beach, views of Robben Island, and the table mountain park.

Best photo opportunities. Stunning views of Table Bay ahead of you and Twelve Apostles sneaking off behind you. Perfect viewing of Robben Island and Table Mountain - now with a quirky "frame" for your subjects to pose behind with TM right behind them. Picnic tables, WCs, Paragliding to do or watch... stunning must do. And all it costs is tip to the car guard.
This is really worth a visit. You can drive up or you can walk up. The views are sensational of Table Mountain and the city; plus there's a loo too!
Signal hill. Great views , there's a karmat on the mountain too,easy acess to signal hill not far from table mountain and one can hike up the lions head too

Great view of Table Mountain and Cape Town. You can drive and park at the top. Plenty of space and views like out of a movie set. You can do the entire journey in 30 minutes if you need just a short diversion.

A good alternative for Table Mountain. When Table Mountain is closed or very busy, you can allways drive up on Signal Hill. The views are not so good as on Table Mountain, but it is a good alternative.

Amazing sunsets.. A must see in Cape Town. Can be reached by car. Take the family with food and drinks and find a spot and watch the sunset. Really is amazing. 360deg views. Take your camera as well. I do this every time I visit this city.

Magnificent Views Over Central Cape Town & More. Signal Hill is a popular spot that offers tremendous views both on the way up and at the peak. On the way up Table Mountain as well as the main part of Cape Town is viewable. When at the peak, Robin Island and the World Cup Arena + Town is viewable. I also believe this is a possible location to paraglide from.

Beautiful views. Wonderful experience. Parking was clean , manned by Security Guards . A great drive up the mountain .Excellent views , good ice cream and you can tandem paraglide , book or get there early.
Quick visit.. perfect place to watch the sunset and when the weather is clear Robben Island is seen to the north. There are also some strange birds.

A Pic-nic at sunset..... What a beautiful setting for a pic-nic! I took the evening "red bus" tour @ 18hrs,in front of the two ocean's aquarium.When I boarded the bus I noticed everyone with pic-nic baskets,so I just thought 'great minds think a like',because I brought a bottle of wine,cheese,rye bread & grapes along,to eat incase all this beautiful sceneries makes me hungry.The drive along the sea coast was a real treat as the sun was still shinning.The views of Sea Point,& Camps Bay was very festive,as I've noticed that south africans do party after work,& yes even on week days!When we got to the top of Signal Hill,I saw all different kinds of people,the locals,tourists,children,old & very young,were sitting out on blankets & chairs,having fun & enjoying a meal before 'the setting sun'!Just awesome!

Beautiful views. The views are amazing. If you don't like heights, beware the road to Signal Hill is scary-I'm not afraid of heights and about had a panic attack. I went twice-the second time I sat on the left hand side of the vehicle and was much better. Make sure you parasail off the mountain. It was one of the greatest things I've ever done!
The most beautiful view of Cape Town. . The sights from signal hill are breathtaking. On a day with clear skies you will see all of capetown city. It's magical day or night. Take your camera!

A must at night time. This is a really good place to take a slow car ride and admire the beauty of Cape Town below you. The best time to go however is at night when the city is all lit up and you can see the extent of it all. As you round the final area and park you look down on Sea Point and the football stadium. Its spectacular.
Great View. Grat view of the city and Ocean from here, Nice ride up there and also a great walk to see Cape Town like never before

Just ok. The hill is not too impressive, bit over rated but you do get a nice view from it, but nothing you would not get from Tafelberg really, if you're strapped for time, skip, to Tafelberg instead.

Sunset. Brilliant views during the day, in the evening take a picnic and watch the sunset stunning, with south easterly wind it sometimes is advisable to wear a jacket, there is a coffee man at the top who sells lovely coffee

Walking up Signal Hill. Relatively easy walk up although the hilly bits above the Gardens seemed the worst.We walked up from Buitenkant St all the way to the car park and right up to Signal Hill itself. Take a lunch and have it up there.Our return trip was just under five hours but we were not racing.Unfortunately the day we were up there is was blowing a gale but it made the trip down hill seem more adventurous.Great day out; just remember to pack the lunch, water, wind breaker, hat and camera.ENJOY the view....
Good view. Signal hill is easy to get to, and you can walk or drive. The view is good, but Lions Head or Table Mountain is better

our 10k run. we ran from our B&B below to the top of Signal Hill and back down one morning. It was fabulously uphill all the way but so worth it. The flora and fauna alongside the road was beautiful and the view looking out over Cape Town keep me from thinking about the uphill part of the run. It was fun to get part way up to find an arrow spray-painted on the road and the words "Heaven this Way". It did seem like it at the top.

We walked up from the City Centre. Thats right, we were in training for hiking up Table mountain, so we thought we would take the long way to to the top of Signal Hill. Was a very good walk taking in the top suburbs of Cape Town we walked from Greenmarket Square, up Kloof St, then up the road to the Lion Head car part, then we found a dirt path that took us to the top of Signal Hill. We felt quite superior to those who drove up. Especially since the wind was howling 40km gusts - we had an absolute blast and the slow walk allowed us to really appreciate the view of Cape Town and surrounding moutnains. Just beautiful.. do take the walk if you can.

Fabulous views. It was our first trip to South Africa and so we were disappointed to find out that the cable car to Table Mountain was closed for maintenance. As a second choice we organised for a taxi to drive us from our Cape Town hotel to Signal Hill which is also next to the city.The lookout gives fabulous views of the city and the ocean. It also has a great views of Table Mountain.

Get up there for sunset. The hike was a pretty easy, although in some places you lose track of the path. Get up there a bit before sunset and just sit andenjoy watching the table cloth cover Table Mountain and the sunset over the water

We kept going back. To me this is much better that Table Mountain with its queues waiting for the cable car. Drive the windy road to the top and look out over both Cape Town and Table Mountain .. but without the crowds

Beautiful views. As a Capetonian it is sometimes easy to forget the beauty of the city we live in. My husband and I decided to take our lunch and have a picnic on Signal Hill. It was a beautiful day, so we found a shady spot and had our picnic lunch. The views from Signal Hill are truly spectacular. You can see Cape Town at its best, Robben Island, Table Mountain, Bloubergstrand on the west coast all the way to Camps Bay. This is a good place to view sunsets as well, but it does get crowded especially during the summer times. However, this is a definite must see. There is not much to do there except have a picnic, take photos and go for walks.

Great View but very limited parking. at sunset, there is probably one of the best places to be but the parking situation is very limited and frustrating, there is not even in high season. head out early to secure a parking, park a picnic basket, something to drink and enjoy this beautiful view overlooking cape town, Robben Island and watch the sun disappear forever for that day.
Perfect to get an oversight of Cape Town. Beautiful sights and very near from the city. We went after finding Table Mountain very busy so it is side by side from it.

Great view of the sunset. Go there to see the sunset. We can have also a good view of the twelve apostles and the lion's head. Bring your food to do a picnic. Depending on the season you'll go, have warm clothes as the temperature could be really cold.

Spectacular at Sun down. This is an experience that will last forever. First I joined the night trip on the open top bus and enjoyed the ride along the coast to get to Signal Hill. We arrived at 7pm. Just time to grab a coffee from an enterprising Cape Towner who has a coffee machine in the back of his mini van! Then one can walk around the hill and see all the people sitting waiting for the sunset experience. Picnics, cameras and just drinking in the view. As the sun sets the colours are amazing and are constantly and gradually changing. This is an experience on should not miss. I actually enjoyed it more than Table Top Mountain.
Stunning scenery. Used the tour bus to go and see the sun set. Perfect. Was very busy as would expect but this didn't matter as it was amazing. A great evening with the Red Bus Company.
Stunning views. This is an easy taxi ride up from Cape Town centre to take in wonderful views of Table Mountain and the whole of the surrounding area. Great for photo taking.

Beautiful. As we were unable to go up the cable car, my then boyfriend decided that the next best place to go was Signal Hill where he later proposed. We took a picnic and a bottle of champers and watched the incredible sunset. We always get so lost in the beauty and because the place holds this amazing memory for us, we always go back on our anniversary.

Monumental!. You cannot get a better view of Cape Town and the beautiful blue beach than from Signal Hill. This is an incredible locale which must be visited at least once by EVERY tourist. Plus, you can take a sneak peak at the world famous Robben Island.
Great view over Cape Town. From signal hill you have a great view over Cape Town. It is just a short footwalk to get up there and it is not so challenging to get there like the lions head.

Signal Hill. Perfect view of the city and the Ocean! We were unable to go up the cable car for Table Mountain, so we drove up Signal Hill as the alternative. It was a beautiful day and beatiful view. People were even up there hangliding down!

perfect if you cant do table mountain. Table mountain managed to evade us all holiday as the winds were too forceful and the top was too cloudy. However, Signal hill was the perfect 2nd choice. In fact, the people i went with who have done table mountain before thought you got a better view of Cape Town and Robben Island from here. So definitely do this either before you do table mountain or if you cant. Certainly dont overlook the option of it, You can drive up if you really must
nice view but not more. There is not much to see. The view is nice but after 10 minutes we drove back to the city with our rental car.
What a view!. Since Table Mt. was closed, we went up to Signal Hill. It was a beautiful day and the view was spectacular! Would highly recommend stopping here as well as Table Mountain.

beautiful vista. a romantic and beautiful setting to watch the sun set while enjoying a glass of wine. Take a light jersey as the wind tends to pick up most days. parking is a mission at the summit so try and park little lower down or get there early. watch out for the tourist busses.

A Breathtaking Drive to a Breathtaking View. My Dad was a bit freaked out by the drive up Signal Hill as it's not a super wide road, goes very high with a steep drop off on the side, and there are lots of cars/tour buses on the road, especially around the Lions Head Trail area.Once we got to the look out, the drive up was well worth it. We brought champagne and chocolate and watched the bay for whales and dolphins until the sun began to sink. The view is truly spectacular! If you don't have a car, it seems like lots of tours do sunset wine trips there and the red, double decker buses also stop there.Loved all the guinea fowl up there, too!

Go at Sunset and you will never forget the experience!. We took the City Sightseeing tour to the top of Signal Hill which gets to the top about half hour before sunset (although there are earlier buses). Had a picnic and an unforgettable sight of the sun descending in the west. There is something magical about an African Sunset.
Easier and cheaper (free) than next doors Table mountain.. The views are still excellent, although nowhere near as high up as the 'Table'. This camera spot is also walkable.
Good sunset. I visited with the night city sightseeing tour and was treated to a wonderful sunset. Having some clouds on the horizon made the sky pink, orange and then red.

Worth a trip for the view alone. One gets a better perspective if the mountain formation from the top of Signal Hill - cars & buses etc can get up if you don't fancy the walk. View over Camps Bay, Robben Island and the beautiful ocean are awesome - ph and the World Cup football stadium is very impressive too
Good view point. It's a good view point of Cape Town if you don't have time to ride to top of the Table Mountain. You get a good vie on to the Table Mountain an entire Cape Town.
Great views. On a nice day this is the best place to get an overall view of Cape Town for FREE - no queues - lots of free parking. On weekends you even get to watch the paragliders leaving from here.

Great Views and Paragliders. Terrific spot for city and ocean views. Good substitute for Table Mountain when weather doesn't permit visiting it. It is windy at the top, so be prepared or dress in layers. Paragliders launched and landed at the top and were fun to watch. The only negative were dirty public rest rooms.

Spectacular. Watching the sunset and the city lights at night, wow it was amazing. What I didn't like was the smell from the toilets, it was awful, you could just imagine what do they look like inside when they were stinking like that. Also the parking was not adequate
Nice view of the city. It's a nice stop for a few shots of the city and table mountain. You can easily combine Signal hill with the hike of Lion's Head.
Very nice views of the city and ocean.. Worth the trip up there for the views and photo opp, check it out, I don't think you will be disappointed..

Good views of Table Mountain and Cape Town. I did this as part of a tour when Table Mountain was covered with cloud. It is a great spot with good views but not as good as Table Mountain (which I did later). I would recommend both.
It was blowing a gale the day I was there so take a coat.

Good sunset spot. There are wonderful views off the city from the top of Signal Hill, it is easy to combine Signal Hill and Lions Head on the same visit. You can access the top either by walking which takes a couple of hours or driving, whilst we were there we saw para-gliders off the top. Great spot.

Fabulous Views. We got a clear day and could see all the major landmarks - Table Mountain, Lions Head, Football Stadium, Robben Island, V&A Waterfront, downtown and much more. If you've got a car, it's a must

Interesting Point of View. We had to settle for this site to view Cape Town from above since Table Mountain was close for maintenance the 3 days we were there. Good pictures with interesting backgrounds came out of this area easy to get to from downtown.

Watch the sunset!. We did this on our first day! We arrived in Cape Town and then went up to Signal Hill with a group of people from our hostel and watched the sunset. Lots of people take picnics up there, which we did and they also lay out this huge picnic blanket for people. Nice thing to do with your friends or with your girlfriend/boyfriend.
we like. We enjoyed Signal Hill. and partly for private reasons. This place put us in a very good mood because we felt good there and a few good jokes came out.
fantastic view. take a taxi or a bus to go to the top, Fantastic view on Cape Town and suburbs , the harbor the beaches and V&A Water front

Beautiful sunset, terrible traffic. We visited signal hill after we came down table mountain, it was very easy to find from there. The attraction has become too big/popular for what it is, as a result there is NO parking, and the single lane to the top doesn’t move. however once you get to the top, and find yourself somewhere to park, the view and sunset take your breath away. don’t go onto the viewing deck, take a small walk to the left and find yourself a seat on the grass, watch the boats go by as the sun sets, it is very romantic. In Short, go early, and expect it to be full of people, but find yourself a private spot to watch the sun go down, you won’t forget it. BE SAFE! signal hill does have a reputation for robberies, once the sun goes down, don’t hang around.

truly spectacular. Without doubt one of the most spectacular views that is possible to see in any city in the world. Cape Town is anyhow blessed with incredible natural beauty but also has quite variable weather that any two days can give such a different views around the iconic table mountain. The day I went it was perfect with bright sunshine and a few clouds. Gentle pathways with marvelous vistas await. A must do.
Nice views. Beautiful views, but thats all it really is. A good spot to catch some tandem paragliders though. Overall it should be a stop in your trip, but shouldnt be for more than 30 minutes
Brilliant View of Capetown. Once you drive to the top, the view is quite amazing. You can look down over Capetown, i hear the sunsets are fabulous.. however, one must be careful after dark.
Breathtaking Views. Absolutely stunning views.Nice pathways to walk,but please be very careful as lately there has been many reports of robberies and mugging.Don't get out of your vehicle at night!!!
Great views. Drove here. Very easy to get to and park. Views of the city and table mountain are perfect. I recommend this to everyone. Make this one of the top five things you do in Cape Town

Awesome view. Definitely worth a drive up there. If you put on your walking shoes and park halfway along the saddle there is a lovely walk along the contour, with views over Bantry Bay etc. Good for dog walks too.

very nice, but much better if combined with Lion's Head. From Signal Hill one can enjoy a great view of Cape Town. To walk from the city center to the top of the hill is really easy and very pleasant at the same time. I strongly suggest to combine this visit with the one to Lion's Head (it takes about 30-50min from Signal Hill to reach the edge of Lion's Head), so that the hiking would last about 3 hours in total and one can enjoy all best panoramic points over Cape Town in the same day. It would be a great combination!

Noon Gun. Most beautifull drive toward to top of the mountain. If Table Mountain is close because of weather permitting .This is the place to go to . Beautiful view from the top of Cape Town and Blauwberg and Robben Island .A visit to Kramat on the way is optional.(muslim ) culture.

Great Little Stop Off!. If you are in the area this is a lovely scenic place to stop off and have a wander. The views of Table Mountain and the Ocean are breathtaking and the paths make for a nice little walk. Definitely worth a visit!

Great views. Every visitor to Cape Town should do this. Easy to get to by car or Red tour bus. Walking also an option. The views over the city and sea and up to Table Mountain are spectacular. Good place to go early in a visit to get orientated. Remember your camera.

Awesome Views!. What an awesome view. I have been up to the top of signal hill a few times and every time I see something new. The view over Cape Town city, Table Mountain, the ocean with Robben Island and right up to Table View is breathtaking. There are a few concrete tables/ chairs where you can have a picnic, or sit on the grass with blanket. There are various little paths to follow to some outlook points too. There is also a little ice-cream shop that you can buy from - average prices and a treat for the kids.
Fantastic views. Well worth the drive. The views all the way are great and at the top you look down over the most affluent beaches and onto Robben Island

Great Views. The Red bus route took us here when the Table Mountain Cable car was being repaired. Great for views although not a lot to do here other than watch para gliders jump off in front of you..
Windy Viewpoint. Signal Point gives great views back over Cape Town and off over the cliffs and ocean to the south west
paragliding !. the paragliding spot is very good. excellent service and nice people. the landing point and views midway are a treat too.

A fairly famous drive to the back edge of "Lion's Head". Graphically speaking, this would appear as the rump of the Lion's Head mountain in Cape Town central. The view is spectacular, but needs to be accessed by some form of wheels. There have been some incidents of crime at night, (when the views are at their best), so it is ill advised to go up there to park and stand around after dark!

Great Views. If you can't make it to the top of Table Mountain, or even if you do, Signal Hill is a great stop. You still get panoramic views, but for free. You can also get great shots of Table Mountain from here.

Nice substitute for Table mountain. We could not afford to pay for the cable car on Table mountain, so we drove to Signal hill. Beautiful views. You can spend a couple of hours here. We saw people paragliding and watched them all he way down. It was late afternoon but we still took awesome pictures. There is also picnic facilities and a number of families enjoyed the views and the birds. The drive up there was also n nice experience.

great view. From here you can look down and see the people who pay to sit on the fairground wheel at he waterfront. why would you pay to sit on a fairground wheel in a shopping centre to get a view when you have all this natural beauty around you?
Noon Canon. Went at noon to hear the blast! It was really informative and the kids of course loved the build up to the actual firing!
excellent in all ways. it is the place to see cape town if you are not able to goto table mountain due to wheather conditions.

At the Top of the World. Cape Town never ceases to amaze me. This is one of my favourite spots. We love the picturesque views, the paragliders, and the greenery and unspoilt beauty. Overall unforgettable experience.
Great view of table mountain. Table mountain was closed for annual maintenance (every August), however the views of the city and table mountain were great.
WOW What a View. Table mountain was closed for maintenance, so we ended up on Signal Hill. The views were absolutely stunning. Many photo ops.

Walking up. A 2 hour walk to the top of Lions Head was a perfect ending for my trip in Cape Town. You goining up in a circle and watch over Cape Town and the Ozean! It´s incredible and you can beat yourself. If you´re not sure if you fit enough try it and go slow you will maybe not reach the top you can be proud of yourself anyway !
Amazing. Amazing views, especially at night! Very, very windy one of the nights we were there, so we spent most of the time in the car!

Para-gliding. I took an impulsive para-gliding ride off Signal Hill when I was in Cape Town in May. It offered a brilliant view of the city but unfortunately was too quick. It was great to be able to see a different perspective of Table Mountain and the surrounding landscape.

Great views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. The cable car up Table Mountain was shut for maintenance when we were there but this gave us a fantastic views in all directions, great for getting your bearings. Also perfect photos of us in front of Table Mountain!There is a car park with sustainable toilets (long drop but modern, spotless and completely un-smelly)

Honoring an old tradition. The Noon Guns at Signal Hill have been booming out for over two hundred years now, sometimes just announcing the time so that ships in the harbor could synchronize their time pieces, sometimes, in war, or shortly after, the honor the fallen.In the present day, they fire to honor the tradition, and help Cape Towners see how good their Atomic clocks are. A Naval officer makes an excellent prefiring talk, shows how the cannons are loaded the old fashioned way, with a bag of gun powder, tamped down with a wooden rod. Then he steps back, advises people where to stand, and counts down until the cannon fires. He does not pull a cord or press a button to fire the cannon. Interestingly, the cannon receives an electronic signal to fire from the South African Naval Observatory which uses their Atomic Clock to send a signal for the cannon to fire at precisely the right moment. And it does! It is all great fun. Plus the views of Cape Town from Signal Hill are quite striking.

Better views than Table Mountain. While Table Mountain is the tourist favorite, locals will tell you that the best views of Cape Town come from Signal Hill. It is a nice drive up, but once you reach the top you have a sweeping view of almost all of Cape Town!

Stunning Views. During my visit the Cable Car to ascend Table Mountain was shut for annual maintenance; but Signal Hill proved to be a wonderful alternative. The city sight seeing bus took you all the way to the top and between buses provided ample time to take pictures and admire the wonderful views over the city bowl, Robben Island, the Waterfront, Table Mountain and Lions Head. A lovely experience.

Great walk, superb views. Lovely - and not overly long - walk up the hill, for panoramic views of Cape Town. Not as busy as Table Mountain either, which was nice. Was challenging for a fairly fit 60-year-old in our group, but she handled it fine, so is accessible to most (there are two routes, a tougher and a less tough one).
Breathtaking.. Great attraction to check out when in cape town. Amazing scenery. Best to come during sunset,very romantic. And no charge.

Great views over the city. If you don't have time to go on the cable car then this is a reasonable alternative. You can drive to the parking area at the top where there are really great views over the city. There have been a few security concerns especially late at night so be vigilant at all times.

Perfect view!. When I did the City Sightseeing Bus Tour the bus made a stop on Signal Hill instead of taking us to the Cableway because it is closed during winter. The view was amazing! You could overlook the whole city, table mountain, devils peak, lion's head. It was breathtaking! Absolutely worth a visit!! :)

Spectacular view. Worth doing. Tremendous panoramic view of the city. Be careful, though, lots of wind. Make sure you stop on way up or down for pictures,as best views of the city are about two hundred meters before the summit. Ample parking.

I love this place....magical, special - you can view the whole of cape town - wonderful when the sun is setting and wond. this is one of most beautiful places to be - one can view the whole of cape town from signal hill - when there is a full moon, locals walk with candles and torches to the top. It is a magical experience and once done, never forgotten. A very beautiful place.....
What a view. An easy and well signed drive to the top of Signal Hill provided us with amazing views of the city and Cape Town - recommended as part of any trip
great views on a clear day/night. Take a picnic up and watch the sun set, really beautiful and best of all its free. Sadly the ablutions normally leave much to be desired.

Been there - jumped off it with a paraglider - tick!. Signal Hill itself has some beautiful views, both driving up it from Kloof Nek, and from the top.Parking is very limited at the top - which is made worse by the paragliding operations operating from there. I went to have a look - and ended up tandem-gliding in a paraglider down over Sea Point (town) to the seaside promenade below. Great experience. +/-R900, with about 20 minutes flying time. Maybe expensive per minute - but hey, what an experience!
Magnificent vista over Cape Town. Drive to the top of Signal Hill for a panoramic view over central Cape Town, the waterfront and Sea Point areas. Safe in the daytime, not advisable at night.

One of my favourite places to be. I can spend hours on Signal Hill just looking out over the city and sea. I always take the most beautiful photos of Sea Point, Green Point, the sea, the city (and beyond) and of course Table Mountain.

Historically interesting. Signal Hill offers some beautiful views of the situ as well as offering the visitor an interesting insight into some of Cape Town's history. The signal hill cannon is fired every day at exactly 12:00 and has been done so how hundreds of years to signal the time for original farmers in the area. Originally it was also used to signal the arrival of ships into the bay so farmers cold bring their goods to be traded. Visitors to the cannon get a free tour and mini lecture before its fired.

View of the City. A romantic place for couples who wish to enjoy the sunset, whilst feeling above the city.
There are toilet facilities for everyone.
The paths are again, wheel chair accessible.
It is safer if people are in groups. If possible, go with a local or tour guide.
Amazing sunset view. I totally recommend this. Heap up a bit earlier as it gets mobbed at sunset. Take a picnic blanket and some snacks and you will have a great experience!
hike with a view. if you visited Table Mountain and still have energy then this is a good bit of exercise. the view from the top is amazing, 360 degrees of visual pleasure!

Why would you rate this place low?. It has a terrific view of Table Mountain. You can see Robben Island from the distance and on your way back to downtown a cool panoramic view of the stadium. There is one place where some locals flying control remote planes. The bathroom was clean. The parking was very clean as well and is free. Take the time to enjoy the views and pictures taken. In less than one hour you can go to the next point. It's windy during winter so is best to bring your jacket and to cover your head if the wind is too cold. There are few places for pinic area on the other side. INo stores or food places, still is worth the trip.

Peaceful, beautiful, and safe. Signal Hill is that little hill about 310m high right next to Cape Town city centre and almost above Bo-Kaap, De Waterkant, Green Point, and Sea Point. It provides excellent views of Table Mountain, the Cape Town city Centre and harbour, the stadium, Robben Island, and the surrounding suburbs and ocean.It is part of the Table Mountain National Park, and as such is protected environmentally. The natural vegetation is good, except that there are a few exotic trees there that really should be removed. There's a stunning indigenous Acacia karroo there with thousands of beautiful yellow flowers on it in season.There are hiking trails that start there up to Lion's Head and beyond, and it's also very close to one of the oldest mosques in Cape Town that provide insight into our less-than-pleasant history.There are only two negatives that I find there. One is the lack of parking, you really need to arrive early or take your chance or go with a tour bus such as our red tourist buses. The other is that the toilets were not well maintained when I used them. This might have improved, or maybe I arrived on a "bad" day, but don't expect much in terms of cleanliness.Having said that, if you can "can it" for a while or "go" before you go, as it were, Signal Hill is a really lovely vantage point to gain perspective of the layout of Cape Town city and surrounds while relaxing in a tranquil natural environment.

Great view of Table Mountain. You can drive all the way to the top, there is a small carpark or you can park on side of the road. Some people bring picnic and stay for the evening to watch the sunset, you can also paraglide from here.

Nice view & a good piece of history. Put your ear muffs on when the gun goes off at noon. This practice has been in place for many years and is a point of every tourist map of Cape Town. This is the time when you have maximum tourists at this point.

Amazing nightview of Cape Town. You could practically see the whole of Cape Town on there. From Campsbay to Greenpoint to CBD. One of the most breathtaking view of Cape Town! Definitely is a must and if you could then taking the night city sightseeing bus, going there after 9 is not ideal for safety reasons

Tour of South Africa. We did this on our last day of the three week SA travel. so it was kinda sad. At the start neither of us was sure of what to expect in SA but now wish we were staying longer - like six weeks! We watched the sunset and the hang gliders take off and had to drag ourselves away with a promise to return.

My Favorite Spot in Cape Town. All the years that I have visited Cape Town, Signal Hill is always my first stop on my trips. The views cannot get any better as for the quiet and solitude which makes it such a relaxing place to visit.

Pretty view, swarms of tourists.. Came here to watch the sunset. Beautiful. Was nice and peaceful for about half an hour and then all the tour buses turned up and the vibe completely changed. If you can ignore the masses of people and them all running around to find the best picture spot, you'll have a wonderful time.

Drive up Signals Hill (Stunning Views). Ideal location for an early morning walk/jog, or a midday picnic. Safe and secure with many tourists. Excellent views of Lions Head, Table Mountain, and the Cape Town city bowl.

The noon gun BOOM!. Signal Hill is a signal importance to Capetownians. Historically the noon gun would go off so that sailors can set their instruments. Later on, during the war, a two minute silence, where all humans and vehicles come to a standstill, was observed. Today, the tradition of the noon gun continues using the same canons from the 1800s. The gun has been fired everyday since. Not many countries still practice this tradition, so watching the gunner load the gun and fire the gunpowder [no canon ball] is a treat.
Amazing Views. Signal Hill is a brilliant substitute if the Table Mountain cableway is closed. The views are pretty special and free! Enjoy :-)

Magnificent view of the City Bowl and Atlantic Seaboard. The view from Signal Hill is breath taking. Getting a panoramic view of the Mother City gives a new perspective to the beauty of the City. I liked the idea of sipping bubbly while taking in the views of this place.The limited abluition facilities to this popular tourist attraction is not cool.
Night. Nice for Night View for Cape Town City specially if the Full-Moon you'll find a lot of photographers taking pictures from there!

Fantastic family outing. Sunday (father's day) was a wonderful opportunity to take my family to Signal Hill for an outing. The place was quite busy but we did get some parking enjoyed our packed lunch at the tables that are provided. Despite the number of people the area was clean and well kept. After lunch we walked along the footpaths with our kids and they enjoyed the warm air and skipping over the wooden poles on the path. There was also tandem paragliding on offer and an ice cream vendor for refreshments. Beautiful views of Robben Island, the Waterfront, Table mountain and the Atlantic seaboard from Signal Hill

Perfect place to have a picnic with a view.. Signal hill often reminds me of the view that certain heights in Santorini, Greece, has to offer. Pack a picnic and your camera and head up to watch the sunset. Get there early though or you will battle to find parking!

Sunset over Africa. We booked a red bus trip for sunset, to signal hill. It was cold and windy and the Cape fog was setting in. Grey cold fingers crept into nooks and cranies. We worried that the view would be of nothing but thick fog. As we ascended Signal hill we edged ahead of the fog and and had a view of endless grey. Suddenly the fog opened up in places and we had pockets of view! And what a view it was! The city, Robben Island, ships way out at sea! Mother nature really showed off!
Epic sunsets. Awesome sunsets, take a cheese platter and enjoy beautiful Cape Town. Enjoy a bottle of wine. Take some fiends and have a meander.9

Lovely place to watch the sunset.. Large parking lot with picnic tables and guinea hens running around. Restrooms and the drive up and back is lovely. See the ocean from one side and Capetown and Table Mountain from the other. When the city lights come on the view is spectacular -- the ride back lets you see the soccer stadium built for the World Cup.
Simply spectacular !. Just go and tell us if we were wrong ! Simply spectacular views - the best especially when the Table Mountain is in the clouds.

Amazing Sunset. We drove up to the parking area at the top of the hill before sunset, took a cooler with some refreshments and had a choice of camping tables or sitting on the grassy slope. We enjoyed the excellent view and when the sun started setting over the ocean we were awestruck by the amazing beauty of this daily occurrence.Go well before sunset otherwise you may not find a nice spot.The bathroom facilities were clean and well kept.I can recommend this attraction!!!

If the weathers bad its your best option and the views are still great. O so this one is the third in line of the city view points after Table and Lions head but if the weather is persistently bad which we had in Winter, then it's worth a visit just to stand above the clouds (some days) and if they clear, get some great views. It offers a nice panoramic view of Table Mountain as well as the city but can be clogged with tourists and idiot para gliders sprinkling for business. Just be prepared!
Best Sunsets. My favourite sunset place. You can drive up the hill and just chill , watching the sun set. Keep close to everyone for safety.
Great place to see the sunset.. Courtesy of the Hop On Hop Off bus, we thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the top of Signal Hill. Incredibly beautiful evening.
Boom!. Go at noon for the daily cannon blast. Great talk first by the Navy man before the blast. In fact go at 11:40 to hear his talk. Stay back from those cannons.

Stunning views in all directions. I hadn't planned on visiting Signal Hill but when I found some extra time, decided I might as well. Wow, I was so glad I did! The views back to Table Mountain were stunning and there were plenty of needs to stop to take photos before I actually got to the main car park! There's also a glorious view of the World Cup stadium and Waterfront. Definitely well worth it though you do need a car as the sightseeing bus doesn't go there. Expect to pay the normal nominal amount to the parking attendant. There are toilets at the main car park. My hotels advised not to go there at night and whilst I'm sure the views would have been stunning I decided they probably knew best.

nice view of the city. Good place to go by car and get great views on Robben island and the city of Capetown. On the spot you can look alle around to Lions head and downtown Capetown with the soccer stadium.

Be careful. Great views but a known crime spot. Not qwell protected by police. Avoid at night. One evening during our stay a girl was raped by three men while her boy friend was tied up and had to watch!

What a view. What a view from there. Also perfect for taking pics of Cape Town and enjoying the fresh air and nature. Just use comfortable shoes and watch the weather closely and take warm clothes in winter.

Good view of Table Mountain. Signal Hill is nothing really special, you can get a great view of the mountain and Lions head together with the Apostles. Go have a walk up there or just take a taxi and make some great pics. Can be done in one hour.
Stunning views During the Day. Absolutely gorgeous view. There are multiple places to stop at and just look at the view of Cape Town. Avoid at night, very dark and no security.
Best visited at sunset. Signal Hill offers a great 270 degree view across Cape Town and the Bay, with Robben Island in the distance. On a clear day at sunset the views are truly awesome!

Fantastic views. Drove up to the top of signal hill on our second evening in Cape Town. Fantastic views of Table mountain, V & A waterfront, football stadium and in fact all of the city bowl area. Great place for a picnic at sunset.

Go at sun set. Even though it was cold and windy, this was well worth the trip to watch the sun go down over the Atlantic. African sunset have a magic to them that reaches the soul, and watch the sun go down over the ocean's horizon you can believe that you experiencing such beauty. Advice: Make sure you dress warmly, there's a guy selling hot drinks there but just go prepared for the windy chill. I loved just sitting on the grass embankment and taking a bit of time to watch a beautiful African sunset.

Beautiful!. This is a short drive from the famous Table Mountain (and technically a part of the Table Mountain Reserve Park)! It won't take you long and you can see Table Mountain from Signal Hill. Also, I saw a bunch of paragliders there when I visited if that interests you.
Signal Hill,well named !. Outstanding views all round. Well worth the effort of getting up there. Showing off Cape Town and Robbin Island to great advantage. Quite memorable.

A beautiful place. We went there early in the evening for a picnic and we saw the most beautiful sight there. We went there to see the sun set and we were not disappointed with the breathtaking view we got. Anyway, what we saw was the clouds moved in from the South and covered the valley and the sea below us and nothing covered us up! The resulting sunset was that the cloud added to the spectacular view of the sunset and there was orange colour everywhere. I will definitely do this again.
this view is AMAZING. The view from signal hill over Cape Town is great at any time of the day. Make sure you go there when in Cape Town!!!!!
Nice view, but lots of tourbusses. Nice views from there but avoid the parking area, there are too many tourbusses. We also felt a bit unsafe there. Much better to go and climb Lion's Head instead.
Amazing views. One of the best panoramic views of Cape Town City bowl as well as the Ocean. Perfect for sun-downers - take your own blanket and drink of choice. Oh yes, and your camera!
Nice views. It was a cloudy day, and Table Mountain was covered in cloud, so this was an alternative. The road was good, and views were 270 degrees or so.

Amazing. Sunset on Signal Hill, on a clear evening is amazing and really worth doing. Great to be surrounded by fellow tourists and Capetonians gathered together for the spectacle - there is a buzz of expectation about the place. Take some drinks and snacks up and do it in style. After the sunsets its worth walking down to the first corner on the road down. As the light changes you can get some fabulous shots of the city and its lights.

Sunset is great, but come down after that!. This is a wonderful place to see sunset, but there has been some incidents after dark. Better leave after the sun set.No need to be scared, just be careful!
sunset at signal hill. just do it! Beautiful view over Cape Town and the Atlantic ocean, take a sundowner up there you definitely never forget this special experience.

Worth a visit to see Table Mountain from a different view. There's nothing up there other than a viewing area but is worth a visit to see Table Mountain and Lions Head from a different perspective. Also the Paragliders are jumping from there so is fun to watch them :-) The City looks closer for you to enjoy and take tons of pictures.

worth the twisting trip up. try and go both early morning and late afternoon to get the best clean views - there are loos here and one afternoon a mobile coffee van but nothing else except amazing views
Not very interesting. I hear it's a great place to hike as well, but otherwise looking at the cannons isn't all that exciting.

Picture Time!. Took a nice, easy drive up Signal Hill. It does not take long and it is a free site. If Table Mountain is closed, make sure you come here. I would do both if possible. The HOHO bus does not go here during the daytime. We had great views of the city bowl, V&A, inside the stadium, Sea Point, and of course Table Mountain. If you don't have a long lens, which you would need taking pictures from Table Mountain, this is a great place to be. Walking around the top of Signal Hill affords you many interesting angles for picture taking. There is a small parking lot and rest rooms. If you're lucky, maybe the local para-sailors will snag a customer while you are there, and you can watch a tandem jump. Next time, we will try a night visit.

Paragliding!. We didn't actually hike up Signal Hill; we rode to the top and had booked a tandem paragliding experience. It was probably the best thing we did while in Cape Town. It was so amazing to step off the mountain and be lifted up by the wind soaring above the town with views of the ocean, the town and the mountains. What an amazing view! I could have stayed up there all day! We landed so softly on the grass below. A must-do!
Great views but can be dangerous. Great views of Cape Town ,but do not Bo there late at night or alone. People have been attacked on occasion.
STUNNING SUNSETS!!!. We were taken up to the top by the City Sightseeing Tour to watch the sunset. Pack a picnic dinner and enjoy!

Terrific Views. This is wonderful for a ride up the mountain as you get a 180 degree view of the beaches at Camps Bay, Clifton and also the magnificent views of the waterfront and if you are there around 12 noon the cannon is fired indicating noon. This can be heard from the boat trips around the harbour as well so well worth setting your time and taking note. But please be careful when driving up here at night time as you must have your car doors locked as there are some undesireables that hang about. Be alert and you will be fine. Also there are gliders that fly off the mountain and this is something nice to see

Spectacular Views, just pray for tame wind. We went up to Signal Hill as part of the night tour of the open-top bus.Make sure your camera is fully charged and your memory card empty as the views are breathtaking--not just when up there but even on the way up and down.

Loud but cool thing to see. I'm a big fan of upholding traditions. We went to see the firing of the noon cannon at Signal Hill. I like that its a tradition that has continued throughout the years. Just remember your ear plugs.
Great free view. Drive up to Signall Hill and capture some amazing photos of Cape Town during sunset. You won't regret it. You don't pay for the view.

Paragliding at Signal Hill. A great vantage point to see Cape Town and area, very few people, beautiful day, even took the tandem paraglider down to the waterfront. Only downside is the weather did not favour a longer ride, next time off Lion's Head.

Worth the walk. We walked from the Lions Head to the Lions rump along Signal Hill. Very accessible even for inexperienced walkers and the views of the city and Clifton Beach and Camps Bay are more than worth the effort.

Great for views of Cape Town. Great for views of Cape Town. Also, fascinatingly, the wind came and went depending on which part of Signal Hill you were walking.Definitely worth a visit for this who want to get an idea of the geography of Cape Town

Breath taking views. Went to visit Table mountain, but found the queues too long. As we had visited it twice before we decided to visit Signal Hill instead. The views were just as breath taking without the queues and well worth the visit. There is car parking although not a large one. There are also great views of Table mountain itself.

Take a jacket!. This is the place to watch sunsets from, but be warned, it is very popular so you may need to walk a distance after parking your car. The wind can stir up from nowhere, so make sure you are prepared. Although there is no bar atop, you can get coffe and soft drinks from a mobile vendor there.At noon, hang out with the navy as the noon gun is fired.
Great view. We nearly missed this attraction. Worth the detour for the fantastic views over Cape Town and of Table Mountain.
Best view if Table Mountain covered in cloud. The views are amazing, and impressive, even if not up to TM! The para gliders added another dimension to the visit, and it is all free.
Beautiful sunset. Disliked toilet facilties, dirty and no toilet paper !Liked the view and the vibe. Ate a picnic supper and drank wine while watching the sunset with family and others.

Accessible for everyone. You can enjoy great views over the greater Cape Metropolitan area, Table Mountain and Sea Point from Signal Hill. If you're unable to climb Lion's Head, this is a great alternative as there's no climbing required. It offers great views for free.Depending on the wind direction, you can also watch paragliders take off from signal hill.There is a parking lot but it can get quite full on beautiful days during peak holiday times.

A must at sunset. First Climb Lion's Head and than enjoy the Sunset with a Bottle of wine.Start your walk at the Upper entry point. To Walk Down lion's Head in the dark needs experience. We Never heard of any crime.

Amazing and clever!. really great for pictures, we could actually see it from Protea President hotel too. The taxi driver who took us up said that cloud hangs around it when the weather is going to change and thats how they know!

Another great viewing place. Much lower down than Table Mountain, this great vantage point provides superb views of the central business district and some other areas such as the Harbour. It is easy to access from downtown but, unless you are very energetic, you may need a car or a tour bus. A good place to take snaps of the Mountain

This is a good place to go for the views, especially if Table Mountain is closed. Not as high as Table Mountain, but if TM is closed (as it does for high winds or low cloud) and your time is short, this is a good alternative: you get good views of Greenpoint and Seapoint and the Atlantic coastline. Go about an hour before sunset and watch the sun go down and the lights come on

Celebrated Valentine's Evening on Signal Hill. On Valentine's evening a few of us (couples) went to Signal Hill for a sunset picnic. It was awesome, the view was spectacular. We took along picnic baskets and blankets and enjoyed a lovely supper there. It was very full but everybody was in a romantic mood because it ws Valentine's evening. This made it even more special.Road up tp Signal hill is very steep and parking limited but it is worth the drive up. one of the best views, I think in Cape Town. The non-alcoholic champagne just finished off a perfect evening.

Easy and Safe Views of Beautiful Sunsets. On a Monday, after taking a drive around the cape and up Chapman's peak, nearing sunset, my wife and I decided to pull off and try out the views from Signal Hill. We were able to easily drive all the way to the top. It was popular with lots of people joining us, including a police presence (but on the inverse you probably would not want to be up there on your own for safety reasons).The sunset views on the ocean were beautiful, city views were great as well. I would recommend bringing up a blanket and a bottle of champagne to spice up the romance.
On top of the world.. Still one of my best places to relax. Think. Breathe. Remember, explore and watch the sunset in Cape Town. Its a peaceful hill with a history and a view.

Easy to reach, fantastic views. Easily accesible by car, or in my case, by bicycle, has really good views over the city and the Atlantic Seaboard. The trip takes very little time and is a must to see the layout of the city, with the view over the Stadium and Robben Island.

Fantastic views. Signal Hill derives it's name from the days when a semaphore communication post on the side of the hill was used to send signals to ships in the harbour. It is situated next to Table mountain and one gets elcellect views of the mountain,ocean and of the city bowl .The view are also excellent at night and a night trip is a must The is moderately strenuous hiking trail of about and hour and 50 minutes that spirals up around Lion's Head that gives a much better view of the city and also overlooks Camps Bay and Sea Point. The trail begins at a gravel parking lot located under a patch of bluegum trees near the beginning of Signal Hill Rd.This is also a take off point for the para gliders .
Awesome view. Worth a side trip up the circular road. Incredible view in all directions - Table Mountain, Sigm=nal Hill, the City , Sea Point and Moullie Point

Marvellous Views. We joined several other people enjoying seeing the sunset and having a nice wine!! It is a very busy area and the only problem was that so many people left after sunset that a traffic jam ensued as cars had parked all down the road which made two way traffic impossible. Suggest waiting at least a half hour before descending.

Clearer than the top of Table Mountain.. We went to Signal Hill straight after coming down from Table Mountain where the tablecloth was hanging about (thats the cloud for anyone who does not know). We got some lovely photographs overlooking the city and Robben Island, many people had the same idea to go and get their holiday snaps from Signal Hill. It is a lovely drive up there with seats and very panoramic. Worth a visit.
MG101. good views from the top, busy when we went ( midday) and the car park attendants are a bit in your face, worth the visit though
Amazing Views. Signal Hill holds a special place in the hearts of all my family. So go there and enjoy the views. It's a special place for special people.
The best sunsets for free. A must visit if you are in Capetown. You have the best view of the city for free. On Sundays is very crowded...but worth to visit.
Great views of the bay. A simple drive to the top provides great views of Sea Point, Table Bay, Robben Island and Table Mountain. Security is excellent with good parking and easy walkabouts.

A sunset experience not to be missed. Anyone visiting Cape Town should do this at least once. Arrive early take a picnic and drinks and watch the sun slip into the ocean and see how the shadows change on Table Mountain behind. Can get v busy and parking is limited. If you want to avoid driving there is a special open top sunset bus tour as well.

Drive to the top of Signal Hill. An absolute must on your drive round the peninsula. Views are spectacular and less of a mission than the planning required to get ahead of the queues to get on the cable car (which is also a MUST, of course). Take care when wondering away from the crowds.

Best view ever. When Cape Town gifts you with good weather, head up to Signal Hill for sundowners. Although there are only a few picknick tables, the view of the ocean on one side, and the city lights on the other, makes this a very worth while outing. Take a blanket and watch the sun set over the blue ocean.
Magnificent views from its summit. Magnificent views from its summit. Rather windy and low cloud but still amazing. The granite formations on the way up are stunning.

Beautiful at sunset!. The view from Signal Hill overlooking Cape Town and the sea is amazing. Very picturesque at sunset. Wear comfortable shoes to walk from parking along the hill to the viewing area.
Lovely sunset. Take a hike up signal hill with a picnic basket and bask in the views of the cape. Spend a few hours enjoying the location.

if you have time to kill. Unless you intend to wander some of the trails leading from and around the summit but want to see CampsBay and Cape Town from a different angle I would not urge any tourist to visit the Hill.There is nothing of its history on show just views.

PUT YOUR FINGURES IN YOUR EARS. The drive up is worth it alone as the view you get of Cape Town is different to the normal one shown on the posters. Bo Kap in all it's colours is just below you so take a proper camera. More could be made of this attraction and it was closed on the last time I visited but still go. Of course don't forget to arrive before 12 midday or you wont hear the cannon.

Part of the City Sighteeing Tour. Visited in the evening for the sunset, as an added "free" extra to the the 48 hour option on the City Bus. Some reasonable photo opportunities, but it was very crowded and returning to the city after sunset could only be described as chaotic, due to traffice congestion, which resulted in a 30 minute wait.

Marvelous View. Signal hill is an amazing place to be. We went to Cape Town for a 6 days’ vacation; out of which we went to three times up on signal hill. The sunset view from here is breathtaking. You get a wonderful view of the ocean and the Table Mountain, with the beautiful Cape Town right under your feet. Although many people visit, we didn’t have much trouble finding a good spot for us. We did a picnic and enjoyed a good time. Very relaxing and romantic!
Great Views. Lovely views, quite peaceful and not too busy. You can get great photo opportunities of Table Mountain from this position.

Must see sunset from there.. Night trip tour is best and well worth the cost or free if you have booked a red & blue tour which is extremely cheap and great value .The views are great and you are just below table mountain.coffee bar there with excellent local coffee
Fabulous views. Awesome views of Cape Town, Table Mountain, Devils Peak, Cape Point drive and the Twelve Apostles.And not so crowded with cars and tourists.
Sunset here not to be missed. We ended our perfect trip to Cape Town with a superb bottle of wine, picnic basket and to-die-for sunset from the top of Signal Hill. A perfect ending to a perfect trip!
Sunset heaven. Take a bottle and watch the sunset go down...tea and coffee available as well as cold drinks..gets chilly...
Sunset over the Atlantic. Great place to watch the sun set over the Atlantic we went up on the Double Decker bus and glad that we did, there was a lot of traffic.

Sunset on Signal Hill - a Sight to behold. We ensured we travelled up Signal Hill in time to watch the sun set. - what a party atmosphere. Everyone in a festive spirit and then as the sun gradually makes its way across the sky - everyone was breathless - those who were in their senses remembered to take photos - certainly something I will do again

Best place to go to watch the sun set over the Atlantic. Table Mountain may be closed but never Signal Hill. The consolation spot for not going up to the Table Mountain, is actually quite beautiful itself. The amazing views of the coastline and the city with the setting sun in the background makes it worth a visit.

great place to have a picnic at sunset!. The tram was closed to Table Mountain, but this was a spectacular alternative - no lines and no fee! Gorgeous sunset views - pack a picnic and head up there! Lots of locals

Good view. If you want to click picture with Table mountain in background then this is the place which is highly recommended. The point on signal hill can help you get picture with table mountain in background.
Signal Hill. Great views from the top of signal hill, well worth the drive up during your visit to Cape Town. On the way back stop at Lions Head for more great views.
Worth a detour. Beautiful view of the city but do not forget to do Table MOuntain as well. The locals love to have a picnic on signal hill and watch the sunset !

Very pretty!. We go to Signal Hill every time we are in Cape Town. Best part, it's free! Second, the views are great. Probably the best place to take a picture of Robben Island and the town. Most people don't stay for hours so parking is not a problem. It is touristy, but there is no full-time restaurant and there are no regular shops. In high season you might have a few vans set up with food and drink. There are proper bathrooms. The hiking area is nice and not too long. Do wear proper shoes and be on the lookout for snakes. We saw a puff adder, but he was hurrying off into some thick brush and didn't pose a threat.

Photographers paradise. If you can get a lift up to the top of Signal Hill then you will not be dissapointed, although not anywhere near as high as Table Mountain it still offers superb views of the bays and coast line, ideal if you want to take some photographs, the route up is hairy as ther are no road side kerbs and isn't very wide...but its well worth visiting.

Worth a trip up at night. Stunning views of downtown Capetown at night make this worth a trip, especially if you have a car but I'm sure a cab would only cost a few pounds.We couldn't find anywhere specific to park so just pulled up at the side of the road. Very dark up here at night with no street lighting so probably not a place/time to let kids run around.
so romantic. we brought a bottle of red wine and watched the sunset... So romantic!Would definitely go back sometime (hopefully) soon!
Night magic. Take a trip up signal hill at night and marvel at the lights and sights of Cape Town. Top of Signal hill is very busy during the day and can be unpleasant but the nights are stunning.

Takes your breath away.... Signal Hill has the most spectacular, mind-blowing view of the Cape. You will obviously appreciate it the most @ night, where you are greeted with the most colourful and gorgeous, and also quite romantic view, depending on who you are experiencing this with! Will totally bowl you over!!! Beauty @ its best!!!
See the lights of CT. We went to Signal Hill to see the sunset. It was not so beautiful I had expected but the lights of Cape Town were very nice and worth seeing.

Good spot for nice pictures. Great spot for panoramic pictures. Of course also the story why it"s called signal mountain is interesting if you travel with a guide (and are interested in the history of the place).

Worth the view. If you are going to spend the time and money to travel to Cape Town, you will do yourself an injustice if you do not visit Signal Hill. The views are breathtaking and it is inexpensive.
Get a different view of table mountain. Friends had told us to use Signal Hill as a backdrop for photos and we were not disappointed. Worth a drive up.
Awesome views. Breathtaking views from the top - of Camps Bay and the City. Should never be missed - view may be even better than the view from Table Mountain.
Breathtaking. If you not fit for the hike take a car up and enjoy the breathtaking views. Chill and watch the sunset. A must do if you siting the Mother City.

Cape Town's sundowner spot. The view might not be quite as spectacular as from the Table Mountain, but it is still good enough to be be Cape Town's favourite spot for the sundowner. Just before sunset, crowds of locals gather here, equipped with picnic blankets, food and drinks to have a proper gin tonic or a bottle of wine. A most relaxing place.
crowded and dirty but great view of sunset. Parking lot was trashy and gridlocked. Trails were littered with picnic rubbish. But sunset views make it clear why it's such a popular spot.

Sunset on Signal Hill. I watched the sunset up here as part of my Cape Town Big Bus tour. The bad side is that the second that sun is down, you're being herded back onto the bus, but what you've just seen outweighs this niggle. Beautiful and simple, and a much-needed return to the basics of life and nature. Breathtaking.
Great view of the city. Loved the view from up there, great for pictures, you can see the whole city, specially on a sunny day. The drive up also offers a great view.
Beauty in the eye of the beholder ;). Nature at it's best. I love jogging and to have family picnics at Signal Hill. It's beauty is breathtaking.

A little bit exaggerated. Signal Hill has an amazing view. We included this place taking into accounts of all comments made on Tripadvisor. However we were a bit disappointed, because there was heavy traffic on the hill. Finally we decided to leave our car and walk through the top before the sunset. The atmosphere is cool and the view is beautiful however i can say that we have been to many other places in Cape Town which has better sunset views(for example Camps Bay I would suggest to visit Signal Hill not just for the sunset, but for the overall view of the whole Cape Town from above. Signal Hill helps you to understand why the city center is called "The City Bowl".

Romantic sunset. I have been to signall hill to picnic and to watch the sun set. A mind blowing experience and very romantic indeed. I watched Cape Town light up at night from signall hill..the views are awesome, enough to let ones jaw drop to the ground.

Sunset to Saviour. Do th night tour and appreciate the sunset at signal hill. Do remember to tae a jacket, as it an become windy. A picnic basket is a must, U buy Coffee etc whilst u doing your sundowner.

Beautiful!. Amazing view to look up Table Mountain and Devil's Peak and looking down, Robben Island and Cape Town City. A picnic area to take break with public Toilet. There's an ice-cream truck when we were there. Enough space for car park.

Nice views, interesting people. The city views are great, expect the unusual (paragliders take off every few minutes in the afternoon), artists, people in clown outfits were there, dogs.... but everyone is harmless.

Great views: the sunsets are killer!. If you lack the energy to walk up Lion's Head, at LEAST drive up to the Signal Hill parking lot / lookout area. The best time is sunset, but expect it to be crowded. There are not a lot of facilities up there, but it is about the view, after all.

Signal Hill. What a magnificent and unusual view of table Mountain one gets from Signal Hill, as well as great views over the city and the Atlantic seaboard. Take a trip there by car or on a tour - or for the energetic, hike along from Lions Head

Beautiful sunsets.... This place is beautiful for sunset and a view of Cape Town and the ocean. On the negative side the WC facilities are utterly disgusting. A real pity as most other places are well maintained and clean.
Signal hill. the view again is terrific, you just have to go up in the evening to watch the sunset over Camps bay, awesome.

"THE " Beach. Its the place to be for a couple of hour in the sun -when not windy.. !! and also a pleasant place for an early cocktail in one of the bars and lounges along the beach road or a romantic lunch ..
Great view. Visited Signal Hill for the noon gun ceremony. Briefing by the firing officer was enlightening and good weather made the event very enjoyable.
A veiw. There is really nothing else to say. There is nothing here except a few walks and some lovely views of the city.

The sunset spot. Quite crowded on a nice evening especially at the weekend but worth it for the two way views over the city and out toward the southern ocean and sunset. The locals take a picnic. There is only one road so if you have a dinner date elsewhere, get out early!

Watched the sunset from the top of Signal Hill. We had the fortunate opportunity to have our B&B be situated at the bottom of Signal Hill and then we were able to take the tour bus to the top of Signal Hill to watch the sunset. Really a spectacular vista. I would suggest to bring a picnic lunch or a bottle of wine to have during your time up there. It is simply wonderful.

Cape Town....another great city/harbor view. Great place to get a very nice view of the city & harbor. Took the hop on hop off bus up for the sunset which is a cost effective way to get there & especially if you buy a 2 day pass
Watching the Sunset!. Make sure you do this-it's free with a two day Red Bus pass and well worth it.Choose a cloud free evening!

Great sunset!. Wonderful place to watch the sunset. It can get crowded and can be hard to find a place to park, but at least you have options to reach the top. You get a different view than from Table Mountain, so it is a nice way to see a different perspective of Cape Town.Lovely to have a picnic, some wine & a great place for friends or a bit of romantic for couples.

Easy to reach by car and amazing view over Cape Town. And the sunset is beautiful to catch there as well. When visiting before sunset you can go paragliding or mountain biking. It is not the top of Table Mountain, but it is worth to go there as it gives a different view on Cape Town.

go for the sunset. join many others in travelling up to signal hill, take a picnic, wine and your camera. Go well before sunset time as parking is limited, take a seat or sit on grass, sip your wine and just marvel at the views and of course if you are really lucky a fantastic sunset

the noon gun. Interesting and worth the walk up. We visited Signal Hill as an addition to a walking tour of Bo Kaap with a very special guide, Cyril Johnson, who had formerly lived on the street in the area. tour advertised in Hop-on Hop-off bus brochure, and arranged at Dutch Manor Antique Hotel.

Ok during the day, absolutely spectacular at night!. If the table mountain is shut and you cannot access it, your alternative program should definitely be signal hill. Going there during the day you will have a great view over Cape Town, eventhough it is not that high.But when going there in the evening you will have a spectacular view of sundown and then see the city as the metropole it is with all the lights and the table mountain in the background.
Beautiful as always. Although there was a strong south Easter blowing, the panoramic view and sunset is not to be missed.Worth a drive even if you have been up Table Mountain.

Great views, and it's free!. Love going up to signal hill, whenever I get a chance. It has beautifull views of the city, peninsula and mountain, and there's no fee to go up there. The walks are nice and peacefull and the whole area is kept clean and neat.

Great vantage point to survey the city. Spectacular views of the City and best view of the Cape Town Stadium. I have done a few events on Signal Hill and guests love the views of the City Bowl and Table Bay.

beautiful and scenic. wonderful for a sundowner or just to enjoy the view, be vigilant, people do get attacked, do not visit at night. It's a nice walk up, but again, be carefull and do not go alone. I suggest at least a group of 5 people and don't take valuables
Nice and easy. You can reach it by car, have a picnic or just enjoy the view. Not so much to see, but if you walk, you can see the waterfront, bo-kaap, etc.

Signal Hill has the best view!. Drive to Signal Hill to see the sunset there. It is really great. But be early because there is small parkinglot which is full very quickly. Bring your own picnic, the locals do it too

Drive Right to the Top. After you've done the Table Mountain cable car we would recommend driving to the top of Signal Hill which gives you an excellent alternative perspective on Cape Town and the surrounding mountains. If you have a car, a trip need only take you 30 minutes and it is well worth it
VIEWS!!. We drove up here at night and it was amazing to see Cape Town lights twinkling below us. Next time I plan to walk up there reday for sunrise as it'd be spectacular.

Scary drive but great views. Easiest way to get a great view of Cape Town & Robbin Island if you have a car. Car park at the top has grotty public loos but great views. Drive up is not for the faint hearted.
Incredible views of sunset on clear days.
Fab Views. Excellent views over the city. Can appreciate how beautiful the scenery is and as always the mighty Table Mountain dominates.

Recommended Activity - Flying!. We visited Signal Hill Drive and hiked up Lion's Head with picnic basket and lots of water, expecting to find the best view of Cape Town (from above). My friend noticed a 60's Triumph with exciting Parapax Paragliding graphics. She called the number and Stef asked us to simply walk another 100m up the path, where we saw the paragliders taking off. After some back-and-forth decision making, we decided to make the most of the day and fly with Stef and "Iceman". It was the most awesome thing to do in Cape Town yet - the view was spectacular and serene! We then watched the glowing red sun disappear behind the sea over some beers in Camps Bay. Stef's company's name was ParaPax - what a fantastic crew!

A good free sight. The winding drive up to the top of Signal Hill is great if the weather has closed Table Mountain because you get a great view of Cape Town, the Waterfront and more. It isn't a big car park, so it might be challenging if things are busy, but well worth a look.
Good views. Well worth driving up to Signal Hill as you get very good views of Cape Town but also of Table Mountain as well. You can picnic up there and there is parking.

A best place to watch sunset in capetown. It was a perfecy place to watch sunset. We wnt with night bus ?(a semi open doble decker bus) from capetown. it was very nice to see all beautiful scenary up and donw hill. However, after sunset the weather become chilling..so be prepare with warm clothing

Sunset. This is the place to go and have a sundowner and watch the sunset. Need to take your own drinks as no shops there but please pick up your litter when you leave.In winter take a blanket as can get a bit chilly.

Petty crime. Signal hill is not a safe destination. The views are great, but you can get better views from Table Mountain. It takes forever to get to the top of signal hill and you might end up being robbed. So rather take the money and your time and take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain ... you can then wave to the lot who decided to go to signal hill.

Compulsory. It's holds a vista of Table Mountain that simply has to be seen. Nice view of Robben Island and controversial Cape Town Stadium as well as the city bowl stretching round to the the suburb of Sea Point as one tracks around the mountain. If you go at noon there's a war memorial noon day cannon that is fired from a base on the hill (much safer then too if you're worried about crime - not that I've ever seen anything suspicious)Lots of paragliders in ideal weather. Not much parking. Public transport does not go all the way to the viewing site. No shops - maybe a snack van. Use car or taxi, or +- 3km walk from bus stop.

Great View and low on crowds. We had a taxi driver take us up to Signal Hill. Table Mountain was so crowded and packed with people we chose Signal Hill. The view was awesome and we were able to get pictures of table mountain. There was no entry fee and well worth the stop.

Sunset views. Very quick sunset and magnificent views of Cape Town beach area. Quite cold once sun has set so rug up. Parking limited, luckily we were on the City Sightseeing bus, so that wasn't a problem for us.
Great Views. This is an easy drive to the end of the mountain for wonderful views of the city in three directions! Also, you have a fantastic view of Table Mountain!

CLOSE TO THE CITY AND THE CABLE CAR.. This is so close to the city that you can just as well fit this short trip in. Beautiful views as the road winds around the hill, with a parking are where you can stretch your legs. A great view of Robben Island.
Most beautiful view in Cape Town. My favorite spot in Cape Town for a scenic view. You can look at the city, at Table Mountain, and at the ocean. Great for picnics or watching the sunset.

Worth seeing!. I have often visited Cape Town but for safety reasons I never went up Signal Hill. This time however I decided to give it a try! I was so pleasantly surprised by the facilities, scenery and safety! I have been up Table Mountain with the Cable Car many times but this experience was breathtaking in its beauty and no long lines. I will definitely recommend it to anybody wanting to experience the true beauty of Cape Town and surrounding areas!Just a tip... Do not go alone at night, take a tour!

Sundowner Picnic. WOW, such a different view of Table Mountain as well as Robin Island and the city as you drive up. I suggest ppl always go and have a view. I've heard ppl say its unsafe, but I've usually seen the police patrol there late, and its always busy and in the past 4 years I've never experienced any issues, gone there late at night, early afternoon as well, no issues.

Great views over Capetown. An alternative option to Table mountain which can get crowded with long ticket queues on sunny days. Great to watch were the paragliders taking off from Signal Hill. Has toilet facilities, but be prepared its a long drop!
Wonderful views. Quite amazing to drive up there and view Cape Town. You pay to park at the top, but anywhere on the road is free, and you still get the views. Hard to stop taking photos!
Walk up to the top. The views from Signal hill are superb!If you have time a walk up to the top of Lions Head is very rewarding and not too stenuous.
Noon Gun site. Only tried to visit once, but it was all locked up - shame! It would have been nice to see the cannons as we hear the gun every day!

to be done with lion's head. It is the perfect complement to the climb on Lion's head. From the parking you'll have a wonderful view of the Table Mountain and lion's head hanging over you head. Good view on the beaches and on the city. Be careful when parking not to leave any valuable object in your car.

Great view, great sunset. beautiful landscape view, rraching all Cape Town, the sea, Seapoint, Robben Island, the "all package". Perfect for the end of a afternoon, but don't forget to take your coat or blanket with you... It can be cold up there
