A nice view. You can reach it by car. You can admire Cape town and the Table Mountain from this place. It's not particularly wonderful, but it takes a little time to reach it if you have a rented car. So don't forget it after visiting the Table Mountain.
Paragliding from Signal Hill. Paragliding from Signal Hill is an absolute must. Feel the experience of 'flying' above CapeTown and have the joy of the silence in the air above a busy metropolitan.

The most impressive view on Cape Town. From Singal Hill you have the most impressive view on Cape Town, especially port and Camps Bay, you can also see Malaya Distrinct and great view of table moutain. Another must see in Cape Town.
Vantage Point. Excellent Point up the hill overlooking the entire atlantic ocean, Robben island, Bantry Bay. Lovely spots to sit and soak in the sun and have a picnic.

Great Views. If you go to Table Mountain, you should go to Signal Hill too. The views do not match the top of Table Mountain, but they are well worth a look. If you do not make it to the top of Table Mountain, definitely go to Signal Hill.
Views a plenty. An easy drive to experience great views, especially the night lights. Stay in your car as a safety precaution though.

If Table Mountain is closed this is good for a view. It was raining quite heavily and windy as happens in August in Cape Town. As the cable car was shut I passed through and headed up onto Signal Hill. You get a very good view back over the city bowl and towards Cable Mountain. It's worth the trip up for a diffent perspective on the city if Table Mountain is shut down. Easy access from car and about a 10 minute drive from the city centre.

Sunset spot. The place to watch one of the best sunsets from is Signal hill. Okay, so I didn't do the romantic version - but there are plenty of people with their wine watching the awesome view over the sea.
CRAZY ROADS, Great view. A perfect spot to see the city and soccer stadium. Parking along the road and a parking lot at the top allow for excellent viewing! Be careful on windy days.

Signal Hill a must. One of the most beautiful outlooks in the Cape. You need to be aware as it has become a favourite place for muggers. So keep your eyes open. That said the views from the top - ranging from the Atlantic Coast around to Table Mountain and the City - are unbeatable. My best place to take visitors. Drive carefully getting up there.

Chasing the Noon Gun. The noon gun is fired every day except on Sundays and public holidays, but is not very easy to find. Signal Hill provides excellent views of Cape Town CBD, Table Mountain, the Atlantic Seaboard and Robben Island. Gets very windy but lovely place for walking.

A Must Do!. We hadn't planned on going up Signal Hill, but on our way back from the peninsula tour we were a bit early and we asked the driver to go up for a sunset view. Wow! What amazing views of the city. For us, they were better than the views from the top of Table Mountain (probably due to the inclement weather that day, but still). We got some great pictures and had a whole new appreciation of the city. Seemed perfectly safe up at the top. Enjoy!

Always well frequented!. Signal Hill is frequented by both locals and foreigners; so much so that there's not always parking available! But the views makes it all worth while. You can see the mountains beyond Stellenbosch in the west, the entire harbour area as well as Greenpoint and Sea Point. It is good for taking pictures from that height...
noon daygun. If you visit this site, you must be there for noon to see the gun, which is discharged each day. Cover your ears!!!!. The views are also stunning

A must do if you're in Cape Town. Visiting Signal Hill at sunset is a must do in Cape Town! The drive up is a little unnerving (especially if you encounter oncoming traffic), but the view of Table Mountain at dusk is gorgeous, as is the true African sunset you will experience if the weather is just right. Bring your camera!
Bang Bang. great views and hectic fireworks, the spokesperson could have a better grasp of the English language or even better there should be language guides you can collect as in British museum

Walked there from the city. Walked there from the city though a Malay neighbourhood with cute houses and little mosques. I followed Google earth via streets and a few paths. Be warned its a work out but great fun and really rewarding. I walked it in winter and worked up a sweat so if its hot take water and sun screen.
Great for 15 Minutes. Yes, the view is super (on a clear day) and the drive up interesting (let some else do it)--but in 15 minutes you've seen all there is to see.
Best Sunsets. The drive up is lovely, the views are awesome! Greenpoint staduim; city of CT. Take some wine and a few snacks up and watch the sun go down -- definately worth it!

A hidden view of the Mother City. A wonderfully secluded part of the city which offers some stunning alternative views of the city - wonderful views of the city bowl. Many people hike and it's generally seen as a very safe, free activity to do in the city.
A great spot for sunsets.... I headed up Signal hill for some photos at sunset... i am glad I did x x x x

Panoramic views so beholding..*-*. Another touristic scenic attraction of Cape Town!
Views from the top are so beautiful..the Atlantic Ocean,the city's harbour, the 2010 soccer world stadium, Robben Island are but a few of the sights one can behold from Signal Hill..
A must see when in the City of Cape Town..!!
Go for Breathtaking Views. This is an easy and wonderful short drive from downtown or Camps Bay. Weather permitting, you can have 180 degrees views over the town and Table Mountain.

Beautiful view!. Grab a picnic (or half price sushi from beluga) and go and watch the sunset up signal hill. Get there about 45 mins before sunset so you can get parking, take wine, and enjoy the beauty that it cape town!

incfredible. cape town is so stunning with so much to do, many people dont have time to go up signal hill. THis is a great walk and is said to be the barometer of good or bad weather. If it has cloud bad weather. Is the poor cousin of tablemountain and the twelve apostles. Special
Watch the sunset. You can take a taxi up and watch the sun set over Cape Town.

Romantic Sunset. I love going to Signal Hill with my partner or friends. It is lovely to just relax and watch the sunset. Usually we take a blankie, some food and a bottle of wine. There is nothing better than having good company and enjoy the beautiful view of the city and ocean.I would suggest that you be cautious when going alone. I would suggest going in a bigger group. As they say 'safety in numbers'
Signal Hill view. Beautiful vista of all of Cape Town, nice photo op site.
Okay...but rather head up table mountain. Still a pleasant drive, but I would skip it for the drive / view of a life time and head up to Table Mountain.
Great views!. A great spot to go and watch the sun settle, but you won't be alone. There are some good picnic spots too.

Drive to the view. If you are intimidated by climbing Lion's Head, rather drive to Signal Hill. Here one can view Robben Island and the Cape Town Stadium from the top. One can also walk around or have a picnic. Well worth a visit at sunset.

Worth seeing but don't linger here. A great spot to watch the sunset from, but it's best not to stay after dark as it's known as a petty theft hotspot. Recent efforts have been made to increase security. There are many other great views along the Cape coast or from the top of Lion's Head.
great views, good exercise. it's a bit of a walk, but the views are worth it. We are not 'hikers' but in good general condition so I recommend it

Great Alternative. If Table Mountain is closed, this is a great alternative for spectacular views. Be aware and keep your car doors locked when you walk around. I wouldn't visit at night although th eviews are spectacular with the harbour lights etc.

Popular viewing spot of Cape Town. We drove up the hill although many people walk. There is a parking area and viewing points around the parking. Sometimes people use it as their starting point for hang gliders. It was relatively tidy although a bit more cleaning up and maintenance would make it excellent
Stunning views with wonderful sunsets. Has become a little scruffy and often very congested. Still worth a trip for the amazing views over the City and great sunsets.
Fantastic Views. Really worth the drive... and enjoy the fantastic views!
Go for sunset. Signal hill has great views at night. Try to get there for sunset. It is a nice contrast to do Table Mt in the daytime and Signal Hill in the evening.
Beautifull sunset. We came here to watch the sunset; don't forget tot bring some wine!
Great Hike. Its fun to go on a group hike. I would not suggest doing it alone due to safety reasons.
sunset. watched the sunset from signal hill with a picnic and a glass of wine very romantic even though lots of others has the same thought

For that movie moment. Everyone has always said to me when i visit the Western Cape that Signal Hill is beautiful but dangerous at night. Im sure we, naturally have to be alert and cautious but i have down i lions head moon light walk and have been on two dates with my hubby to stare at the GORGE view and steal a few kisses!Do it, you wont regret it <3

Talk to the Painter. At the top of Signal Hill there is usually a painter. If you have the time talk to him. He has his own unique story of apartheid. We spent 2 hours learing about it from someone who lived it and he even met Mandela!
SUNSET!. You must go up to the top to take in a dreamlike sunset. One of the highlights of our trip.

Amazing view. Wonderful view of Cape Town and surrounds towards Sea Point.Also see Table Mountain.The gents was disgusting , but my wife said the ladies was OK.Can get different viewing angles as you descend as there are parking bays alongside the road
WOW WOW. Magnificently breathtaking - everyone visiting Cape Town has to go and take their breath away at the views of Cape Town. Spectacular!!!
Signal Hill. Good if you have a hire car. Great views of Table Mountain.

Excellent Views of Cape Town from Signal Hill. For the best views of Cape Town and to watch the sun setting over the ocean, you must visit Signal Hill.A few days every month as you watch the sun set, moments later you make a 180 degree turn and watch the full moon rising at Signal Hill. It is not recommended to go alone or at night. Always take a local tourist guide with or go in a group.

Sunset!. My husband and I were told that you couldn't miss sunset on Signal Hill, so we made our way up there just in time for the sun to set on our first evening in Cape Town... it was beautiful! Not too crowded at all!
Best Sunset. Take a trip up signal hill at dusk and see the most wonderful sights of the vast Atlantic, vibrant SeaPoint below you and Robben Island in the near distance. Spectacular

Hygiene. I am a Proud South African and for the first time we visited Cape Town. We went to Table Mountain and Signal Hill. The view was fantastic and the experience very nice ..... until we went to the bathroom. There was no running water, no water at all !!! There was black bags over the basins. There was no toilet paper so the people before me surely used their hands and dragged it over the wall. There was other people in front of me and they were visiting from Holland. What do they tell their family and friends??
located next to lions head. Traditional firing of the canon at 12pm to mark the time. This has been done for years,,,,,,and a loud boom eminates everyday at noon. worth a look....dont jump!!!

Nice view over the Football Stadium and the Waterfront. Easy access by road. There is a small parking lot. The site is extremely popular at sunset. Be ready to be caught in heavy traffic jam when the weather is clear...
Stunning view. Beautiful viewpoint of table mountain and capetown.Toilet facilities were clean - but long drop toilets.Slightly nervy driving up so high on the mountain top, but worth it!

Great views. If you don't fancy the scrum of the cable car but still want to see the views this is an alternative. Not as high but reachable by carand with some good walks nearby. Tourist buses come but they didn't seem to stop long so not a problem
great view. Go to signal hill for a great photo of Table mountain and great views of the city

views views views, plus atmosphere. go at sunset, take your camera, put it on a tripod. see the city lights. what a vista!!! awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! twinkling lights everywhere. very very romantic.
Stunning sunsets. This is a must when in Cape Town. Get there easrly, take a bottle of beer and wait for a beautiful sunset over the city.
Great view of Robben Island. Go there at sunset with a bottle of wine and cheese

Best free view of Cape Town. From the Lions head to the rump this gives great views of Cape town from all sides.Drive out towards Camps bay and take a right onto the hill. You can drive all along its length to the top.Especially good if you're not so mobile.Go in the day and come back at night to see the city lit up.You can photograph Table mountain to the docks, to the city look down on the World Cup stadium and watch massive boats sail out to the Cape. And its free to drive up there but please respect the country code and take your litter home :¬)
Photo Call. Went with a tour party. Great information from tour guide but I guess for me it was just ok. Photo call I guest for many people.Nothing much more to say other than it was a great view.

Sunset at it's best.. Drive up to Signal Hill at sunset with a bottle of champagne and watch the world go by. Watch cruise shipe enter and leave Cape Town, see spectacular views in all directions. Leave your camera at home at your peril!
Take a tripod.... A late afternoon picnic to watch the sun go down. Very crowded but still worth a visit. I managed to get some pleasing photos of Cape Town as its lights went on.
Best Sunset Spot around. I always love watching the sun set over the Atlantic and the city of Cape Town from the top of Signal Hill
worth the effort to visit. worth making the effort to get up to signal hill, most tours dont go there. great views of the sea front and the stadium, as well as a different view of the mountains

A view to rival Table Mountain. We drove to the summit on a sunny morning and were very impressed by the wonderful view.We had a great aspect of Table Mountain, and also down to Greenpoint, and right over Cape Town and its docks.If the Table Mountain cable car is closed it is definately worth going here instead to get a similar view on the city.
Great view. Had the pleasure of getting to Signal Hill and seeing that amazing view of Lions Head and Table Mountain.

Security needs to be improved !!. I feel that insufficient warning is given to visitors / travellers in respect of the fact that not everybody is ' friendly ' on Signal Hill ! Unfortunately in a country where poverty is a very real fact of life muggings unfortunately tend to become ' routine ' and as such go unreported. Signal Hill offers some wonderful views of Cape Town and our legendary sunsets if you do visit please exercise caution !

Cape Town Hill. Drive up to Signal Hill to see the lovely Mother city and breathtaking views...for FREE. We took some refreshments and had a lovely picnic. There can be some crowding when the big tourist busses emerges and all the tourists flock to take pictures, but definitely still worth going up there. For the more fit at heart…you can also take a stroll up.

walk to Signal Hill and enjoy. Signal Hill is a great place to visit. You can do a long walk from Lions Head parking or from the town. You can also get there by car or tourist bus. It's great to see the Stadium, Sea Point , Green Point etc. from there. There are many places where you can stop and enjoy the view. Cape Town is an amazing city. You will enjoy it wherever you go, whatever you do. :) There is a shop to buy some drinks there, but there is a possibility to find it closed, so if you walk all the way, better take some drink with you :) In Cape Town you always need plenty of liquid because of the heat.
What a view !!. It 's worth to go there to see the view - the town ,the waterfron and the sea !!!

Sunset - nice to have seen it. Can get a bus trip up here if you buy a 2 day pass to the red and blue bus routes around Cape Town (250 rand for the 2 days) and you get up to Signal Hill just before sunset, watch the sunset, and bus back to town. It was windy and progressively colder, so dress up for this one. Good views over Cape Town, and the Atlantic coast

Great View & Free. This is definitely worth the drive up the hill for the spectacular view of downtown Cape Town. The best part is that it is FREE. You won't get the distant views of the Cape of Good Hope from Table Mtn but you get an up close personal view of the city. Also, you must go at noon for the canon shot to watch all the birds take off from the noise. For the ambitious, you can hike up lion's head. It's also great for a picnic.
great views. worth the trip up to take great pictures of the view.

Big Traffic Jam. The place to go when there is a sunset...... except everone else goes too. Very poor access and exit...... all the same way on what becomes a single track as everyone parks on the road.... If you do plan to go go early. We could not find anywhere to park... for miles but were stuck in the system Eventually found enough space to turn round and get out. The beach at Camps Bay was a good enough vantage point for us. Never again.

360 debree breathtaking views day and night. You can see with a birds-eye view the whole of the Mother City and all its splendor. You can clearly experience a sweeping view from Robben Island all the way across to the formidable and regal Table Mountain backdrop. Amazing, and its for free.
Spectacular views. A must do when in Cape Town ... the views are amazing. Top photo opportunity ...

Worth going!. Our trip to Signal Hill was included in the City Sightseeing of Cape Town. It was an evening trip to see the view of Cape Town. Unfortunately, not many of the lights were on, but we did see a good sunset. Some travellers took a picnic with them, as there were tables etc. at the top. The views were good all the way around.
Part of the Lion's Head. You can drive up here for a view of the City and Green Point but I'd rather go for Table Mountain for the view as it's right next door
Jump!. Parenting from there was great. Wish it lasted longer.
more good views. Able to see Robben Island from here and also across the city
Lovely Sunset. Excellent view of Cape Town Coastline and the mountains. The sunset was great. Lots of people sitting around having a picnic. Happy & lively atosphere.

Lovely views. of the city basin of Cape Town. Can drive up, cycle along the ridge or even walk a fair distance. Best option is to drive to the end of the famous "LION's TAIL" - spectacular at night, but don't linger. Have been a number of petty thefts reported!
Walk down the signal. We had fun, though it was a bit windy. Travelers need to be warned about the chill factor
Great at sunset. We went on the Citytours bus and took a picnic. Great views of the sea and mountains.

The best sunsets in Cape Town.. A trip to Table Mountain is not complete until you've wtinessed a sunset from Signal Hill. Take food and a bottle of wine if you're going to do this the right way. You will not be disapointed. If you're thining of a proposal of marriage; this is a good place to do it but it may be witnessed by lots of other romantics. As it gets dark, you can watch the lights go on over Camps and Bantry Bay and look over the bay at the large boats drifting on the water - its very serene.
Do this when coming or going to Table Mt. Just opposite the Table Mt. entrance - spend 30 minutes to enjoy a different view of the western and southern side of Capetown.

Cheapest way to see the city. My family did not want to sit in a car all day, so we went up the Lion's head to Signal Hill and enjoyed 360 degrees of sights while we all got to stretch our legs. On a clear day it can't be beat for views. We were also there while a local church group was having a revival so we were serenaded by beautifull voices while enjoying the views.
Nice for sun down. Take a drive up Signal Hill to watch the sun go down and enjoy great view of Cape Town without having to do a strenuous hike.
Visit at sunset. Beautiful vistas of capetown, V&A waterfront and harbour etc at sunset from signal hill. Fantastic photo opps! Can get v cold (in August) when the sun goes down, so be prepared.

great view. It seems all kind of people go up Signal Hill. Local people on a picnic, school classes and tourists in one vibrant mix. The traffic up and down tends to be a little chaotic, but being stuck in your car doen't upset people, the same way it does in e.g. Europe. You smile, wait, talk or smoke and drive on when it's possible. The view from Signal Hill is great.

Good place for sunset. Went up here with the Night Tour which is run by the open top bus sightseeing company. The big difference between here and Table Mountain is that you can drive up! Also, it's nowhere near as high. Even so, it's a relaxing place to sit down and take in the setting sun and the view of the city below. Picnic areas are provided and the night we went, hot drinks were being sold from the back of a van. It was surprisingly cool up there, though, so bring a jacket.

Excellent lookout for the whole cape town region.. The view from signal hill is amazing and worth a visit.Other reviews are suggesting driving up signal hill. Since I'm a sporty person I suggest putting on your running shoes and run up the hill. A good starting point is the car park at the junction to table mountain.The length of the run is about 7 km (including return) and the climb is close to 300m. Make sure you take some water with you and avoid running around noon.
Beautiful View. This will give you a better view of the beauty if Cape Town; the harbor; the Waterfront and Robben Island. You can see quite far up the West coast on a clear day.

Free for all. Signal Hill has a little bit of history to go with it. Its part of the Table Mountain group but isn't as famous except with hikers. The noon gun is still operated there...I never once heard it though, and its one of the best hiking trails in Cape Town. There is a unique view of the harbor from the top of the hill, but you have to take the cable car up Table Mountain to really take in this great view.
Viewpoint No 1. Easy accesible by car, amazing views over Cape Town and a good spot for a picknick. Perfect spot for firsttimers : meet Cape Town
Great view of the city. Offers some decent hiking and has a rest stop type area for picnicers to use facilities. Very pretty view!

full moon hike. must do at full moons, people walk up there and watch the sunset. do not forget a torch to find the way back. and you must not be afraid of real climbing;) if you have not done so far just try, everyone in capetown hikes up there even kids..
Beautiful. Its a lovely place. The tour buses spoil it though. The people that get off of them make too much noise.

Wonderful views. Signal hill is a must see when in Cape Town. Fantastic views of table mountain, twelve apostles and the whole of Cape Town. Go and see it both during th day and the evening. Take some champagne and snacks and watch the sunset

Splendid view. We went up to see the sunset, and were not disappointed. In previous years we have taken a picnic up there and watched the sun go down. However, it is difficult to find a parking space.

great views by day, spectacular by night and it's free. for one of the best freebies in cape town, drive up signal hill by day or even better at sunset. the hill's named after the midday gun that used to provide a time-setting boom for ships in the harbour, and now continues as a tradition but computer controlled instead of being set off by a man lighting a fuse. so you'll gather than the hill overlooks the 'city bowl' the sits between table mountain and the harbour.as the sun dips down, shadown play across the mopuinbtain and then the lights strt flickering on along rods, in houses, shops ands blocks of flats round the seashore and off to the horizon. spectacular!at the far end of the long, winding dead-end road is a car park and picnic spot that overlooks sea point to the west rather than the main downtown area. from there by day you can walk round the hill and enjoy the views. beware of one thing: stop along the road to admire than view and there's a good chance the traffic police will be with you - it's a safety hazard. so pull off where there's a white-lined lay-by or go through to the car park.
Great views.. Great views. Worth going up there to look around and see CT's great location.

nice spot. Signal Hill is a nice spot to go and have nice views of the city. If you cannot visit table mountain due to the weather conditions, just go to the Signal Hill instead. But of course Table mountain is a way better experience and spot, keep in mind.
Great picnic spot. Beautiful views, good amenities and wonderful for kids to play
Lovely views. Nice views of the harbour and city bowl. Pity that once again due to crime there is now a curvue at night when people must leave as high jacking and theft has been a problem..
A Sight Not to Be Missed. the views were just spactacular. The trip up was exciting but a wee bit scary but i loved it
Perfect sunsets and views.... Pick up a bottle of Stellenbosch's finest and watch the sun set over the city. A memorable occasion.

Worthy of the Short Trip up. My stalwart travgel agent in Cape Town (Taste the Cape/Ann-Marie Breen) suggested I not overlook going to the top of Signal Hill. She was right: it provides a unique view not only of the city and harbor, but also of Table Mountan.
Perfect sunset. There is no place better for watching our African sun set! To beautiful for words and amazing views of sea point and R island!
convenient way to view city of Cape Town. This was one of our first ways of seeing Cape Town, give a very good bird's eye view.

Magical Sun Set. There is no better way to set a romantic atmosphere than enjoying the sunset from Signal Hill with a glass of Cap Classique bubbly. The magic is part in the views over Cape Town and part in the buzz of others having sunset picnics around you.

Signal Hill. So named because of teh signal cannon on its slopes, this still fires to mark midday everyday. Fantastic views from the top of the City Bowl and Atlantic Seaboard. Toilets have recently been built on top. Avoid after dark as its isolated and there has been some crime.
Yet another good view. Easy to get to by car. The best views are fro the mountain but that is sometimes closed because of clouds. The noon gun can be a surprise.

Beautiful view of Cape Town. The view from Signal Hill at night is magical. When we went we saw people hiking, having sunset picnics and just enjoying being surrounded by some of the most breathtaking scenery in South Africa. There were police patrolling, and seemed safe.
Great Sunset. Doesnt get much better than this in Cape Town if you love a spectacular sunset.
signal hill. spent a few hr here as part of the night bus tour great point to watch the sun set in the evening
Go for the noon gun salute. Take some earplugs as when the gun goes off it's a hec of a bang and the groung literally shakes

The view without the cable car. Table Mountain may be one of the "must see" attractions, but not everybody can afford going up. Signal Hill is a great alternative to enjoy stunning views of the surrounding area, Table Bay, the City Bowl and Green Point / Sea Point area. Sunset from Signal Hill is beautiful.

The best alternative to Table Mountain. In order to avoid the often long queues to go up to Table Mountain, Signal Hill offers similar spectacular views, with the bonus of viewing Table Mountain as well.
Ringzeremonie. We had our ring ceremony, as the weather has unfortunately not played the game. We would have liked performed on Table Mountain

Good views from Signal hill for sunset. Nice views for sunset! Very easy to find and drive up.
Be sure you go at least 45 min before sunset because i gets quite busy!
Great views. Go and see robben island from an aerial view. take a picnic basket

Beautiful at sunset. you can drive all the way to the top for a breath-taking sunset.
I warn you--its windy though
Photo opportunity. Great place to take photos of Table Mountain and the new football stadium. Toilets are clean and tidy, parking at the top and you can wander round
glass of champagne at top. i went here with my partner and friends and just sat there with a glass of champers, what a scenic view and beautifull surroundings
S-U-N-S-E-T. Hire a taxi with couple or friends (or even yourself), grab a bottle of Pinotage and enjoy a sunset that will never forget!

A must for sundowners. Arguably one of the most spectacular and special places to enjoy sundowners overlooking pretty much everything that Cape Town has to offer. Views of city, Table Mountain, many beaches, Stadium and Atlantic, including Robben Island. Simply have to visit this breathtaking view point of Cape Town.
Option to Table Mountain. Not as impressive as the Table Mountain but if you do not want to queue for hours this is a good option to view Cape Town from above
wonderful views. lovely view of cape town superbowl area and of the atlantic seaboard and Robben Island below. Do visit the Karamat..
Vistas. It is a great sight from a distance, and might imposing up close. The names given to these wonders are apt - and one can only marvel and their splendour.

Great Views. This is a quick and easy drive - so just do it! Great Views of Table Mountain and Lion's head. A great place to watch the Sunset with a glass of Champagne. Also lot's of nice little hikes. Definitely worth the short trip.
Best views in Cape Town. When in town pack a picnic basket and soak in the views Cape Town has to offer. Also on the night of harvest moon it is mesmerising. But enquire about safety, very important!

Historic and Scenic. A short drive to the top of Signal Hill for the less active, or a hike from the surrounds for the more active. Either way the views are wonderful. Lots of trails atop...in fact you can easily hike/run to Lion's Head and do both in a day. You will sleep well that night!

beautiful views. Visiting signal hill is free, gives you gorgeous near-360 views of the city, and is a quick 5 minute drive from within the CBD. You can pack a picnic and take in the view, watching the sun go down and city lights come on. On a good summer's day/evening, it is pretty full with visitors, but if for some reason it's not, and it's fairly desolate, just be very aware of yourself and your belongings as there have been a few incidents/muggings in the past...

Not too hard a climb. Considering the path to the top of Signal Hill is circular, it offers panoramic views of Cape Town from all sides. A leisurely uphill walk takes approximately an hour, but its well worth the effort. Check the weather before setting off, as this can change quite rapidly, enshrouding the hill in mist.
Okay view of the harbor and city. If you have time, drive to Signal Hill. Views are fine but if your time is limited visit Table Mountain instead. Views here are far superior.

Enjoy the sunset from Signal Hill. We booked a 'hop-on, hop-off' bus ticket for two days which includes an evening trip to Signal Hill to watch the sunset. You assemble at 17:30 at the aquarioum stop and you are taken to Signal Hill. It is a popular spot, people take food and wine to watch th sun go down and it is a magic experience when it happens.
Go and just sit there enjoying the view. After a long flight from northern Europe we just sat there for a couple of hours and felt relaxed.
Great Views across Table Bay. Good for walking or even just drivng to the vantage point and admire the views. Popular spot for when ocean yacht races start.

Drive up the mountain. Be careful we were hit by a Hylton Tours bus who could not outmanouvre the tourists who walk on the road
Your hire car company will hit you for the excess even if not your fault.This cost us £385
Fab views. Free views are the best views! take a drive up the long road anf you will be rewarded!

The alternitive Table Mountain. This part of Cape Town is a good view point for those who were unable to go up table mountain due to weather conditions. however, it is not nearly as inpressive. nice to go too, to watch the sun set... but normally crowded and also you have to be careful after dark as there have been people robbed here, alway go with a group.

Great panoramic views of Cpae Town & environs. Well worth a visit, only 15 minutes by car from central Cape Town and an alternative to Table Mountain if time is at a premium. Adequate parking at the top unless you go at a very busy time. I could easily have spent a couple of hours or more admiring the wonderful views.From the main viewing point you look down to Sea Point and Robben Island in the distance. You also get a great view of the new football stadium and to the right the V &A (Waterfront). Also good views of Table Mountain and the beaches sweeping away to the right. It is well worth walking down the road (from where you came up) to get better views of Cape Town city centre and the suburbs out that way.Have a good walk round at the top - lovely views all round and if you have time you can take a path down in the direction of Sea Point - not sure how far it goes. There was an artist painting in oils - quite reasonably priced at c R350 if you want a souvenir. The car guards were a bit of a pain - they do definitely serve a purpose in certain areas of Cape Town but I don't think they are appropriate up here. The hawkers are a bit annoying and I didn't really want my windscreen covered in 'flyers'.However, definitely well worth a visit for an hour or so. My main recommendation would be to walk 100 metres down the road for other views and take some binoculars.

Great alternative when Table Mountain is closed. We visited Signal Hill because Table Mountain was closed due to windy conditions. But we were glad we went. The sunset was splendid and the view to the sea was dreamy. Bring a mat and some wine and you are all set for an unforgettable time.

Picnick with a view. Very nice picnick spot. On nice weather days it gets nerve wracking to drive up as it is chock and block full and the road is narrow. Beautiful spot to picknick. Table Mountain in all its glory on the one side and the ocean and Robben Island on the other side. Doesn't get any better.

Sundowner Spot.. Easy access. Parking readily available. This is a great spot with yet another amazing view of Cape Town and the sea. Grab a bottle of wine, cheese, crackers and some good company and enjoy a sunset on Signal Hill. It gets better, but not by much.Take a jacket, as it can get a little cool and breezy when the sun begins to set.
Awesome veiws of Cape Town. To have an excellent veiw of Robben Island, Cape Town Staduim, Sea Point and the City, a visit to Signal Hill must.

Grab your pullover & camera.... If you have an hour to spare around sunset then take a drive up Signal Hill. Try to get there a bit early as parking does get a bit tight. Bring coffee, drinks, a picnic or just yourself, you'll encounter them all on the hill - some available to buy on site. A very convivial atmosphere to watch the sun come down & some great photo opportunities. Chill, smile, relax or party.
Great views of the City. Great views of Robben Island, the World Cup stadium and the city
The place for views of Table Bay & the Stadium.. Take some binoculars and study the ships in the bay and the harbour and the distant shores of Milnerton and Blouberg and the local Seapoint.
best view for sunset. if you want to see a fantastic sunset go there! It's possible to go by car.

good views of city and seaboard. go late afternoon for sunset and good light. great views over the city, and a nice drive. be careful and security conscious. have incidents up there but there might be security not sure if always there.
good drive. another lovely sunny day and a great drive to the top.Fantastic views over Cape Town .
Beautiful view!. Beautiful view and well worth the short drive from Sea Point, Clifton or Camps Bay
Beautiful place to watch the sun go down!. Beautiful place to watch the sun go down with a glass of champers in your hand!
Go also by night, it's magic..... ....but be sure you are with local guides. It's not safe to be there in the night by you own. Don't leave the car except you are 100% sure you are safe.
A good view. We rode up by car and enjoyed the view. This is not a place where I would recommend spending much time
Great Viewing Point. Great views of Cape Town CBD and Sea Point / Green Point
Breathtaking on the right day. This spot easily acessible by car and without costing you any money can deliver a perfect sunset venue. Watch and listen to Cape Town from above
Exhausted. Walks are now open to the top of Lions Head and well worth the effort. Not for the faint hearted at the very top as climbing using chain supports needed but the view is amazing
Well worth a trip at sunset, beautiful. We were surprised given how busy it was up there how quick and easy it was to get down the mountain again straight aftewards, very well organised!
Sunset View. Its a nice place to see the sun set on land, take a car as its very steep
Great View. The view of Cape Town and Robben island is worth the short drive up the hill
Great views at sunset and at night. This is the place to go at Sunset, and take in the night scene over Cape Town - with Table Mountain on the side. A must do when in Cape Town !
Signal Hill. Excellent views from the top, but a bit rundown in places.
Fantastic views. It is well worth a drive to the top of Signal Hill for the views of Table Mountain, the city bowl and along the coast. Robben Island can also be seen.
Beautiful at sunrise or sunset. There is an easy walkway up to Signal Hill and you will be rewarded with the most beautiful views over Cape Town and the ocean

stunning view of sundown. we went to Signal Hill twice. The first time was as part of the SightSeeing bus tour but sadly it rained that evening and we didn't get to see much. The second time we went the view was lovely. Such a beautiful sunset and you have great views of the City Bowl.
Terrific views. This was not even known to me prior to the trip to the top. But the clouds came in so quickly to block amazing views of Cape Town in 270 degrees.
Cape Town sites. Great views of Cape Town city, the harbour and the sea from high above. every one must try paraglide.

Fascinating. With great views of Cape Town and an interesting talk given by one of the guides, you certainly have to put your hands over your ears for the 12 noon gun shot which can be heard all over the city.
Great view. Easy place to get too, if you have a car & even better if you can make it for 1pm for the gun.
views. views to die for parking good have to be carefull with small road and people walking on it
Great view from Signal Hill. Signal Hill is a great place to view the city if you can't make it up to Table Mountain. Good parking places.

Sunset on Signal Hill. Most certainly worth viewing a sunset from atop here...
We took the trail that led to a beautiful spot from where Lion's head was visible, as well as Robben Island and The upper cableway station on Table Mountain.
The drive up Signal Hill is in itself stunning, but sunset from the top is really beautiful :-)

Most amazing sunset of my life!. Signal Hill is a place to go to watch the sunset. I've taken the most beautiful sunset pictures of my life! The circulation up and down the hill is a bit stiff, but it's worth going through all that trouble!
Excellent views of the the area - Free. The view from here is just about as good as from Table Mountain - and it's free. Parking available at the top and you can walk around freely.
Sunset sunset. Take a picnic basket and bask in the glorious sunset.

Romantic sunset. After a long day shopping at the CT Waterfront, we were advised to take a trip up Signal Hill for a romantic sunset. The ride along the ridge of Lion's head gave us great views of the city. Reaching the top, the 360 degree views were amazing. It was a clear day, so we could see all the way to the furthest mountains. As the sun set over the sea, we sensed the real romance of Cape Town. This is a great way to get oriented to this breath-taking destination.

A great stop. Awesome views of the area, and a great place to stop and take some pictures.Originally planned to go to Table Mountain but due to too many clouds decided to stop here instead and we are happy we did !

Amazing sunset. After a full day of driving the cape of goof hope, we decided last minute to drive up to Signal hill for the sunset. We were not disappointed! It was one of the nicest sunsets I have ever witnessed. The colors over the ocean were amazing and offered many good photo opportunities. If it is a nice day with a few clouds, do not miss it!!!

most special view point in all of Cape Town. Go to Signal Hill if you want a different view of Cape Town. To get there you drive up Kloofnek Road (towards the cable station, just follow the pointers). At the top of the neck, instead of turning left to go to the cable station, rather turn right, towards Signal Hill.On this drive you have an awesome view of the City Bowl. Going around the bend, you see the breathtaking atlantic seaboard. There you can picnic with a bottle of wine etc while watching the sun set.it costs you nothing, one of the really special free things to do in Cape Town.Tip: go about half an hour before sunset, and just experience the magnificent view and ambience. One can also have a great view on Robben Island.This is Africa, so be safe and wary of dodge types, and never go alone, always at least two people.Enjoy it, we love it, we go there all the time!

stunning view and awesome pictures... Go there with a group of friends or just as a couple. Enjoy a Hunters Dry or just a bottle of wine, while enjoying this awesome beautiful view! :) but go a little early to get the best spot and getting the full experience. :)
